Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

What You ll Do
In this position you will play a key role in designing, implementing, and optimizing data infrastructure and pipelines. You should have a deep understanding of data engineering principles, possess excellent programming skills in Python and SQL, and have a strong grasp of modeling concepts.
Who You ll Work With
The Teradata Core Engineering team works with advanced database technologies allowing us to build exciting new features that unlock business value for our customers. As the Sr. Data Integration Engineer, you will report directly to the Technical Lead Data Engineer Design & Development, Data and Analytics, MEA . On our team, you will help to execute a vision that delivers technology-enabled, high-impact business outcomes for our enterprise customer base that meet the highest software quality standards.
What Makes You a Qualified Candidate
1. Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
2. Minimum of 7 years of professional experience in data engineering roles, with a focus on building and optimizing data pipelines and infrastructure.
3. Strong proficiency in Python and SQL, with the ability to write efficient and optimized code.
4. In-depth knowledge of data modeling concepts and experience with implementing and maintaining data models.
5. Solid understanding of ETL processes and frameworks, along with hands-on experience in designing and implementing ETL workflows.
6. Experience with at least one ETL tool, such as IBM DataStage, Talend, or Informatica.
7. Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and different modeling techniques, such as dimensional modeling and data vault.
8. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
What You ll Bring
You are energetic, positive and outgoing. You exercise strong judgement and decision making across all aspects of your role. You re well-organized, detail-oriented and have a consistent track record as a strategic thinker capable of foreseeing impacts of simultaneous projects. You describe yourself as resourceful and have conquered the art of effective multitasking. You have superior time management skills.
Necessary Job Requirements:
Must be based in Cairo, Egypt.
Must be willing to work on-site with clients (Egyptian Government, Telecommunication Operators, and Banks)

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
The Enterprise Architecture team is responsible for ensuring that IT services are integrated, strategic, cohesive and aligned to business need. The Enterprise Architect is responsible for the overall architecture of all technology solutions and owns and manages the Sector's technology
governance processes.

Key Objectives :
Technology Strategy :
• Maintain a Technology Strategy documents to be used as reference for solution architecture and making key architecture decisions.
• Be an advocate and actively engage in designing and implementing project solutions using APIs, Micro-services to be hosted in Cloud platforms and in migrating legacy in-premise hosted applications to Cloud hosting.
• Ability to quickly understand current data structures, including sources, warehouses, lakes and analytics platforms and tooling.
• Knowledge of cloud providers, what technologies they provide, and the use cases they serve, and latest technology trends.
• While leading EA Office, create appropriate “delivery accelerators” to enhance developer productivity and encourage best practices including a measurable increase in application and service agility (reduced time and cost of change)
• Leverage digital best practices to reduce delivery risk and ensure continuous reductions of technical debt. Maintain current knowledge of industry trends and tools to provide best practice insight and best-in-class recommendations
• Own the Roadmap – the multi-year plan for developing the firm’s technology blueprint to meet business goals as understood and foreseen. The Roadmap includes target-state, interim states, and projected costs at each step
• Lead and shape architecture blueprints and roadmaps to advance CBO’s transformation priorities.
• Ensure that all components as well as their usage are consistent and in compliance with all applicable regulatory, IT, and corporate standards and policies.

Design Controls Adherence
• Support DevOps teams to track the compliance of architecture controls across all the business lines and actively support adoption of Decision Driven Design process.

Communicate
• Pro-actively communicate the adherence to architecture process, design standards, design patterns, principles in accordance to appropriate design authority governance Best Practice
• Ensure that architecture deliverables are compliant with the stated requirements, approved technologies, best practices and group strategies

Compliance
• Ensure compliance with internal and external technology standards and regulatory obligations.
• Knowledge of the regulatory environment applicable to data used within financial services. This includes data legislation both existing and proposed, and the approach and views of the local regulators.
• Experience of data governance as applied in a data management at an enterprise scale.

Risk Management
• Maintain awareness of operational risk including its identification, assessment, mitigation and control, loss identification and reporting in accordance with the Group Operations FIM.

Self-Learning
• Develop proficiency in understanding of the Architecture Practice , Design Frameworks , tooling and strategies Desired Candidate Profile
Education & Experience:
• B.S. and / or M.S. degree in Computer Science or equivalent
• 10-12 years of relevant system development, or design experience in delivery role in financial services environment
• Experience in the execution of high impact, enterprise wide, strategic programs or initiatives
• Working knowledge of a fully integrated IT environment
• Experience with the architecture of mission critical, high transaction volume environments
• Experience with the full software development life-cycle using traditional and agile methodologies.
• Experience with maintaining legacy technology environments, the strategy and architecture requirements that accompany that environment and specific experience in the use of API based architecture and integration/collaboration
• Experience in leading architecture in a modern data centric business that is complex, in relation to data tools

Mandatory professional qualifications or licenses:
Knowledge of multiple technologies including (but not limited to): C#, VB, .NET, ASP.Net, Java, and Enterprise Integrations (middleware, ETL, API etc.)

Technical Skill Set Required:
• Proven track record in pragmatic architectural/technical design in financial business systems as well as solid software development experience
• Deep understanding of Web Technologies and Service and Integration solutions - knowledge of Mobile and Tablet technology a plus
• Good understanding of usage of APIs, Micro-services.
• Good understanding of migrating and implementing Cloud based solutions.
• Track record of delivery under diversified/matrix team structure
• Sound appreciation of the full software development life cycle, including release management
• Excellent understanding of System Development Life Cycles (SDLC) both Waterfall and Agile
• Working within a large, complex and geographically dispersed organization with multi-disciplinary and multicultural diverse work environments
• Evidence of strategic leadership and management balancing personal and authentic leadership style which educates, inspires, and motivates teams and fosters community amongst disparate practice members

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

We are seeking a talented Data Scientist to join our team. As a Data Scientist, you will play a key role in leveraging data to drive business insights and support data-driven decision-making. Your expertise in statistical analysis, machine learning, and data visualization will be crucial in analyzing complex datasets, developing predictive models, and generating actionable recommendations for our organization's BI initiatives.
Job Duties:
• Conduct advanced data analysis and modeling to identify trends and patterns in large datasets.
• Collaborate with the data team to define data requirements and formulate analytical approaches.
• Develop and implement machine learning algorithms and predictive models to solve business problems.
• Apply statistical techniques to analyze data and derive meaningful insights.
• Design and develop data visualizations and dashboards to present analytical findings.
• Work with stakeholders to understand business needs and formulate data-driven solutions.
• Utilize data mining techniques to discover relationships and opportunities in data.
• Build and maintain data pipelines to support data analysis and modeling processes.
• Validate and interpret the accuracy and performance of predictive models.
• Explore and apply new data science tools and techniques to improve BI capabilities.
• Collaborate with data engineers to ensure data quality and consistency.
• Communicate complex findings and technical concepts to non-technical audiences effectively.
• Support the BI team in data-driven decision-making through insights and recommendations.
• Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation using data science techniques.
• Conduct A/B testing and experiments to optimize business strategies.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams on data-related projects.
• Assist in defining key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics for measuring business performance.
• Participate in data governance and data quality initiatives.
• Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science and BI technologies.
• Mentor and provide guidance to junior data analysts or data team members. Desired Candidate Profile

Education:
Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics.
Years of Experience
• Minimum 3 years of work experience in this field.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Position Summary
Location
Cairo
Senior Cloud Data Platform Engineer, Cairo, Egypt
Connect to your career at Deloitte
Deloitte drives progress. Using our vast range of expertise, that covers audit, risk advisory, and consulting services across tax, legal, business, technology, and corporate finance, we help our clients become leaders wherever they choose to compete. To do this, we invest in outstanding people. We build teams of future thinkers, with diverse talents and backgrounds, and empower them all to reach for and achieve more.
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for measurable impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.
Connect to your opportunity
Our people work in a variety of projects to solve clients' toughest data problems by combining industry experience, consulting, and analytical skills to create a lasting impact. Our projects and clients vary greatly, and your responsibilities will differ based on your level of experience/skillset and the focus of the client engagement, your role is likely to include some or all the following:
• Placing a focus upon exceeding client expectations and delivering against our continuous improvement goals, taking a client problem, and turning it into a technical solution
• Data Ingestion: Design, implement, and manage data ingestion pipelines to collect and ingest data from various sources into the cloud data platform. This might involve using tools like Apache Kafka, AWS Kinesis, or Azure Event Hubs.
• Data Transformation: Develop and maintain data transformation processes to clean, enrich, and structure data for analytics and reporting purposes. This often involves using ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tools or scripting languages like Python.
• Data Integration: Integrate different data sources and systems to ensure data consistency and accessibility. This may involve setting up data connectors or APIs.
• Data Security: Implement and enforce data security measures, including encryption, access controls, and compliance with data privacy regulations such as GDPR or HIPAA.
• Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize the performance of the cloud data platform to ensure efficient data processing and query performance. This may involve adjusting configurations, indexing, and caching.
• Automation and Orchestration: Create and maintain automation scripts and workflows to manage data pipelines, backups, and routine tasks. Infrastructure as Code (IAC) tools like Terraform or AWS CloudFormation may be used.
• Monitoring and Alerting: Set up monitoring and alerting systems to proactively identify and address issues with data pipelines, platform health, and data quality. Tools like Prometheus, Grafana, or cloud-native monitoring solutions can be employed.
• Documentation and Collaboration: Document data platform architecture, processes, and best practices. Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and other stakeholders to understand their requirements and ensure the data platform meets their needs.
Connect to your skills and professional experience
As a Senior Cloud Data Platform Engineer, you will have the following responsibilities:
• Lead a small team of data platform engineers in the design, development, and implementation of data engineering solutions.
• Gather requirements from stakeholders and translate them into technical specifications.
• Design and implement data pipelines to collect, transform, and load data into data warehouses and data lakes.
• Maintain and optimize data systems to ensure high availability and performance.
• Work with other engineering teams to integrate data engineering solutions with other systems.
• Stay up to date on the latest data engineering technologies and trends.
• Assists with the data platform blueprint and design, encompassing the relevant data platform components.
• Collaborates with the Integration Architects and Data Architects to ensure cohesive integration between systems and data models.
• High degree of (hands-on) technical guidance & vision with broad subject matter expertise in cloud, data and security technologies, specifically AWS, Azure, GCP, Oracle, and SIEM platforms (Splunk ES and Sentinel)
• Experience with Terraform
• Extensive experience and expertise across the Splunk platform, its architecture and distributed components including premium apps (ITSI, Enterprise Security, Phantom, etc )
• Experience with data streaming technologies
• Experience of agile methodologies and associated toolsets and code repositories
• Coding experience using languages such as Python and/or Bash
• Experience working with CI/CD, Infrastructure-as-Code, and other automation tools
• Strong collaboration and stakeholder engagement skills
• Self-motivated and organised person
• High level of attention to detail, the ability to think architecturally at big picture and able to translate this into practical implementation

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Lab Machine Interfacing Developer in a software company focused on healthcare software like HIS (Hospital Information System), EMR (Electronic Medical Records), and LIS (Laboratory Information System) in Dubai, your role would involve designing, developing, and maintaining interfaces between various laboratory machines and the healthcare software systems. Here's a detailed job description for this position:

Job Title: Lab Machine Interfacing Developer

Job Description:
As a Lab Machine Interfacing Developer, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between laboratory equipment and healthcare software systems. Your primary responsibilities will include:
1.Interface Design: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand the requirements for interfacing laboratory machines with the healthcare software systems. Design interfaces that enable seamless data exchange and integration.
2.Software Development: Develop software solutions and modules responsible for connecting and communicating with laboratory machines. This may involve programming in languages such as Java, C++, or Python, depending on the technology stack used.
3.Integration Testing: Conduct thorough testing to ensure the reliability, accuracy, and security of data transfer between laboratory machines and the software systems. Debug and resolve any issues that arise during testing.
4.Compliance: Ensure that the interfaces comply with relevant healthcare standards and regulations, such as HL7 and DICOM, to maintain data integrity and patient safety.
5.Documentation: Create detailed documentation for interface specifications, configuration, and troubleshooting guides for end-users and support teams.
6.Maintenance and Support: Provide ongoing support to ensure the smooth operation of the interfaces. Address any issues, perform updates, and make enhancements as needed.
7.Collaboration: Collaborate with laboratory technicians, software developers, and healthcare professionals to gather feedback and continuously improve the interface solutions.
8.Security: Implement robust security measures to protect sensitive patient data during data transfer and storage. Desired Candidate Profile
§ Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
§ Strong programming skills in languages like Java, C++, or Python.
§ Knowledge of healthcare standards and protocols such as HL7 and DICOM.
§ Familiarity with laboratory equipment and their data communication protocols.
§ Experience in software development and integration projects, preferably in the healthcare domain.
§ Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills.
§ Strong communication and teamwork abilities.

Preferred Skills:
§ Knowledge of healthcare software systems like HIS, EMR, and LIS.
§ Experience with database management systems.
§ Understanding of network protocols and security measures.
§ Certification in relevant healthcare IT standards (e.g., HL7 certification).

This role is critical in ensuring the efficient and accurate exchange of data between laboratory machines and healthcare software, ultimately contributing to better patient care and data management within the healthcare organization.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
ob Purpose
To implement the IMS policies and procedures of Enova across all the projects through conducting health, safety environment, energy and quality inspections in the assigned project/ geography and participating in risk assessments and incident investigation in order to ensure the timely and accurate identification and reporting of non-compliance against relevant policies, processes, standards and customers’ requirements and guidelines. Ensure welfare and wellbeing of our workforce are respected and continuously improved on sites and accommodation. Be the main point of contact between site operation and HSEQ department, provide support as per international and company standards as well as local regulations.
Key Accountabilities
Strategy Contribution and Implementation
Contribute to the development of the HSEQ departmental strategy and ensure effective cascading of departmental strategy into policies and procedures in line with the overall business objectives of the organizations and his / her geographical area specificities.
Contribute to continuously improve Enova Integrated Management System toward Best Practices for all department
People Management
Manage the effective achievement of objectives through setting individual objectives, managing performance, developing, training, and motivating staff, provide regular formal / informal feedback as well as appraisal in order to ensure team’s best performance
Functionally manage all HSEQ related matter and person in Enova’s geographical scope, coordinate with Operation, support services and corporate HSEQ guidelines
IMS Compliance and Systems
Ensure compliance with all relevant IMS procedures, standards, customers’ requirements, and guidelines across Enova projects to guarantee employee health and safety, quality, and compliance with environmental, energy, Facility Management and Asset Management certification requirements, and a responsible environmental attitude
Support in implementation of company accreditation system 9001, 14001, 27001, 41001, 45001, 50001 and 50001 to ensure all the required documents and systems are in place to enable efficient HSEQ operations and all other systems / certifications applicable to the company.
Assist in the implementation and maintenance of the HSEEQ system used within Enova, and keep the line manage informed about any issues or recommendations to improve performance, in order to ensure the system is operating as per desired efficiency and results.
Ensure compliance of all activities as per Permit to Work issued.
Ensure client requirement are clearly identified, and level of compliance is always maintained onsite.
Monthly Performance report updated per site with HSEQ requirement.
Communicate system update on site, incident & accident update; HSEQ weekly communication to all staffs on sites.
Risk Assessments
Assist the line manager in implementing techniques and other analyses, as required to assess HSEQ risks identifying and prevent non-compliances that may lead to significant losses.
Ensure actions are properly taken to control any identified risk in a safe and sustainable manners.
Raise any Stop Work Card and non-conformities in case of any non-compliance against Risk Assessment and Method Statement on site.
Ensure Subcontractors Risk Assessment are reviewed and appropriate for each given task prior start of the work. Support on improving Risk Assessment in regards of site risk specific.
Inspections & Internal Audit
Perform inspections of all work sites and projects in the assigned area of operation, to ensure compliance with relevant standards, customers’ requirements and guidelines and identify non-compliance, unsafe practices, and conditions
Investigate all incidents in the assigned area of operations under the guidance of his / her HSE line Manager and follow-up on the action plans as agreed by the line manager to ensure timely resolution of incidents
Support for internal audits at sites, as applicable (Enova, Client, or external)
Training and Awareness
Ensure First day site inductions and refresher are provided to all employees on-site.
Keep aware of the IMS related policies, procedures, standards, checklists and guidelines, customers’ requirements and guidelines and ensure creating of awareness on these standards, across the Company, thus improving compliance
Assist in the provision of training and awareness on the IMS policies, procedures and guidelines and preparation of the relevant training material, to ensure creation of awareness on the related standards
Ensure third party training record are maintained on site as per local regulation and company best practices as but not limited to: First Aid, Fire fighter, MEWP licenses, scaffold inspector, etc.
Internal and External Relations
Develop a working relationship with authorities and assist in identifying areas for service improvement
Coordinate with the customers in the assigned area of operations, to understand their HSEQ requirements, standards, and guidelines, and ensure they are implemented accordingly
Coordinate, manage and inspect activities of subcontractors. Review documentations prior to start of the activities, ensure compliance to HSEQ standards at the start of each activity, and stop the work if necessary.
Policies, Systems, Processes & Procedures
Follow all relevant departmental policies, processes, standard operating procedures, and instructions so that work is carried out in a controlled and consistent manner.
Identify obsolete procedures, process, and format on site, communicate to Head office and support on continuously improving IMS documentation system.
Ensure all records are properly recorded on site and available upon demands during internal and external audits / inspections.
Statements and Reports
Assist in the preparation of timely and accurate sectional statements and reports to meet and department requirements, policies, and standards.
Prepare regular reports on non-compliances, risk and impact assessments, audits and breaches and submit it to the line manager to enable suitable actions to be taken
Provide Root cause on Non-compliance, near miss, unsafe act, or conditions as necessary as per the project requirement to ensure non reoccurrence.
Integrated Management System
Ensure all relevant quality, health, safety, environmental, Energy, Asset Management, Facility Management & Data Management procedures, instructions and controls are adhered to so that the safety of employees, quality of products/services and environmental compliance can be guaranteed.
Related Assignments
Perform other related duties or assignments as directed.
Activities may require night duty as per the requirement of the project.
Activities may require travel to multiple location across the country as per requirement of his / her scope. Desired Candidate Profile
Qualification, Experience & Skills
Bachelor's degree in Engineering is preferred
Preferably training or professional certification such as NEBOSH IGC
10-12 years of experience within HSEQ working environment
Ability to carry out risk and incidents assessments, inspection, and audit
Inspection of technical and/ or construction activities
Able to manage subcontractor on site and liaise with operation in charge
Database management and record keeping skills
Ability to exhibit a high level of confidentiality
Ability to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner
Team working skills, risk management skills, high attention to detail, communication skills, analytical skills
Emergency Management, Investigation and rootcause analysis
Ability to Multitask and prioritizing
Good level of English communication and writing skill
Good level of Arabic communication and writing skill
Preferably holder of a valid driving License within the country
Preferably holder of third-party certificates, such as Fire Fighter, First Aiders, Scaffold inspectors, etc.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Product Planning
Lead the development of product lines for the company starting with ladies’ wear and then moving on to Men’s and kid’s wear.
Develop and maintain relationships with vendors and suppliers.
Follow the production process from ideation to shipment.
Maintain measurement charts with required grading based on size range and create tech packs.
Release PO to vendors once the price is negotiated and confirmed.
Ensure trims are ordered on time.
Ensure all packaging materials are ordered and available in stock.
Maintain product description and master sheet.
Maintain trackers: Sampling tracker, Production tracker, and shipment tracker.
Monitor production timelines and ensure that all products are delivered on time and to the best quality standards.
Generate Barcode and SKU numbers.
Once a shipment is received bifurcate the collection by categories and styles.
Come up with creative names to label the collections and themes.
Be involved in quality control from the fit approval stage to the final inspection.
Co-ordinate with warehouse for shipment of products to customers.
Analyze and evaluate the current product line and suggest improvements and changes.
Analyze inventory intelligent reports i.e. fast movers, slow movers, product demand trends, category demand trends, etc.
Plan strategies to increase revenues for every product category, new product launch, fast mover, and slow mover along with the marketing team.
Monitor market trends and customer feedback to ensure product lines remain relevant and competitive in the marketplace.
Research and source new materials and fabrics as needed.
Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure the successful launch of new products.

Vendor Management
Develop an adequate vendor base for the concept through active scouting and negotiation/renegotiation.
Build and maintain relationships with vendors and suppliers and negotiate the best deals with them for procuring merchandise.
Maintain contact with vendors; update list of vendors for bidding purposes; attend product demonstrations, obtain samples and literature regarding potential products and vendor capabilities, and confer with end users.
Identify, evaluate, and select appropriate vendor mix to achieve business objectives.
Evaluate the performance of suppliers and manufacturers as per their product quality and delivery timelines.
Identify and leverage alternate buying opportunities to source products and ensure that the company maintains its competitive edge by constant renegotiation.

Buying Budget and Planning
Determine buying requirements and formulate a buying plan and budget for the assigned department/category.
Keep abreast of the latest trends in buying and discuss the same with Design and Management from time to time to assess the realignment of existing processes.
Map competition prices/products and provide qualitative inputs to the business.
Manage OTB and align the buying plan to the overall department/category business plan and the merchandise strategy as laid down by the Management.
Help meet the profit targets by ensuring timely procurement of the department/category Merchandise.
Pursue cost reduction measures through centralized bulk buying and/ or selecting appropriate vendor mix, scanning the environment for benchmarks and constantly improving the purchase process.
Implement financial and credit services agreements with the vendor that maximize profit and positively contribute to cash flow.
Track the merchandise transportation from supplier to warehouse and ensure a smooth flow of goods.
Follow the reverse logistics guidelines to send the faulty/damaged goods back to the vendor.

Market Place Management
Product data management.
Image drive management.
Marketplace sales management.
New product upload.
Contract update and renewal of new and existing marketplaces.
Costing and MRP/promotion management for the various marketplaces.
Generate Facebook codes.
Warehouse co-ordination.
Ensure the value of products and product features are communicated in the best possible ways to the customer. Desired Candidate Profile
8+ years of relevant experience of which at least 6 years should have been in the fashion retail industry
Good Knowledge of Buying and Production processes
Planning and organizing skills
Excellent Analytical skills
Good interpersonal skills Good Negotiation skill
Go-getter attitude.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking to recruit an experienced Parts Inventory Control Executive (UAE National) to join our FAMCO team based in Dubai. The main purpose of the role is to provide the required availability and supply speed for parts, pertaining to the franchises assigned, while keeping the stock value and obsolescence within the required limits, under the direction of the Parts Product Manager
What you will do:
Stock Control
Monitor and set appropriate system parameters in consultation with the Inventory Control Manager.
Scrutinize order proposals produced from the computer system and make appropriate amendments in consultation with the Inventory Control Manager.
Parts Availability
Scrutinize the daily critical reports and take action.
Study back-order report and expedite with the principals for early delivery.
Management of Customer Orders- VOR, Urgent and Normal orders
Process customer orders on time.
Obtain expected arrival dates and inform the sales persons so that feedback can be given to the customers
Follow-up back orders with principals for early allocation.
Expedite goods in transit with the logistics service providers for speedy delivery.
Stock Aging and Obsolescence Control
Follow up sales of parts that are in sales-order stock before they become non-moving
Study stock aging reports to expedite sales of slow-moving parts.
Process dead stock reports at regular intervals so as to maintain a healthy inventory.
Expedite with principals for buy-back of non-moving parts and process buyback so that such parts are returned on time.
Management of Logistics Costs
Ensure that the import costs are minimized by using cost effective means of transport- express, air-consolidation, sea freight etc.
Identify and use logistics service providers who offer good rates.
Consolidate customer orders appropriately to reduce the number of consignments.
Claims Management
Process claims on time to reduce claims in process.
Expedite claims with principals to ensure that the claims are reimbursed by the principals on time. Justify the claims with appropriate evidence to minimize rejections.
Data Management
Ensure accurate article master data by timely updating.
Ensure updating of the supplier prices so that the system always has the current purchase price. Desired Candidate Profile
Required skills to be successful:
Communication: Needs to have the ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbal and written.
Relationship building: Needs to have the ability to build and maintain friendly, warm relationships or networks of contacts with the principals.
Interpersonal Understanding: Needs to understand other people and have cross-cultural sensitivity.
Flexibility: Should have the ability to adapt to and work effectively with a variety of situations, individuals or groups. Needs to understand and appreciate different opposing perspectives on an issue, to adapt an approach as the requirements of a situation change.
About the team:
Working in a fast-paced and diverse environment, and reporting directly to the Parts Material & Inventory Manager
What equips you for the role:
Engineering Graduate/ Diploma holder in a technical field.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Looking for Qualified HR Recruiter to manage every phase of our recruitment efforts, from the identification of potential candidates to the interview and evaluation of candidates. The HR recruiter will be liaising with management to understand staffing needs and will execute plans to find qualified candidates to fulfil mandates.

Job Responsibilities
Designing and updating job descriptions
Crafting emails for attracting passive candidates
Sourcing potential candidates using various online platforms (e.g. Linkedin & Naukri Gulf)
Screening incoming resumes as well as application forms
Interviewing candidates via various mediums (e.g. in-person, phone, video)
Preparing and distributing assignments as well as language, logical reasoning, and numerical tests if required.
Advertising jobs on careers pages, job boards and social media
Providing contacts of qualified applicants to the company’s Hiring Managers
Monitoring HR metrics (e.g. source of hire, time-to-hire, and time-to-fill, etc.)
Hosting recruitment events and participating in job fairs
Collaborating with management for identifying future staffing needs
Providing guidance and consultancy to new recruits and also helping them onboard
Co-ordinating with various Recruitment consultants for our hiring requirements.
Maintaining HR Data Management process & Handling Recruitment Trackers.
Assisting the HR Ops team to send job offers and recruiting emails, and also answering queries related to compensation and benefits. Desired Candidate Profile
At least a Bachelor’s Or Master's degree in Human Resources Management or a relevant field
Minimum 2+ yrs of Prior experience as an HR Recruiter.
Sound knowledge of all HR processes (e.g. recruitment, onboarding, training, talent management etc.)
Sound knowledge of all Labor Laws & Regulations
Experience with resume databases, ATS, and referral programs
Sound knowledge of full-cycle recruiting
Strong verbal as well as non-verbal communication skills
Exceptional time-management and organizational skill.
Energetic & Positive Thinking, Problem Solving capabilities, Ability to manage stressful situations
Never Give-up Attitude is a Must!

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
The position ensures the achievement of budgeted revenue, profit and customer growth goals. The outputs are executing exceptional delivery service and on target results within the financial budgets set up by the company. The role through the route team ensures the effective delivery of the company’s products and services to maximize customer satisfaction and retention which generates sales and profits for the company. The position must analyze and monitor route activities and results, develop and implement alternative plans as needed, measure and monitor revenue & profitability levels, take corrective action as required, evaluate the market for opportunities to grow revenue

ESSENTIAL ACCOUNTABILITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Set and communicate clear goals and sales targets with sales team.
Coach, communicate, motivate, and support route teams in their achievement of route targets.
Manages employee performance to ensure customer base goals are achieved. Maximizing revenue and profit from existing customers, protection of company assets and safety.
Planning and executing assigned coverage/route plan.
Ensuring vehicles are utilized in a cost-effective manner (minimize driving time and maximize delivery time) exceeding the specific distribution & service demands of our customers
.Conduct regular market surveys to determine existing route plan efficiency and enhance as necessary.
Maintaining accurate and to-date records (customer base data management)
. Respond and resolve customer issues in a timely and appropriate manner.
Continually seek additional revenue opportunities with existing and potential new customers
. Careful monitoring of KPI’s (capacity, cost per bottle, failure rates and volume per customer)
. Ensure collections are done in a proper timely manner.
Conduct daily market visits to assess the adequacy of the sales and distribution network, study market trends and activities.
Conduct daily assessment of sales and distribution by meeting the sales team
. Report to management any change to current market situation and information on competitor’s activities in order to generate ideas to increase sales & distribution.
Daily, weekly, monthly and annual budgeting and planning for route teams Desired Candidate Profile
• Degree educated or relevant experience
• 2+ years of experience in Route Management
• 2+ years of experience in Revenue and Cost Management Experience
• Working knowledge with Microsoft Office suite.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Customer Service Executive at Urban Oak, you will be responsible for providing exceptional customer support to online shoppers of our furniture products. You will serve as the primary point of contact for customers, addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring their satisfaction with our products and services.

· Customer Support: Respond promptly and professionally to customer inquiries via phone, email, chat, or social media platforms.
· Product Knowledge: Develop a deep understanding of our furniture product catalog to assist customers in selecting the right items and answering product-related questions.
· Order Management: Process and track customer orders, ensuring accurate and timely delivery. Address any order-related issues or changes.
· Issue Resolution: Investigate and resolve customer complaints, concerns, and issues, aiming for a quick and satisfactory resolution.
· Technical Support: Assist customers with any technical difficulties related to the website, payment processing, or other online shopping issues.
· Communication: Communicate with customers proactively, providing updates on order status, delivery schedules, and any relevant promotions or discounts.
· Feedback Collection: Gather and document customer feedback and suggestions to help improve our products and services.
· Data Management: Maintain accurate customer records and order histories in the company's CRM system.
· Team Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments such as logistics, sales, and marketing to ensure a seamless customer experience. Desired Candidate Profile

· A bachelor's degree.
· Proven customer service experience, ideally in an online retail or e-commerce environment.
· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
· Aggressive sales skills and ability to convert enquiries
· Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
· Proficiency in using customer service software and CRM systems.
· Ability to remain calm and professional under pressure.
· Familiarity with furniture products and industry trends is an advantage.

Work timing -
This role typically involves working in Urban Oak Musaffah office or remote setting, with occasional weekend or evening shifts to accommodate customer needs. It may also require sitting for extended periods and using a computer for most of the day.
Salary and perks:
Basic salary of aed 3000.
Additional incentives based on sales conversions.
Accommodation provided in the neighboring premises. Hence transport to and work not a concern.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
We are currently looking for a Parts Advisor to work for Toyota Dubai – Al Badia Service Center. This role is the representation of the brand & parts division to the customer and maintains customer relations to ensure an end-to-end engaged customer journey in part operation (retail counter and workshop), that leads to parts supply and revenue achievement & customer retention.
What you will do
Achieve financial objectives by upselling, discount control and promote accessories to meet monthly revenue targets.
Enhance customer retention through consultation on customer needs & parts requirements, as per recommended maintenance schedule, to ensure long-term relationship with the customers.
Coordinate with the Job controllers and Service Advisors on status of parts, its availability, quotation, order/arrival and ensure timely progress update of Vehicle to customers and to maintain the on-time-delivery commitment.
Active compliance to all Standard Operating Procedures, Company policies & Distributor Programs to ensure consistency in the customer experience.
Ensure open and closure of sale order/reservations to optimise stock level & revenue & mitigate the risk of financial loss on a daily basis
Ensure accurate information capture of customer details on SAP for effective customer data management.
Required skills to be successful
Spare parts sales experience in the automotive industry
Good sales and customer service experience
Knowledge with parts catalogue
Good systems knowledge preferably with SAP
About the team
The Part Advisor is the most critical contributor to parts operation for supply of all parts as per customer and workshop demands of the branch and needs to demonstrate an extremely high level of relationship between all stakeholders to deliver exceptional customer experience. This position directly interacts with Customers, Service Advisor, Parts Supervisor, Job Controller, Technicians and Workshop Manager. Desired Candidate Profile
Possess a good general level of Technical Education, Diploma, Bachelors or Automotive Engineering Degree
Minimum of 2-3 years’ experience within spare parts operations, preferably at an automotive parts sales counter, familiarity with safety standards during work for people, machines and material
Ability to speak, write and read English to deal with supervisors and customers
Working knowledge of MS office, SAP knowledge preferred
Proficient with Electronic Parts Catalogue (EPC)
Has good product and process knowledge

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Market Analysis and Strategy Development: Leverage your extensive experience to analyze the fresh fruits & vegetable market in the Sultanate of Oman, including trends, consumer preferences, and competitive landscape.
Develop strategic plans to optimize new and existing business opportunities, ensuring sustainable growth for the region.
Identify potential areas for diversification and expansion, aligning with the company's overall objectives.
Client Relationship Management: Utilize your robust network of customers/clients and established relationships with HORECA customers, retailers, QSRs, airline catering, and industrial caterers to drive business growth.
Engage with key stakeholders to maintain and expand partnerships, fostering long-term relationships and promoting mutual value.
Act as a point of contact for clients, addressing their needs, inquiries, and concerns effectively.
Business-to-Business Sales and P&L Management: Apply your extensive business-to-business sales experience to drive revenue growth and achieve sales volume targets for fresh fruits and vegetables.
Manage the Profit and Loss (P&L) for the assigned territories, ensuring profitability while adhering to budgetary constraints.
Negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms with clients, maximizing profitability and maintaining competitive positioning.
Market Insights and Product Knowledge: Leverage your thorough knowledge of the market, competitors, and products to make informed decisions and tailor strategies to market demands.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, technological advancements, and regulatory changes that could impact the fresh fruits & vegetable business.
Budgeting and Target Achievement: Take ownership of budget control and target achievement, effectively managing resources to meet financial goals.
Develop forecasts and sales plans, aligning them with broader organizational objectives.
Partnership Cultivation: Cultivate and nurture long-term partnerships with targeted accounts, driving increased sales, improved margins, and enhanced customer loyalty.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless execution of partnership initiatives.
Operational Excellence: Utilize your knowledge of fresh fruits & vegetable operations to streamline processes, enhance operational efficiency, and optimize supply chain management.
Collaborate with operations teams to ensure timely and quality delivery of products to clients.
Enterprise Software Solutions: Leverage your hands-on experience with enterprise software solutions to optimize sales processes, data management, and reporting.
Communication and Language Skills: Utilize your fluency in both Arabic and English to effectively communicate with clients, colleagues, and stakeholders.
Leadership and Development: Provide mentorship and guidance to junior team members, sharing insights and best practices to support their professional growth.
Lead by example, embodying the company's values and fostering a culture of excellence.
Ship Chandelling Expertise: Utilize your ship chandelling work experience, if applicable, to enhance the company's offerings and services to maritime clients.
GCC Driver's License Requirement: Ensure compliance with the GCC Driver's license requirement for mobility within the region. Desired Candidate Profile
10+ years of experience in developing fresh fruits & vegetable business in Sultanate of Oman and other GCC markets by interacting with leading retailers, wholesalers, supermarkets, major hotels, caterers etc.
Expertise in optimizing new and existing business opportunities to ensure business growth for the region.
Thorough knowledge of the market, competitors and products.
Strong network of customers /clients and good relationships with retailers, wholesalers, supermarkets, caterers and hotels.
Business-to-business sales experience; strong general business capabilities and P&L management.
Knowledge of F&V operations and business development.
Ability to control the budget & target.
Cultivate long-term partnerships with targeted accounts, leading to increased sales and margins.
Achieve F&V sales volume, revenue, and profitability goals for the assigned territories.
Ship chandelling work experience is an added advantage.
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or related field, or equivalent work experience.
Hands on experience with enterprise software solutions.
Fluency in both Arabic & English language communication.
GCC Driver’s license is mandatory.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
As an AI/ML Engineer with expertise in Azure Analytics, GPT, and LLM technologies, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and implementing AI-driven solutions to address complex challenges in our organization. Your primary responsibilities will include:
1. Solution Design and Development:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and opportunities for AI/ML applications.
Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and algorithms using Azure Analytics, GPT, and LLM technologies to address specific business problems.
2. Data Processing and Analysis:
Work with large datasets to pre process, clean, and transform data into usable formats for model training.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to gain insights and identify patterns in data.
3. Model Training and Optimization:
Utilize your expertise in GPT and LLM technologies to fine-tune and train natural language processing models.
Optimize machine learning models for accuracy, performance, and scalability.
4. Deployment and Integration:
Deploy AI/ML models into production environments, ensuring seamless integration with existing systems and applications.
Monitor model performance and make necessary adjustments to maintain optimal functionality.
5. Evaluation and Testing:
Develop and implement rigorous testing procedures to validate the accuracy and reliability of AI/ML models.
Continuously assess model performance and make improvements as needed.
6. Documentation:
Maintain detailed documentation of AI/ML solutions, including code, algorithms, and model architectures.
Create user-friendly documentation to facilitate knowledge transfer within the organization.
7. Research and Innovation:
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI/ML, Azure Analytics, GPT, and LLM technologies.
Contribute to the organization's innovation efforts by exploring and proposing new AI-driven solutions. Desired Candidate Profile
Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as an AI/ML Engineer with a deep understanding of Azure Analytics.
Extensive experience working with GPT and LLM technologies.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms, data structures, and data modeling.
Experience with cloud platforms, particularly Microsoft Azure.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work on complex, unstructured problems.
Strong communication and teamwork skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
A commitment to staying updated on emerging trends and technologies in AI and ML.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Requisition Number:
216967
External Description:
What You ll Do
In this position you will be responsible for designing and implementing data models that supports the customer organization's data-driven initiatives. You will collaborate closely with data engineers, data architects, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements, analyze data sources, and create effective and efficient data models. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in data modeling, possess excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, and be proficient in SQL and data modeling tools. You will be instrumental in shaping the data infrastructure and ensuring integrity, accuracy, and accessibility of our data assets.
Who You ll Work With
The Teradata Core Engineering team works with advanced database technologies allowing us to build exciting new features that unlock business value for our customers. As the Sr. Data Modeler, you will report directly to the Technical Lead Data Engineer Design & Development, Data and Analytics, MEA . On our team, you will help to execute a vision that delivers technology-enabled, high-impact business outcomes for our enterprise customer base that meet the highest software quality standards.
What Makes You a Qualified Candidate
1. Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
2. Minimum of 7 years of experience as a Data Modeler, Data Architect, or similar role.
3. In-depth knowledge of data modeling concepts and techniques, including dimensional modeling, data vault, and relational modeling.
4. Proficiency in SQL and experience with data modeling tools such as ERwin, ER/Studio, or another similar tool.
5. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into effective data models.
6. Experience with data warehousing concepts and technologies.
7. Experience with data profiling and data quality management.
8. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
9. Knowledge of industry best practices and emerging trends in data modeling and data management.
What You ll Bring
You are energetic, positive and outgoing. You exercise strong judgement and decision making across all aspects of your role. You re well-organized, detail-oriented and have a consistent track record as a strategic thinker capable of foreseeing impacts of simultaneous projects. You describe yourself as resourceful and have conquered the art of effective multitasking. You have superior time management skills.
Necessary Job Requirements:
Must be a native Arabic speaker.
Must be based in Cairo, Egypt.
Must be willing to work on-site with clients (Egyptian Government, Telecommunication Operators, and Banks) 100% of the time.
Must pass security clearance to work with the Egyptian Government.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB PURPOSE
Issuing purchase orders and following up on purchase requests in accordance with the applicable regulations

CORE JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Strategy, Policy and Procedure
Follow up all aspects of regulatory compliance are adhered to in regard to the respective Procurement Policies and external requirements.
Compliance with the laws and regulations stipulated in the system of labour policies and administrative regulations (Attendance, Absence, Career commitment).
Maintain the confidentiality of the information relating to work, to protect the interests and activity of the Company.
KPI’S
Periodic review of procurement procedures and policy.
Compliance with the laws and regulations

2. Procurement Logistics
Receive purchase order through Oracle.
Request for prices from suppliers in the event of a direct purchase order.
Conduct tenders (competitive offers) upon obtaining the required administrative approvals.
Enter suppliers into the purchasing system.
Communicate with departments to ensure response to project inquiries during the offering period.
Respond to internal customers.
Ensure that the incoming prices are analyzed and placed in the comparison templates and provide detailed proposals.
Receive and follow up on committee reports and register them in the purchasing system.
Convert electronic files to start contracting or issuing purchase orders.
Address suppliers and set up the required contact points to facilitate procurement operations.
Follow up on receiving bank guarantees from suppliers and handing them over to the Finance Unit.
Follow procedures to retrieve bank guarantees after the end of the tender period, in coordination with the Finance Unit and suppliers.
Follow up on the collection of the required fees as required by the company.
Cancel or modify purchase orders in the event that they do not meet the conditions or violate the regulations of the company.
Participate in and contribute to the Supplier Qualification and Performance Evaluation Committee on a regular basis.

KPI'S
Periodic review of procurement procedures and policy.
Follow up and update.

3. Stakeholder Synergy
Develop and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders to ensure high performance.
Work collaboratively and engage with Information Technology Unit in case of encountering technical problems in the system used for Purchasing.
Respond to supplier complaints and communicate appropriate solutions.

KPI'S
% Employee feedback.

4. Maintain Safety
Follow the standards of safety and security in the and other locations in which he operates.

KPI'S
Standards of safety & security

Perform any other responsibilities relating to this job request or work task as allocated by the Line Manager.

Task Completed as Requested Desired Candidate Profile

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior IT Auditor to join our team. The ideal candidate will play a key role in evaluating and ensuring the effectiveness, efficiency, and security of our information technology systems and processes. The Senior IT Auditor will lead audits, assess risks, analyze controls, and provide valuable insights to enhance our IT governance framework.

Responsibilities:
Risk Assessment and Mitigation:
Evaluate IT risks and vulnerabilities within the organization's systems and processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement effective controls to mitigate identified risks.
Stay updated on industry best practices and emerging IT risks to adapt audit strategies accordingly.
Controls Evaluation:
Assess the design and effectiveness of IT controls to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements.
Identify control gaps and deficiencies, and provide actionable recommendations for remediation.
Review and validate the implementation of control enhancements and corrective actions.
Technical Expertise:
Possess a deep understanding of IT systems, networks, applications, and emerging technologies.
Evaluate the adequacy of security measures, data protection, and disaster recovery mechanisms.
Utilize specialized knowledge of Oracle Fusion systems to assess controls, configurations, and security measures.
Lead and manage end-to-end IT audits, including risk assessment, scoping, testing, and reporting.
Reporting and Communication:
Prepare clear and concise audit reports that highlight findings, risks, and recommendations.
Present audit results to senior management, stakeholders, and audit committees.
Provide ongoing communication and updates on audit progress and findings.
Collaboration and Leadership:
Collaborate with internal teams to promote a culture of compliance, risk awareness, and continuous improvement.
Mentor and provide guidance to junior auditors, fostering their professional growth. Desired Candidate Profile
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field.
Professional certification such as CISA (Certified Information Systems Auditor) or CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional) is preferred.
8+ years of experience in IT auditing
Strong knowledge of GRC, ERM, and Compliance frameworks
Proficiency in using data analytics tools, and Microsoft Office suite.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
Demonstrated ability to work independently, lead audits, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a skilled and enthusiastic individual to join our team in the combined role of Receptionist cum Customer Service Representative. In this hybrid position, you will be the first point of contact for our visitors and clients, ensuring a warm welcome and professional assistance. Simultaneously, you will handle customer inquiries, provide exceptional service, and contribute to a positive customer experience.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Receptionist Duties: Greet visitors with a friendly and welcoming demeanor, creating a positive first impression.
Answer incoming calls promptly, direct calls to appropriate personnel, and take accurate messages when necessary.
Manage appointment calendars efficiently, scheduling meetings and appointments as needed.
Maintain a tidy and organized reception area, reflecting our commitment to excellence.
Handle mail, packages, and deliveries, ensuring timely distribution to recipients.
Assist with administrative tasks, including filing, data entry, and inventory management.
Customer Service Responsibilities: Address customer inquiries and concerns professionally and promptly, whether in person, via phone, or through digital channels.
Provide accurate information about our products, services, and company policies to assist customers effectively.
Resolve customer issues and complaints in a positive and solution-oriented manner.
Process customer orders accurately, ensuring attention to detail in order details and transactions.
Build rapport with customers, fostering strong relationships and ensuring their satisfaction with our services.
Collect customer feedback and relay insights to internal teams for continuous improvement. Desired Candidate Profile
The ideal candidate will possess a unique blend of interpersonal finesse, organizational prowess, and a genuine passion for delivering outstanding customer experiences. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, are adept at multitasking, and have a knack for building positive relationships, we invite you to join our team.
Qualifications and Attributes:
Exceptional Communication Skills: Adept at both written and verbal communication, with a friendly and professional demeanor. The ability to convey information clearly and effectively to diverse audiences is paramount.
Customer-Centric Mindset: Demonstrated commitment to understanding and fulfilling customer needs. Empathetic, patient, and capable of turning customer inquiries into positive interactions.
Detail-Oriented: Meticulous attention to detail, ensuring accurate record-keeping, order processing, and overall task execution.
Adaptability: Comfortable handling diverse tasks, seamlessly transitioning between receptionist duties and customer service responsibilities as the situation demands.
Time Management: Proficient at multitasking and prioritizing tasks to ensure efficient handling of both reception and customer service functions.
Positive Attitude: A positive outlook and a proactive approach to problem-solving. Able to maintain composure and professionalism, even in challenging situations.
Team Player: Collaborative mindset, willing to work closely with internal teams to ensure a smooth flow of information and effective customer support.
Tech-Savvy: Familiarity with office software, communication tools, and the ability to quickly learn and navigate new systems.
Product Knowledge: Eagerness to learn about our products and services, enabling you to provide accurate and informative responses to customer inquiries.
Professional Appearance: Presentable and well-groomed, projecting a polished image in both appearance and behavior.
Previous Experience: Prior experience in a receptionist, administrative, or customer service role is advantageous. However, candidates with a strong aptitude for learning and a passion for exceptional service will also be considered.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Aramco energizes the world economy.
Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer.
With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco s value to society.
Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom s vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.
We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.
Overview
We are seeking a Data Architect to join the Corporate Data Office within our Digital Transformation Admin Area.
The Corporate Data Office is responsible for establishing and executing world-class Corporate-wide data governance to ensure all data assets are proactively and efficiently governed and managed across Saudi Aramco, to foster a data driven organization and promote data value realization in line with its strategic goals as well to adequately comply with national and international data regulations.
The Data Architect will work within the Corporate Data Office enabling the company s vision for data and analytics. The role requires deep subject matter expertise combined with a tenacity for dealing with a complex data landscape.
The Data architect will create the standards and introduce new Corporate disciplines from strategic artifacts such as the Conceptual Model, to adoptions of industry metamodels, taxonomies and data flows.
The Data Architect will help set the guard rails for best practices, including establishment of modelling tooling and platforms. The holder will be a leader in their field and will be a trusted hand, able to provide architectural expertise for the wider organization.
Duties & Responsibilities
• Manage the Corporate Data Architecture Reference Model for the Data Office and its clients.
• Develop & maintain the Corporate Conceptual Data Model, ensuring continued scalability, and aligned with business requirements.
• Work across stakeholders to gather solution requirements and propose architecture decisions.
• Define & maintain the Corporate Data Domains and associated taxonomies.
• Shape enterprise data architecture design patterns, design principles and best practices enhancing business solution delivery;
• Define and manage the flow of data and dissemination of information within the Corporate Data Office s platforms and services.
• Assist in selecting data management tools and developing the standards, usage guidelines, and procedures for using those tools.
• Manage end-to-end data architecture within the Office, from selecting the platform, designing the technical architecture, and developing the application to finally testing and implementing the proposed solution in conjunction with stakeholders and data engineers.
• Assist in identifying appropriate data sourcing and extraction processes, and in identifying and nominating sources as systems of record for data usage in various applications.
• Identify new business opportunities pertaining to the use of information assets to achieve efficiency and effectiveness in the marketplace / represent data as a strategic business asset at the Digital Transformation Officer and Senior Management levels.
• Identify data sources, both internal and external, and working out a plan for optimal data movement.
Education & Experience Requirements
As the successful candidate you will hold a Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Management of Information System, Information Management or other relevant qualification, from a recognized and approved program. An advanced degree is preferred.
Candidate will have ten (10) years of experience in a major organization, with large-scale data management and oversight experience, including experience in a senior management role, or transformation leadership experience.
• Candidate must have knowledge of industry leading data quality and data protection management practices.
• Candidate should possess knowledge of data related governance regulatory requirements and emerging trends and issues.
• Candidate must have experience in in technology solutions, practice development, architecture, consulting, and/or cloud/infrastructure technologies
• Candidate will be able to demonstrate consulting skills, with change management concepts and strategies, including communication, culture change and performance measurement system design.
• Candidate with Oil & Gas sector expertise are preferred
• Candidate should have knowledge of risk data architecture

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Our Identity:

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
As an HR Executive at our company, you will play a pivotal role in managing various human resources functions and supporting the organization's workforce. Your responsibilities will encompass recruitment, employee relations, performance management, compliance, and general HR administration.
Key Responsibilities:
Recruitment and Onboarding: Collaborate with the managers to identify staffing needs and create job descriptions.
Source, screen, and interview candidates for various positions, both technical and non-technical.
Coordinate and facilitate the onboarding process for new employees, ensuring a smooth transition into the company.
Employee Relations: Serve as a point of contact for employees regarding HR-related inquiries, policies, and procedures.
Mediate conflicts and issues among employees, fostering a positive and productive work environment.
Monitor employee morale and engagement, suggesting initiatives to enhance job satisfaction.
Performance Management: Support the performance appraisal process, including goal setting, performance feedback, and development planning.
Assist in identifying training and development needs, coordinating relevant training sessions.
Provide guidance to managers on handling performance-related matters and implementing improvement plans.
HR Administration: Maintain accurate employee records, ensuring compliance with legal requirements and company policies.
Prepare and distribute HR documents, including employment contracts, offer letters, and termination notices.
Handle administrative tasks such as managing attendance records, leave requests, and benefits administration.
Compliance: Stay up-to-date with labor laws, regulations, and industry best practices to ensure HR processes adhere to legal standards.
Assist in preparing and submitting required reports to relevant government agencies.
Implement and enforce company policies to maintain a compliant and ethical work environment.
Data Management: Collect, analyze, and report HR metrics to identify trends and areas for improvement.
Utilize HR information systems to maintain accurate employee data and generate reports as needed.
Employee Communication: Facilitate internal communication regarding HR policies, changes, and updates.
Coordinate company-wide communications related to employee events, benefits, and important announcements. Desired Candidate Profile
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
Proven experience (10 years) as an HR Executive or similar role, preferably in a contracting or construction environment.
Knowledge of HR best practices, labor laws, and regulations.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Detail-oriented and well-organized.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.
Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite.

Roles & Responsibilities
Bilfinger is a leading international industrial services provider. The Group enhances the efficiency of assets, ensures a high level of availability and reduces maintenance costs. The portfolio covers the entire value chain from consulting, engineering, manufacturing, assembly, maintenance and plant expansion to turnarounds and also includes environmental technologies and digital applications.
The company delivers its services in two service lines: Engineering & Maintenance and Technologies. Bilfinger is primarily active in Europe, North America and the Middle East. Process industry customers come from sectors that include chemicals & petrochemicals, energy & utilities, oil & gas, pharma & biopharma, metallurgy and cement.

Project Management

Good knowledge of Gulf environmental regulations, including permitting requirements and experience in obtaining permits from relevant agencies.
Demonstrated track record in the planning, coordination, and management of environmental projects.
Excellent technical writing, communication, and project management skills.
Must be comfortable working in the field at remote locations, or on active construction site.
Experience with presenting technical information to clients, stakeholders and/or regulators.
Proven business development, networking and client relationship management skills.
The ability to mentor, grow and develop junior team members to continue the successful growth of the team.

Sustainability.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
About the job Sr. Supervisor, Data Architect
Purpose of the job
- As a solution architect you'll work in a Big Data environment, to lead supervise and contribute to building an elastic , high performance CVM data engineering pipelines, computing and data storage platform that underpins the diverse workloads running on data lake infrastructure.
- You will be working with the team on problems involving large scale data engineering, data and metadata storage, computing infrastructure automation and more.
- You will be expected to set the standards, contribute architecture and implementation for different systems and applications. Promote best practices and build technical excellency culture within the team. The candidate will play a vital role in creating vision, judge features feasibility and lead architecture workshops, and leading the design, make high level decision for CVM application, mediation, governing and stewardship of corporate data sets. You will be working closely with other teams to support mining, auditing, testing, researching and visualizing corporate data sets and with the business consumers and subject matter experts to drive smart data driven solutions and initiatives.
Duties and responsibilities
• Design and implement data pipelines, scripts and services
• Assessing the data architecture currently in place and working with technical staff to recommend solutions to improve it
• Designing, modifying, and testing technical architecture.
• Propose solutions and provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions
• Continually research the current and emerging technologies and propose changes where needed
• Inform various stakeholders about any issues with the current technical solutions being implemented
• Resolve L3 production issues.
• Provide strong technical leadership to the team with a focus on quality, performance, and security.
• Foster a culture of creativity and innovation while also promoting practical decision making.
• Help growing the team by contributing in recruitment process.
• Collaborate with data scientists, data analysts, modelers and IT team members on project goals.
• Optimize the performance and support monitoring of data platform systems and computing infrastructure.
• Define and review service availability and quality SLAs.
• Provide updates to stakeholders on product development processes, costs and budgets
• Document and monitor requirements needed to institute proposed updates
• Work closely with Information Technology professionals within the company to ensure hardware is available for projects and working properly
• Propose and establish framework for necessary contributions from various departments
• Account for possible project challenges on constraints including, risks, time, resources and scope
• Define clear goals for all aspects of a project and manage their proper execution
• Work closely with project management teams to successfully monitor progress of initiatives
Job specification
Education
• Bachelor degree of Engineering in Computer Systems, or Computer Science.
Experience
• 3-5 years of hands-on software engineering experience
• 2+ years leading a data engineering projects as Sr. Data Engineer or similar role.
• Solid engineering fundamentals with extensive and strong software development experience.
• Experience coaching and mentoring junior and senior software engineers.
• Experience developing IT and cloud infrastructure
• Current understanding of best practices regarding system security measures
• Past experience in telecom operators and service providers is preferred.
Skills and abilities
• Very good English both written & spoken.
• Positive outlook in meeting challenges and working to a high level
• Advanced understanding of business analysis techniques and processes
• Excellent collaboration and communication skills and comfortable working across multiple teams.
• Strong hands-on skill, can drill deep into complex systems design and implementation.
