Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description Summary
JLL is seeking a talented and experienced design/construction project manager. The qualified candidate will oversee a wide variety of colocation and hyperscale data center projects from site due diligence, campus planning, conceptual/schematic/detailed design through construction documents, and construction administration. The ideal candidate has experience managing the design and construction of co-location and hyperscale data centers, has a background in electrical engineering, or mechanical engineering, and possesses exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Duties & Responsibilities:
• Provide effective leadership and management for project delivery, ensure timely and quality performance by the project team, responsible for all facets of project performance.
• Responsible for the supervision of design document submission by the design team to ensure that the submissions are made on time and the review of the design documents from the technical advisor/consultant is turned around within the assigned project program timeline.
• Review the value engineering proposals and alternate material requests from the contractor to analyze any possible cost benefit to the client in coordination with the commercial team.
• Review the Prequalification of contractors during the tender stage and provide a recommendation to the client on the selection of contractors.
• Manage and coordinate all the design-related activities during concept design, schematic design, Detailed design, and Issued for construction (IFC) stage. Handle the Shop-drawing and as-built drawing process.
• Manage and coordinate all the construction-related activities to ensure all the activities followed by the contractor are as per the project program.
• Discuss with the project planning team and project control team to understand the progress of the project and accordingly analyze the monthly progress report submitted by the contractor. The same will be discussed directly with the project director.
• Design, Budgeting, Supervision of Installation, and Commissioning to ensure the quality of works of ICT&S systems - (Physical Security Information Management System (PSIM), CCTV, Access Control, Intrusion Detection, Intercom, Gate Barrier, Hostile Vehicle Mitigation, Speed gate, Audio Visual and structured Cabling System).
• Prepare the design of ICT&S systems as per the client s requirement by attending multiple meetings with various client operation teams and obtaining client approval.
• Coordinate with the internal multidisciplinary team (Civil, Architecture, Electrical, Mechanical, Infra & Planning) to develop a proper design, fit for construction
• Prepare equipment schedule, calculations, and design drawings (floor layout with field devices, installation details, schematic drawing) in coordination with CAD team.
• Monitoring the ICT&S works for conformance with the provisions of the Contract documents and ensuring compliance with specifications and Contract drawings.
• Inspect delivered materials and approve them as per approved material submittal, contract BOQ and with the support of proper shipping documents to verify the genuineness/COO of the product.
• Prepare Site Instructions, Non-Conformance Report (NCR), and letters to the contractor in case of any change of contract documents or for any deviations as per specification.
• Lead data center core and shell due diligence and design projects (including civil, structural, mechanical, electrical, plumbing, security, and fire protection for greenfield and add/move/change projects) from start to finish, ensuring budget/schedule adherence, satisfaction of design requirements, and repeatable quality.
• Establish and oversee a process to detect, track and resolve scope changes, errors, or inconsistencies throughout the design process.
• Manage and grow the data center design team, fostering a sense of comradery, collective ownership, and collaboration.
• Oversee preparation of project administration documents including Design status updates, Action item/risk tracker, Meeting minutes and Quality reports
What you can expect from us
We succeed together and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay.
We can t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL. Apply today!
Location:
On-site Dubai, ARE, Riyadh, SAU
Job Tags:
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply, even if you don t meet all the requirements. We re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

ENGIE SOLUTIONS MIDDLE EAST
ENGIE Solutions is part of the ENGIE Group, a global reference in low-carbon energy and services, with more than 96,000 employees.
ENGIE Solutions is one of the global leaders in decentralised energy networks and associated services and is firmly rooted in the GCC region.
We aim to support town cities, local authorities, and industrial and service sector customers in their decarbonisation trajectory. To do so, we provide a wide range of solutions to drive action on three levels: making the energy mix greener, energy efficiency and energy savings.
These solutions are divided into three categories: Local Energy Networks, On-site Energy Production, and Energy Performance & Management Services.
The company is committed to investing in countries through empowering the local workforce, implementing smart technology solutions and know-how, and delivering financed and guaranteed energy-efficient projects for our customers.
Job Title: Data Center BMS Operator
Position Reports to: Data Center Engineer
Location: Saudi Arabia
SUMMARY: Responsible for safely, efficiently, and effectively operating machinery and systems in a cost-effective manner. The BMS Technician must ensure the highest level of professionalism, while meeting the client needs, and a commitment to achieving the goal of no downtime. Responsible for protecting and improving the value of the client assets and ensuring that building engineering systems continue to perform their intended function. Perform installation, repair, and maintenance of controls systems located in the interior and exterior of the building.
PRIMARY FUNCTIONS AND ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Perform monitoring, operation and maintenance of all building systems via the BMS System including: fire/life safety, mechanical (HVAC, plumbing, controls) electrical (lighting, UPS, PDU, generators, primary switchgear), cabling (data and Power), lighting and temperature controls systems, critical environments, digital systems (fire alarm).
• At the direction of supervisor, maintaining, monitoring and performing preventive maintenance and continuous operation of all building systems including fire/life safety, mechanical (HVAC, plumbing, controls), electrical (lighting, UPS, PDU, generators, primary switch gear), emergency backup systems and hot water systems. Monitors operation, adjusts and maintains refrigeration, chilled water, and air conditioning equipment, Record readings and adjust them where necessary to ensure proper operation of equipment. Requires the ability to analyze the operation of various systems, determine the cause of any problems/malfunctions and take corrective action as required.
• Maintain effective communication with all external and internal customers, including Clients, Property & Project management, and Engineering staff.
• Participate in emergency response and problem management. Respond to incidents and mitigate the damage and obtain information on the cause of the problem. Ensure that escalation is performed per the escalation plan.
• Perform preventive maintenance as needed. Specific duties include but are not limited to: performing preventive maintenance with a minimum disruption of building services, performing and/or delegating preventive maintenance tasks to the appropriately qualified maintenance staff member.
• Oversee the activities of contractors working within the building either as representatives of the building itself or tenants operating within the buildings.
• Performs additional job duties as requested.
EDUCATION / CERTIFICATION / KNOWLEDGE/ EXPERIENCE:
• 5+ years related work experience, with BMS systems and controls.
• Diploma degree in an Electrical/Electromechanical discipline.
• Must have hands-on experience in a data center/critical facility, including controls systems and mechanical and electrical systems.
• Certificate must be certified from recognized institutions.
SKILLS/ABILITIES:
• Ability to work a rotational on-call shift.
• Ability to work under pressure, adaptable.
• Ability to work in a team environment.
• Ability to diagnose root cause of equipment failures.
• Very familiar with Health & Safety guidelines and procedures, especially for operating electrical or energized equipment.
• Ability to communicate effectively with vendors who perform maintenance on the facility electrical equipment.

Job Title: Data Center Mechanical Technician
Position Reports to: Data Center Engineer
Location: Saudi Arabia
SUMMARY: Responsible for safely, efficiently, and effectively operating machinery and systems in a cost-effective manner. The Technician must ensure the highest level of professionalism, while meeting the client needs, and a commitment to achieving the goal of no downtime. Responsible for protecting and improving the value of the client assets and ensuring that building engineering systems continue to perform their intended function. Perform installation, repair, and maintenance of mechanical equipment, machinery, and controls located in the interior and exterior of building. Performs tests, rounds and analyzes data to ensure the proper functioning of departmental equipment.
PRIMARY FUNCTIONS AND ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Perform maintenance and operation of all mechanical building systems including mechanical (HVAC, plumbing) and temperature controls systems, critical environments, and light construction (painting, doors, and locks), and digital systems (fire alarm & access equipment).
• Strict adherence to Client established engineering guidelines, processes and procedures.
• Maintain effective communication with all external and internal customers, including Clients, Property and Project management, and Engineering staff.
• Participate in emergency response and problem management. Respond to incidents and mitigate the damage. Obtain information on the cause of the problem. Ensure that escalation is performed per the escalation plan.
• Perform preventive maintenance. Specific duties include but are not limited to: Preventive maintenance with a minimum disruption of building services and performing and/or delegating preventive maintenance tasks to the appropriately qualified maintenance staff member.
• Responsible for adhering to and implementing all facility guidelines and procedures related to his work.
• Responsible for performing daily performance monitoring of mechanical equipment during walk rounds.
• Responsible for following SOPs and EOPs during preventive and corrective maintenance.
• Responsible for executing Work Orders for minor preventive maintenance activities including non-invasive testing, Infra-Red (IR) analysis, inspections, lubrications, replacement of consumables, etc.
• Responsible for escorting Vendors always during major preventive maintenance and during reactive and corrective maintenance.
• Responsible for checking that the maintenance is performed with respect to the Method of Procedures (MOP) provided by the Vendor.
• Responsible for executing isolation, shutdown, start-up, emergency shutdown and restoration procedures of all facility equipment whenever needed.
• Responsible for responding to unplanned events and emergency scenarios, and for sustaining Data Center operations.
• Responsible for escalating emergency failures and alarms to Facility Maintenance Supervisor and Vendors.
• Report any detected malfunction or any required changes to the executed procedures.
• Responsible for requesting necessary tools and parts for Work Orders execution and for returning tools and replaced parts once the work is executed.
• Responsible for maintaining tools in good conditions.
• Responsible for proper disposal of spares and consumables as per implemented policy.
• Advise on any enhancement to be made to the current SOPs, EOPs, and MOPs through formal change request.
• Responsible for executing any required change to the facility (set point, redundancy rotation, labelling ).
• Ensure that the Change Management Process is carried out on the building s critical infrastructure.
• Performs additional job duties as requested.
EDUCATION / CERTIFICATION / KNOWLEDGE/ EXPERIENCE:
• 5+ years related work experience.
• Diploma in Mechanical Engineering.
• Must have hands-on experience in a data center/critical facility, including chillers, pumps, and air handling units.
• Certificate must be certified from recognized institutions.
• Have experience in break fixing, dismantling, and assembling parts and thus performing minor maintenance and workshop activities by hand such as changing bearings, windings, lubricating, replacing parts, testing, etc.
• Have experience in equipment commissioning, startup/shutdown, LOTO (Lockout-Tagout) and isolation, as well as performance monitoring.
• Have experience in monitoring system and alarm management from equipment control panel.
SKILLS/ABILITIES:
• Have a general understanding of electrical equipment in use in the data center (generator, UPS & batteries ).
• Ability to work a rotational on-call shift.
• Ability to work under pressure, adaptable.
• Ability to work in a team environment.
• Ability to diagnose root cause of equipment failures.
• Very familiar with Health & Safety guidelines and procedures, especially for operating mechanical or energized equipment
• Ability to communicate effectively with vendors who perform maintenance on the facility mechanical equipment.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

A data center specialist will monitors, identifies, and resolves issues concerning the data center, server equipment and net backup equipment; performs upgrades, assists with data storage issues, maintains data center documentation, tracks physical data center inventory, and maintains disaster recover processes and documentation.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Install and configure data center equipment: A data center specialist is responsible for installing, configuring, and maintaining various data center equipment, including servers, storage devices, networking equipment, and other hardware and software components.
• Monitor and maintain data center systems: A data center specialist is responsible for monitoring data center systems and ensuring their performance and reliability. This includes monitoring server performance, network connectivity, and other critical systems.
• Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues: A data center specialist is responsible for troubleshooting and resolving technical issues that may arise within the data center environment. This includes identifying and resolving hardware and software issues, network connectivity problems, and other issues that may impact data center performance.
• Ensure data center security: A data center specialist is responsible for ensuring the security of the data center environment. This includes implementing security policies and procedures, monitoring access to the data center, and ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.
• Perform backups and disaster recovery: A data center specialist is responsible for performing backups of critical data and systems, as well as implementing disaster recovery procedures to ensure business continuity in the event of a system failure or other emergency.
• Maintain documentation and reports: A data center specialist is responsible for maintaining documentation and reports related to data center operations, including system configurations, performance metrics, and security logs.
• Collaborate with other IT professionals: A data center specialist must work closely with other IT professionals, including network engineers, system administrators, and security professionals, to ensure the smooth operation of the data center environment.
QUALIFICATION:
• Should have a bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field, as well as relevant work experience in data center operations, network administration, or system administration.
• Certifications in relevant technologies, such as Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA), Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE), or Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP).

Technology

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Overview
Gas Operations Technical Support Department is looking to hire a Data Scientist Engineer to work with Gas Operations Technical Support and Planning Department in order to support the development of IR4.0 and digital projects that are led by Digital Transformation Team. GOTS&PD is a department within the Gas Operations Admin area. The Data Scientist will report to the Leader of Digital Transformation Team and will work with other colleagues in IR4.0 and digital projects and should be experienced in all of its enabling fields, such as digitalization, modeling, machine learning, programing, prototyping, AR/VR, mobile development, and/or AI.
Key Responsibilities
You will be required to perform the following:
Work in IR4.0 and digital projects and master all enabling fields such as digitalization, modeling, machine learning, programing, prototyping, AR/VR, mobile development, and/or AI
Develop applications and software for Digital Transformation Team related projects
Train team members and conduct knowledge sharing sessions regarding data science
Work with engineers of different disciplines providing support to ensure the reliability of projects
Minimum Requirements
As a successful candidate, you
Should have BS degree in science or engineering, MS or PhD is preferable
should have a minimum of 15 years , with a strong preference for 15 years plus, progressive professional experience including a minimum of 3 years working experience as a specialist with full responsibility for supervising major technical work, gaining recognition as a leading expert in IR4.0-enabling fields, such as digitalization, modeling, machine learning, programing, prototyping, AR/VR, mobile development, and/or AI in addition to an industry experience with a major technology developer and oil and gas operations background. You also must have patents and/or publications in any of these areas
Are able to demonstrate the ability to effectively lead cross-functional research teams to successful project completion, effectively represent an organization in high-level interactions with strategic partners with excellent communications skills as well as credibility as a leader and effectively interact with all organizational functions, including senior leadership. Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
About the job Sr. Supervisor, Converged Core IP Data Network Engineering
Purpose of the Job
Planning, deploying and maintaining converged IP/MPLS backbone interconnecting Orange Fixed and Mobile sites and carrying various Core, Voice, Mobile & Fixed Data services; as well as fulfilling OEG internal customers business needs by delivering end-to-end IP connectivity solutions for different Voice and Data services.
Duties and Responsibilities
1. Plan and Implement of the various converged IP/MPLS fixed and mobile backbone projects; HW/SW Upgrades, links expansions & network modernization initiatives
2. Set regular meetings and workshops with vendors for setting the development and decision of technologies and hardware needs to provide state of art network for providing the best in class services to our customers.
3. Provide data network connectivity solutions for integrating various Voice & Data services over the IP/MPLS backbone (PaCo, Core NSS, BSS, fixed broad band , 4G/5G , triple play and B2B solutions .etc)
4. Plan/provision new services implementations or migrations using Network orchestrations and automations frameworks and technologies.
5. Conduct ?what-if? simulations and bottleneck analysis to investigate the impact of network changes and recommend design optimizations.
6. Monitor network KPIs reports to make sure the dimensioning and QoS is guaranteed end to end across the network.
7. Create and maintain relevant projects technical design documentation
8. Create RFI , RFPs and RFQs for IP/MPLS converged core network new projects for enhancement , optimization modernization or expansions
9. Develop converged IP/MPLS backbone annual/quarterly CAPX/OPEX budget
10. Manage IP Pool & Internet clusters.
11. Peer with the upstream providers like (level3, Flag, Global-crossing, ?) using the latest design approaches
12. Provide high resiliency plans for international circuits failure with minimal impact on different services
13. Test new features and HW in the DN LAB environment to ensure the functionality of the equipment and the features for providing the services to our customers.
Job Specifications
• Education
1. Bachelor degree in telecommunications and electronic engineering from a recognized university.
2. CCNP, CCIP or CCDP required, CCIE is a plus
3. JNCIP,JNCIE is a plus
Experience
1. Minimum 4 Years, 2 of which in a relevant role
2. Excellent knowledge of LAN/WAN communications, network hardware such as Cisco/Juniper Routers, Switches and Firewalls
3. Excellent knowledge of routing/switching protocols (BGP, OSPF, MPLS, VPN Layer2, and VPN Layer3)
4. Excellent knowledge/Practical experience in Cisco or Juniper routers and switches configuration
5. Excellent understanding and practical experience with technologies like MPLS, SR, EVPN
6. Excellent understanding of QOS best practices
7. General awareness of the operation and underlying protocols of various Core/VAS/PaCo systems like Softswitches, HLRs, STPs, RNCs, Charging, 3G/LTE, VoIP and SIGTRAN.
• Skills and abilities
1 . Very good English both spoken and written
2. Very good computer skills.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Property Finder is the leading digital real estate platform in the Middle East and North Africa region. A UAE-born startup, Property Finder expanded its operations to Qatar, Bahrain, Saudi Arabia, and Egypt over the years. Recently, it acquired a significant stake in Zingat in Turkey. The company is one of the largest technology start-ups in the region and on a journey to becoming a Unicorn. We are aspiring to create a lighthouse technology company which will have a lasting impact in the entire tech ecosystem in our geography.

About This Role
As the Head of Data Science, you will be a hands-on data science leader, you will support the VP of Data & AI in developing and implementing the Data Science and AI strategy for Property Finder. You will work cross-functionally with the Product Development team and other departments to design and deploy Data Products that support our users and customers.

What You ll Do
• Build and lead a team of Data Scientists to deliver cutting edge off-line and real time machine learning solutions and data pipelines
• Build Data Science, ML advanced models and deploy them at scale
• Partner cross-functionally with Product Leadership and Core Engineering teams to develop and track detailed schedules, dependencies and critical paths
• Effectively collaborate with all project stakeholders i.e. Product Management, Engineering Team, Marketing and other functions
• Encourage and drive initiatives which promote innovation and technical excellence
• Hire, retain, and develop the the engineers on your team
• Coach and motivate your team to ensure high productivity and teamwork, and help each individual achieve their potential
• Interface with other internal teams to prioritise features and functionality based on the resources available and business priorities
Skills & Experience
• Minimum 7 years experience in data science, and/or machine learning
• Minimum 3 years experience hands-on people management of high performing engineers, scientists, and/or engineering managers
• Strong experience in data management, including building and scaling data lake management systems and data pipelines
• Strong experience in data curation and ethical sourcing of data, with knowledge of data privacy regulations
• Strong experience in product management with a track record of delivering successful products and features in the AI/ML space
• Strong experience in building AI architectures and deploying scalable AI models
• A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent industry experience.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think strategically and make data-driven decisions
• Experience with agile development methodologies and best practices for software development
• Experience communicating highly technical concepts to a non-technical audience
• Experience in the marketplace industry or an interest in the marketplace space
Property Finder Principles
• Move fast and make things
• Data beats opinions
• Don t confuse motion with progress
• Failure is success if we learn from it
• People over pixels

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Role Purpose
The Quality Analyst Professional will play a critical role in the development and implementation of data-driven quality initiatives. The position will focus on harnessing data to derive insights that inform quality improvement, contributing to the design and delivery of personalized care models that meet the diverse needs of our populations.
The individual will be responsible for the ongoing analysis, monitoring, and reporting of quality indicators, using advanced analytical techniques to identify trends, highlight areas of concern, and drive quality enhancement initiatives. This role will require the ability to synthesize complex health data to inform the development of personalized healthcare strategies.
The professional will liaise with various stakeholders, including healthcare providers and interdisciplinary teams, to implement and refine quality metrics, using this information to inform the design and delivery of effective health interventions. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to the delivery of high-quality, personalized care, by leveraging big data and advanced analytics to inform strategic decision-making and drive continuous improvement in healthcare delivery.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES & ACTIVITIES
Strategy, Planning and Coordination
Support in the development and delivery of the division strategy through hypothesis development, scenario testing, feasibility studies and related tasks
Contribute to preparation of reports and presentations in the annual planning and budgeting cycle
As part of the team
o analyse and forecast health and wellbeing demands and translate into high level requirements on assets, equipment, and digital infrastructure.
o Reassess and adjust targets and implementation plans accordingly to new and/or changed master plans
Project delivery and Risk Management
Support in development of structures and processes for monitoring of projects and activities
Independently lead and deliver assigned activities and projects
Support the identification, assessment, and mitigation of potential organizational risks that could impact our operations and objectives.
Provide periodic reports regarding project progress, challenges, risks, and mitigation plans
Actively take part of and contribute to workshops and activities related to asset, equipment and digital infrastructure development
Collaborate with cross-functional project teams to ensure successful project outcomes that meet quality standards and align with business objectives.
Administration and Contract Management
Contribute to development of scope of work documents
Support in internal and external communications activities
Relationship and Stakeholder Management
Actively participate in sector and cross sector meetings and initiate meeting structures for effective interaction with stakeholders related to assignments
Manage stakeholders feedback on issues, challenges and unmet requirements and develop action plans
Act as a role model for the sector in interaction with other sectors and departments
People Management
Lead by example, supervise and coach team members and colleagues to perform at their best
Promote a high-performance working environment embracing NEOM s values

Key Stakeholders
All Health Wellbeing & Biotech divisions
Other Sectors and Departments e.g., Sport, Education, Food, Environment, Operations, Projects, Technology & Digital, etc.
Healthcare Regulatory Authorities (worldwide)
Health services providers
External consultants


QUALIFICATIONS / REQUIREMENTS
Knowledge and Experience
3 - 5 years of experience in healthcare quality analysis, preferably in a complex healthcare setting.
2 - 3 years of experience in healthcare quality analysis, preferably in a complex healthcare setting
Demonstrable knowledge of healthcare quality measures and standards.
Proficiency in big data analytics and interpreting complex health data, including genetic data.
Familiarity with the principles and applications of personalized medicine.
Understanding of health informatics and healthcare information systems.
Knowledge of statistical analysis, data visualization, and advanced analytics tools.
Education and Certifications
A bachelor s degree in data science, Computer Science, applied mathematics, Finance/economics, Management information systems or Business Administration, Medicine, (or equivalent) is required
Master s degree in data Analytics or Health related topics is beneficial
Diploma or Certificate in Data Management is beneficial

Job Description
Hiring, Hyperscale Data Center Manager / Senior Manager / Director
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Hyperscale Data Center Manager to Director to oversee the operations of the state-of-the-art data center facility in Riyadh, KSA. Candidates must possess strong leadership abilities, technical expertise, and a deep understanding of data center operations. As a Hyperscale Data Center Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring the efficient and reliable performance of data center infrastructure, as well as managing a team of dedicated professionals.
Responsibilities
Lead and manage the day-to-day operations of the hyperscale data center, ensuring the highest level of service availability, reliability, and security.
Develop and implement operational policies and procedures to ensure efficient data center operations, including equipment installation, maintenance, and decommissioning.
Oversee the deployment, configuration, and management of server hardware, networking equipment, and power distribution systems.
Monitor and maintain the data center infrastructure, including temperature, humidity, power, and cooling systems, to ensure optimal performance and minimize downtime.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to plan and execute data center expansions, capacity upgrades, and equipment migrations.
Establish and enforce stringent security protocols to protect sensitive data, including physical access controls, video surveillance, and cybersecurity measures.
Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations, including ISO 27001, SOC 2, and GDPR.
Manage vendor relationships, including procurement, contract negotiations, and performance evaluations.
Develop and manage the data center budget, forecasting expenses, and optimizing operational costs.
Lead and mentor a team of data center technicians and engineers, providing guidance, training, and performance evaluations.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field. Relevant certifications (e.g., CDCP, CDCS, CCNP, CISSP) are highly desirable.
Proven experience (minimum 5 years) managing hyperscale data centers, including a thorough understanding of the unique challenges associated with large-scale infrastructure.
Deep knowledge of data center operations, including server hardware, networking technologies, power and cooling systems, and data center management tools.
Strong leadership skills with the ability to effectively manage a team and drive results.
Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities, particularly in high-pressure situations.
Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage resources, and meet deadlines.
In-depth understanding of data center security best practices and experience implementing robust security measures.
Familiarity with industry
Required Skills and Experience

IT/Computers-Hardware
Role:

key Skills :
Data Center Construction, Data Center Design and Planning, Greenfield, Brownfield, Hyperscale, Data Center Operations, Power and Cooling Sytems, Hyperscale Computing

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Key Responsibilities
You will be required to perform the following:
Design and Implement smart business intelligence dashboards to visualize huge datasets from multiple data sources

Develop artificial intelligence solutions utilizing machine learning and advanced modeling
Research and develop innovative solutions for Upstream supported organizations

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

An exciting opportunity is available for Specialist , Data & Business Analyst , Located in Riyadh, KSA
POSITION SUMMARY:
The Analyst will be focusing on enhancing the performance of the M&S team through data and economic analysis. Will also engage in other business initiatives to improve/ support all departments.
KEY TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Identify, monitor and support improvement of various KPIs/ parameters that will enhance the overall performance of sales.
• Develop and operate other economic models/ analysis/ tools that can enhance overall sales and operational efficiency.
• Generation of regular and adhoc reports to management and internal stake-holders.
• Create, test, and deploy price prediction models that will forecast short-term and long-term prices of chemicals not limited to crude oil, Propane, olefins, polyolefins, and others. Monitor and report price modeling performance.
• In charge of Price control process execution, testing and improvements. Involves SAP and Python
• In charge of managing the completion, implementation and maintenance of the pricing tool that will run the pricing models
• Regular interaction with other departments to identify improvement areas that can be addressed through data analytics/ science. Recommending solutions/ tools/ databases that can help in the overall improvement of business.
• Will be part of team and/or leading various business initiatives as deemed fit by the company.
• Support adhoc requests from the team/ management related to data analytics and related fields to solve business problems.
Education/Qualifications Required:
Minimum Qualification and Experience:
• A bachelor s or master s degree in engineering, computer science, statistics, math, economics, and business or other related technical discipline.
• Minimum 2-3 years of experience in analytics or data science
• Experience in Business Analyst/ Data Scientist role preferred
• Experience in Petrochemicals/ Polymers, while not mandatory, will offer advantage
Job Specific Skills:
• Strong numerical, problem solving and analytical aptitude.
• Being able to make data based decisions.
• Basic to intermediate Python Programming knowledge (e.g., Pandas, Numpy, Jupyter Notebook).
• Intermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft Excel.
• Ability to learn quickly and to apply new tools and techniques.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Position: Health Data Integration Engineer
Reports to: Senior Enterprise Architect Manager
Sector: Health, Wellbeing & Biotech
Job Location: Sharma, NEOM

Role Purpose:

NEOM is a new vision of what the future could be. It s an attempt to do something that s never been done before and it s coming at a time when the world needs fresh thinking and new solutions. Put simply, NEOM will not only be a destination, but a home for people who dream big and who want to be part of building a new model for sustainable living. NEOM will be a hub for innovation, where established global businesses and emerging players can research, incubate, and commercialize groundbreaking technologies to accelerate human progress.

The Data Integration Engineer is responsible for developing, innovating, testing, maintaining, installing, and deploying Healthcare interoperability solutions, middleware tools and related integrated technologies for determining best-fit data interchange and data integration. This position is a seasoned healthcare information technology professional, providing proficiency in programming and technical development of integrated solutions.

Key Accountabilities & Activities:

• Developing NEOM HIE platform and system/interfaces modifications and specifications; data mapping; establishing interfaces; developing and modifying code, functions, programs, routines, and stored procedures to export, transform, and load data.
• Meeting performance parameters; resolving and escalating integration issues; recommending adjustments as objectives change; provides consulting services to application teams, vendors and/or customers regarding how to integrate information technologies into clinical and business processes.
• Designing and evaluating new data interchange formats; improving physical design; rewriting data policy, standards, and procedures and transitioning such. Skills sets for an integration engineer include Interface Administration, Web Services, FIHR, HL7, EDI, FTP, TCP/IP, etc. using an Integration Engine(s) and/or middleware tools for configuration, scripting and programming, MS SQL and SSIS.
• Designs, codes, or configures, tests, debugs, deploys, documents, and maintains large and/or complex programs, using a variety of software development toolkits, programming languages, testing/verification applications and other tools, while adhering to specific development best practices and quality standards.
• Gathers business requirements, translating that information into detailed technical specifications from which programs will be written or configured, and validating that the proposed applications align with the architectural design and with the business needs. Drives process leadership for work groups, and product/service delivery strategy and work plans.
• Support the Digital Health Director in building and maintaining relationships and establish working relationships with relevant internal and external stakeholders
• Support in inter-sectoral meeting providing and gathering input as it relates to strategy, planning, risks, etc.
• Prepare relevant progress reports as required to update relevant stakeholders on progress
• Collate stakeholders feedback on issues, challenges and unmet requirements and develop action plans
• Act as the key sector representative in building and managing relationships with providers and counterparts (e.g., contract management)
• Ensure management is kept abreast of related developments, risks arising and progress
• Support in the development of business cases across multiple scenarios, including for business lines, subsidiary companies, assets, joint ventures, etc.
• Support in the development of the long-, medium-, and short-term financial forecasts for divisions and sector
• Ensure the sector financial model, including relevant scenario planning and modelling, is always updated
• Manage asset listings and related documents to ensure financial requirements for the proposed developments are aligned to financial forecasts and the greater health financing model
• Facilitate and drive effective and efficient sector procurement and contract management (incl. delivery vs milestones, support invoice payment, etc.) and close out procurement packages to release unused budget
• Act as single point of contact for finance and procurement to ensure sector requirements are efficiently and effectively met
• Support on all sector reporting requirements (incl. Ad hoc requests), ensuring the provision of accurate, appropriate and decision ready information
• Assist in developing the annual implementation plans. Work with divisions to monitor status (incl. progress, risks, and challenges), provide regular updates to management and complete related reporting
• Prepare reports for digital health director and sector head on the current and forecasted progress/completion of key assets and initiatives, with executive levels insights on key assets, requirements, and risks
• In the case of challenges or risks, support divisions or sector leadership in the development of pragmatic and considered mitigation measure and/or recovery plan
• Proactively identify risks for the sector (incl. Strategic, environmental, operational, reputational, etc.), assist in managing the respective registers and reporting, as well as working with leadership and management in the development of mitigation or management plans

Background, Skills & Qualifications:

• Bachelor s degree (Masters preferred) with five (5) or more years work experience as a Programmer, healthcare Interface Developer and Technical or Systems Analyst and at least two (2) years experience in integration/interface programming, relational database programming or relational database administration
• Technical expertise of integration standards such as FHIR, HL7, X12, FTP and other messaging standards
• Development Platform including HL7 and HIE development.; Rhapsody, Cloverleaf, E-Gate, InterSystems Healthcare (HIE) Technical knowledge of UNIX operating system
• Experience in healthcare industry/Clinical/EHR is a MUST
Experience with latest trend in HIE platforms implementation is a MUST

Qualifications:

• Technical knowledge of TCP/IP, networking, and other connectivity standards
• Experience in interface administration and MS SQL/SSIS required.
• Experience in technical applications, scripting tools, report writing tools, form development tools, and WEB development tools such as .NET C#.
• Experience in systems analysis and design required.
• Experience in distributed process, multi system environment and integrated network.

Roles & Responsibilities

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Position Summary
Location
Amman - JDC
When you work for us, you commit to a career at one of the largest and most prestigious professional services firms in the world. Looking for a rewarding career? Take a closer look at Deloitte & Touche ME. You'll understand that Deloitte is a Tier 1 Tax advisor in the GCC region since 2010 (according to the International Tax Review World Tax Rankings). It has received numerous awards in the last few years which include Best Employer in the Middle East, best consulting firm, and the Middle East Training & Development Excellence Award by the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (ICAEW).
In an international firm like Deloitte, our strong global presence is complemented by our local reach and market knowledge. A career in Financial Advisory Services with Deloitte Corporate Finance Limited will equip you with a deep understanding of the local and regional business landscape, enabling you to identify opportunities and risks to our clients businesses. In addition, your breadth of vision will be engaged, as you match our global resources to our clients advantage. Our FAS practice encompasses a broad range of specializations and services but whose common goal is to offer strategic services to clients throughout every phase of the economic cycle. With such a wealth of specializations, you will have the opportunity to pick the one most suited to you.
Our Purpose
Deloitte makes an impact that matters. Every day we challenge ourselves to do what matters most for clients, for our people, and for society. We serve clients distinctively, bringing innovative insights, solving complex challenges and unlocking sustainable growth. We inspire our talented professionals to deliver outstanding value to clients, providing an exceptional career experience and an inclusive and collaborative culture. We contribute to society, building confidence and trust in the markets, upholding the integrity of organizations and supporting our communities.
Our shared values guide the way we behave to make a positive, enduring impact:
Integrity
Outstanding value to markets and clients
Commitment to each other
Strength from cultural diversity

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Location- El Giza , , Egypt (EG)
Job ID -5770
We live in an era where technology transforms and influences our daily lives more than ever before; therefore, technological innovation is critical to our success. We are strategically leveraging technology in a variety of ways and one of them is by leveraging big data and AI.
In this position, your role will be to model complex problems, discover insights and automate workflows through statistical analysis, machine learning, generative AI and data visualization techniques using state of the art big data & AI technologies.
In this role, you shall work on a wide variety of problems such as:
• Using Generative AI for WhatsApp customer chatbot
• Building a chatbot app for internal corporate stakeholders using Large Language Models such as OpenAI GPT-4, Google Palm, Claude etc.
• Delivery sequencing and route optimization
• Address geocoding using deep learning.
• Incomplete address auto-completion using natural language processing
• Profiling and predictive analytics for customers, consignees, and shippers.
The role will cover the following areas of responsibility:
• Work under the guidance of senior Data Scientists to execute strategic keystone projects.
• Gain a thorough understanding and know-how of the on premise and cloud-based data warehouse and data lake.
• Continuously keeping updated with the latest AI and ML technologies.
• Extraction of relevant data from data warehouses such as AWS Redshift to be used for Data Science projects.
• Data cleaning and data imputation of unclean data.
• Performing a thorough exploratory data analysis and presenting results to relevant stakeholders for insight generation.
• Feature engineering relevant to the purpose of the Data Science problem.
• Create and evaluate data models using statistical, algorithmic, data mining, deep learning, visualization, and data matching techniques for data discovery and intelligent automation.
• Present and summarize modeling results and recommendations to business users and stakeholders in an understandable and relevant way, verbally and visually.
• Document and publish analyses, instructions, and code so others can replicate and learn from previous work.
• Educate the organization about approaches and analytical principles to support the organization in the application of novel data science and advanced analytical techniques.
• Lead or participate in development, testing and deployment of production -ready code.
• Prepare and present progress reports and results to stakeholders.
To be successful in this role, you will need to be at least:
• Pursuing Bachelor s in computer science, Operational Research, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Engineering or Natural Sciences or 1+ years of experience as a Data Scientist.
• Ability to write clean, documented production ready Python code.
• Most importantly an Inquisitive mind and the ability to independently ask questions, find answers, learn, and move things forward.
• Understanding of data analysis using the Pandas library.
• Knowledge of, and the ability to explain statistical and mathematical concepts and techniques for quantitative analysis.
• Supervised Machine Learning Algorithms like Logistic Regression, Bayesian Approach, Decision Trees, Support Vector Machines, Ensemble Methods, Feature selection techniques etc.
A few skills which would be good to have are:
• Demonstrable hands-on skills in using databases, manipulating datasets, data modeling, visualization.
• Understanding of advanced algorithms (i.e. Deep Learning) will be good to have.
• Understanding large language models and prompt engineering will be good to have.
• Good understanding of Unsupervised and Semi-supervised Machine Learning Algorithms
• Knowledge about optimization algorithms like Mathematical Programming (Linear/Non-linear techniques), Convex Optimization, Transportation Problem, Vehicle Routing Problem Simulated Annealing etc would be optional.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview **This position will be physically located in Kuwait in support of LOGCAP** GFEBS Data Technician monitors production compliance (work order response and completion) requirements in Maximo and transfers actuals (labor and materials) into GFEBS. Tracks any issues with scheduling directives and standards driven by Preventive Maintenance Checks and Services (PMCS). Provides support to PWD O&M and Environmental Teams with GFEBS analysis. Responsible for ensuring time and details are captured accurately during the execution of work. Responsibilities This position description is subject to change at any time as needed to meet the requirements of the program or company. Responsible for ensuring work orders are assigned to the correct work breakdown structure (WBS). Reviews Maximo data and reports for completeness and accuracy prior to export into GFEBS. Revises Production Control schedules and workloads as needed due to labor or material shortages, backlogs, priority changes, or other interruptions. Ensures 100% compliance with applicable PWS requirements and quality controls within the department and directorate. Ensures products and services are consistent with external and internal requirements and expectations. Interfaces with PWD Leadership and provides reports and data as requested. Compiles historical or other data and utilizes data and trend analysis techniques to predict future outcomes. Provides the GFEBS Analyst with oral, written, and statistical reports. Reviews production schedules, work orders, and staffing to determine workload. Collaborates with management, materials warehouse, procurement, and engineering teams to meet productivity standards. Monitors and analyzes work progress. Writes reports in prescribed format to identify trends and key performance indicators. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Education/Certifications: One-year related experience may be substituted for one year of education, if degree is required. Must have significant knowledge of Excel or CMMS asset management and maintenance software. High School Graduate or equivalent Must possess country of origin driver s license to obtain a Kuwait driver s license Must be CAC eligible Experience: Four (4) years of relevant experience. Solid background in automated data systems and automated processing data system input. Progressive experience in a Production Control arena. CMMS Maximo user experience required. Experience working in a customer service position and using automated processing data system are a must. Prior experience working in the US Military or a Government Contracting environment. Skills: Demonstrates a professional demeanor and works effectively with all levels of employees. Ability to exercise direction and good judgment and possesses strong organizational and planning skills. Ability to work effectively and exercise sound judgement both independently and in a team environment. Strong written and verbal English skills. Possesses advanced skills in creating databases and spreadsheets, Knowledge of Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook. Working Conditions: Must be capable of working in an extreme weather conditions with temperatures exceeding 120 degrees Fahrenheit. Indoor and/or outdoor environment with very adverse and harsh conditions (i.e., hot, dry, duty, desert environment with average temperatures of 30 degrees in the winter and 130 degrees in the summer months). Includes some industrial production environment conditions as well. Physical Requirements: Light work. Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 10 pounds of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects. If the use of arm and/or leg controls requires exertion of forces greater than that for sedentary work and the worker sits most of the time, the job is rated for light work. Employee use of personal protective equipment (PPE) is required for some situations. PPE includes, but is not limited to, head, foot, torso, respiratory, vision, and hearing protective devices. Must comply with all Fire and Safety Regulations and post policies. We are committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace that values and supports the contributions of each individual. This commitment along with our common Vision and Values of Integrity, Respect, and Responsibility, allows us to leverage differences, encourage innovation and expand our success in the global marketplace. Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
SUMMARY OF THE ROLE
• HR Analyst, Data & Systems
• Working at Dubai
The HR Analyst will be the lead in the journey towards Digital, Process and Data-Driven HR. This role will produce business-critical people insights to enable the business and HR to move faster and make better decisions by applying analytics and research to our employee data. This role will lead and drive standardization and automation projects in HR to improve HR efficiency and enhance employee experience.
WHAT YOU LL BE DOING
HR Data & Analytics Management
• Identify, analyze, and interpret trends, connections, links, and inconsistencies/errors in complex data sets and processes.
• Create a people analytics vision and strategy that will include data-driven support for HR and business stakeholders across the employee life cycle
• Confident in handling, structuring and analysing data Total Rewards Experience (Compensation, Equity, Benefits, etc).
• Proactively provide insights and recommendations to help drive decisions. Partner with senior-level stakeholders to solve their needs for data.
• Review processes to increase employee experience, achieve operational efficiency and improve productivity
• Review and ensure HR operational procedures and processes support business needs and add value.
• Lead HR technology initiatives including managing the budget for the implementation, and maintenance of HR systems.
HR Automation & Technology Adoption
• Integrate key HR systems/databases for analytics, tracking key metrics and automating high volume processes.
• Automate high volume/sensitive admin/HR tasks and processes to improve accuracy and efficiency.
• Proactively drives activities that are necessary for the success of internal customers in the adoption and use of HR technology and analytics.
• Implement solutions to HR related issues or processes.
• Partner with Global team on the data integration of HRIS systems to other company systems
WHAT YOU LL NEED
• 5+ years progressive work experience applying analytical methods to business problems, driving improved decision-making and outcomes; Regional and HR experience preferred.
• Extensive knowledge and skills in Excel and Power Platform (Power App, Power Automate), SAP HR, Success factor
• Skills in designing and developing business dashboards and data visualization in Tableau and BI platforms
• Ability to work effectively under pressure with multiple deliverables
• Strong presentation skills including building meaningful materials, presenting effectively to leadership and responding to questions on the fly based on in-role business context and acumen
• Effective interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to collaborate with others, and articulate complex messages and requirements.
• Must be well-organized and very detail-oriented.
WHAT YOU LL GET
• Become part of our values Love the work, Result Count, Take Care, Be Responsible, and Perform as a Team.
• We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for excellence and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality.
• We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.
• Mammoet offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as a hybrid working environment, attractive remuneration package (fixed/variable).
Join us on this exciting journey to revolutionize HR through data-driven decision-making. If you're ready to unleash your analytical prowess and elavate our organisation to new heights, apply now!
WANT TO KNOW MORE?
• Take a look at mammoet.com
#mammoetcareers
#HRAnlayticsjobs
#madeformammoet

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior/Lead Data Scientist Description
Job #: 90512
As a Senior/Lead Data Scientist at EPAM, you will lead a team and play a key role in designing, developing, and implementing machine learning models and data analysis techniques to support project needs. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will understand their requirements and devise solutions to address them effectively. Your expertise in data modeling, evaluation processes, and strong communication skills will be essential in conveying results and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
If this sound like something you d be interested in, we re looking for team members to contribute to an ambitious project set to revolutionize financial decision-making, focusing on developing an advanced application that integrates tax models, data ingestion techniques, and decision-making factors. Apply today and engineer the future with EPAM!
Responsibilities
• Lead a team to design, develop, and implement machine learning models and data analysis techniques to support project needs
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their needs and devise possible solutions
• Implement data modeling and evaluation processes
• Communicate results and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders
• Stay current with latest research and technology ideas; share knowledge by clearly articulating results and ideas to key decision makers
Requirements
• Proven experience as a Data Scientist or similar role, preferably in the financial sector
• Strong knowledge of machine learning models, data mining, and data analysis techniques
• Familiarity with tax models and financial calculations
• Proficient in Python and data science libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Scikit-learn
• Excellent communication and leadership skills
• Strong problem-solving ability
We Offer
• Competitive compensation depending on experience and skills
• Opportunity to work on leading edge platforms, working in a fast-paced, agile, software engineering culture
• Knowledge-sharing with colleagues from EPAM's global tech communities
• Regular performance feedback and salary reviews
• Opportunities for professional growth
• Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
•
• Some of these benefits may be available only after you have passed your probationary period

Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
• Applying your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data
• Exploring and adopting new data sources that improve efficacy of new credit models
• Understand how users interact with our products, and use those insights to drive product strategy
• Guide and enable product teams to measure things that really matter, when it comes to lending

• Drive together with the risk team a unified understanding of credit risk and loan profitability
• Determine how different lending products impacting user profitability, costs, and operations

• Use mathematics, statistics and computer science to extract knowledge and insights from structured, semi-structured and unstructured data in order to assist our clientele to make better data driven decisions.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Role Summary:
Data analytics managers are responsible for overseeing the data analysis efforts of their organization. They work with a team of analysts to develop strategies for analyzing data, identify opportunities for improvement, and implement these changes in order to achieve specific business goals.
Data analytics managers must have strong leadership skills in order to coordinate effectively with both technical and non-technical staff. They also need to be able to communicate clearly with all members of their team in order to ensure that everyone is on the same page regarding project objectives and implementation details.
Responsibilities:
• Initially, will focus to bring business value & insight in Supply Chain function, Production Planning, and segment Profitability.
• Management dashboard , Business insight / KPI.
• SAP modules support to business functions with focus on costing/profitability function.
• Conducting analysis on data to produce reports that help businesses make decisions
• Developing data models for specific business problems
• Coordinating with IT to ensure that current technology can support the department s goals
• Providing leadership to teams of analysts and helping them improve their skills
• Conducting surveys and focus groups to gather information about customer preferences
• Designing new processes or procedures based on findings from data analysis
• Developing training programs to help employees use data analytics effectively and efficiently
• Analyzing data to determine patterns and draw conclusions about business operations
• Communicating with top management regarding results of analyses and recommendations for action.
Qualifications:
• Minimum 5- 10 years of experience in in SAP and Power BI (Business Intelligence) tools.
• Bachelor degree in Computer science/commerce/business administration
• SAP & Business Data analytics professional .
• 5+ years experience in development of Management dashboard/KPIs in BI tool.
• In-depth experience in SAP table /data structure and business process.
• Ability to work efficiently to complete the assigned tasks.
• Good communication and time management skills
• Fluency in Arabic & English languages.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

RSA Business Intelligence and Data Analytics Senior Advisor
RSA provides trusted identity and access management for 12,000 organizations around the world, managing 25 million enterprise identities and providing secure, convenient access to millions of users. RSA specializes in empowering security-first organizations in financial services, healthcare, energy, technology services, and other industries to thrive in a digital world, delivering complete capabilities for modern authentication, access, lifecycle management, and identity governance. Whether in the cloud or on-premises, RSA connects people with the digital resources they depend on everywhere they live, work, and play.
For decades, RSA has pioneered many of the encryption, authentication, and identity federation technologies that still power the internet. And now RSA is transforming the industry yet again, paving the way for the future of digital identity through the RSA Unified Identity Platform; next-generation and hybrid and cloud solutions; the first ever and only multi-functional, passwordless hardware authenticator; and a frictionless, mobile-optimized experience for the modern workforce. If you are self-motivated and looking for a fast-paced challenge doing something that truly matters, come join our winning team! For more information, go to rsa.com.
Collaborate with team members for the purpose of collecting data and executing the company s mission, analyze business requirements, processes and recommending them to the executive leadership for implementation.

Job ID: RSABU004951

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

As a Real Estate Data Collector, your primary responsibility will be to collect and analyse real estate data, ensuring accurate and up-to-date information for the organisation. You will be responsible for visiting real estate offices and various properties, conducting surveys, taking photographs, and supporting the sales team as needed. Additionally, you will be expected to achieve data collection targets and provide daily reports to your direct manager.
In this role, you will:
• Data Collection: Visit real estate offices and various properties to collect relevant data, including property details such as size, location, amenities, pricing, licence/owner details and availability. Gather information through surveys, interviews, walk-ins and telecommunication.
• Photography: Conduct on-site photoshoots of different housing and office locations to capture high-quality photographs for marketing and documentation purposes. Ensure that the images accurately represent the properties.
• Listing Collection & Data Maintenance Targets: Achieve predetermined listing collection targets set by the organisation. Actively seek new listing opportunities through daily visits to the real estate offices and expand the database of available properties. Maintain a database of available properties with the agencies and delete/remove any unavailable listings.
• Sales Team Support: Facilitate the sales team by fulfilling their clients requirements. This may involve calling and visiting real estate offices, coordinating property viewings, collecting listings, photography requests and providing accurate and timely information on available properties.
• Reporting: Prepare and submit daily reports summarising the activities, progress, and challenges encountered during data collection and property visits. Keep detailed records of all interactions and maintain an organised database of collected data on the company's systems/applications.
• Relationship Building: Develop and maintain positive relationships with real estate professionals, brokers, and property owners. Represent the organisation professionally and ethically during all interactions.
• Use of company s product: As a data collector, you will be bound to use company provided assets and products while on the job for monitoring and reporting purposes. Desired Candidate Profile

• High school diploma or equivalent; additional relevant certifications or training in real estate or data collection is a plus.
• Proven experience in data collection, market research, or a related field is a plus.
• Valid driver's license and reliable transportation for visiting real estate offices and various property locations.
• Familiarity with local real estate market trends and regulations is a plus.One-year residential data collection and property measurement experience preferred
• Experience with CRM platforms
• Proficient in using digital tools and software for data entry, analysis, and photography.
• Familiarity with each project s requirements and the company's brand image, products, and services
• Data collection or database experience
• Strong organisational skills and attention to detail to ensure accurate data collection and reporting.
• Strong organisational skills
• Excellent Communication skills
• Should be punctual and flexible with working hours in order to match with the operating times of real estate offices
• Adaptable
• Strong attention to detail
• High-performing and fast-paced work environment.
• Comprehensive Health Insurance
• Rewards and recognition
• Learning & Development

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES & ACTIVITIES


• Support the NEOM Group CISO and Director in implementing the Data Protection Program (DPP) across NEOM's local and global operations. These include identifying emerging risks, defining policies and processes, performing data protection impact assessments, and promoting data protection by design principles.

• Assist in establishing the Data, Identity, and Access Protection Department, including developing frameworks, operating models, processes, and procedures based on pioneering techniques, global standards, and applicable legal frameworks.

• Contribute to developing the Data, Identity, and Access Protection strategy and roadmap for NEOM, considering diverse environments and technologies such as IT, OT, IoT, and emerging technologies.

• Support implementing the Data, Identity, and Access Protection program to ensure alignment with NEOM's cybersecurity strategy and objectives.

• Assist in building, operating, and transferring cybersecurity data and access protection solutions for structured and unstructured data, such as Data Discovery, Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Data Activity Monitoring (DAM), and Data Tokenization.

• Contribute to implementing cybersecurity rules, policies, and use cases on related cybersecurity solutions, such as Identity and Access Management (IAM), Privileged Access Management (PAM), DLP, DAM, and data discovery.

• Support the development of an encryption and cryptography strategy, including key and certificate management, to ensure data and access protection for data in motion and at rest, covering both on-premises and cloud environments.

• Assist in developing and monitoring a Data, Identity, and Access Protection Dashboard, including program progress metrics, key performance indicators, and key risk indicators.

• Supervise and support the team in daily operations according to the targeted service catalog for the program.

• Foster continuous integration between the business and the Data, Identity, and Access Protection function by establishing strong working relationships with stakeholders.

• Collaborate closely with stakeholders in NEOM sectors, regions, and functions to integrate data protection by design and default into strategic projects, business processes, applications, systems, databases, and services.

• Assist in documenting and assessing DPP risks in the business and contribute to developing strategies to manage or mitigate them in collaboration with business stakeholders.




BACKGROUND, SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge, Skills and Experience
• 8+ years of relevant work experience in DPP program management, processes, practices, technologies, risk management, audit, or compliance.
• Proven experience advising on complex data protection matters with practical advice
• Experience in risk management activities and practices.
• Experience in cyber security management and control.
• Experience working with or advising large, multinational organizations.
• Experience in telecommunications, technology, and professional services.
• Familiarity with cloud, telecommunications, IoT, data analytics, and machine learning technologies.

Qualifications


• Bachelor's or master's degree in computer engineering, Science, or Cybersecurity

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

IC is looking for a Full Time IT Security & Data Protection Officer to join on a Full Time basis under a Staff Agreement.

 

Job Summary:

The IT Security and Data Protection Officer ensures that information created, acquired, or maintained by IC, and its authorized users, is used in accordance with its intended purpose and according to the College and International policies. He/she will protect IC data and its infrastructure from external or internal threats and ensure that IC complies with International IT security standards and best practices regarding data protection.

 

Main Duties and Responsibilities:


Monitor the security platform adopted by the College to ensure data protection and defense against threats in cloud applications, cloud infrastructure, and the web.
Evaluate IT security systems and modules.
Perform periodic information security and cyber security risk analysis in compliance with international standards.
Develop policies and procedures related to IT security and Data Protection in compliance with GDPR and other international standards.
Monitor compliance with the organization's security policies and procedures among employees, contractors, alliances and other third parties and take corrective action.
Manage information security incident-response protocols, lead investigations, and suggested corrections.
Provide direct information security training as needed to staff, faculty, and administration.
Coordinate the development of the organization's disaster recovery and business continuity plans for information systems, and tests readiness.
Monitor changes in legislation and accreditation standards that affect information security. and data protection
Initiates, facilitates, and promotes activities to foster information security awareness within the organization.
Coordinate immediate response to imminent threats to the network from internal or external sources for the purpose of actively working to build healthy partnerships throughout the school to better serve our customers in meeting their business objectives.
Investigate reported breaches of security and coordinate mitigation or responses as needed for the purpose of ensuring the schools sensitive data is kept secure.
Work with the IT leadership team to review and develop security and acceptable use policies for review and implementation.
Work with Human Resources, Lawyer, School Security, and/or outside law enforcement agencies to complete investigations involving technology whether the issue is administrative or criminal.
Develop security training for the IT Department.
Work with the IT staff to recommend the acquisition, implementation, and administration of information system security hardware and software on School wide area networks, cloud platforms, and endpoints.
Perform other related duties, as requested by the Director of Technology.


 

Educational Requirements and Competencies: 


Baccalaureate or Master Degrees in information technology/management or a related information technology field. (CCE is preferred)
Possesses certification in information security such as CISA, CISSP, or similar.
Experience in project management and change management.
Extensive experience with Google Workspace.
Extensive knowledge of network infrastructure and cyber security.
Extensive knowledge of database applications and data protection.
Good presentation and communication skills.
High standard of ethical, confidentiality/privacy and healthy professional boundaries.
Proficiency in Arabic and English (oral & written).


 

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Deadline for applying: October 31, 2022

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Full-time faculty position in Artificial Intelligence/Data Science H/F
Pr sentation
The International University of Rabat (UIR) is the first university to have been set up as part of a partnership between the Moroccan State and the private sector in the field of higher education. This partnership allows UIR to work towards the attainment of its objectives: excellence in education, research and active participation in the socio-economic development of the region and the kingdom, at large.
The school of Computer Science at UIR invites applications for a full-time faculty position in Computer Science at the assistant or associate professor level. We are seeking candidates in Artificial Intelligence, and in particular in Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, and/or Generative AI, in the broadest possible sense including but not limited to theoretical foundations, algorithms, systems, software, and applications.
Mission
The successful applicant will contribute fully to both undergraduate and graduate teaching across the School of Computer Science program. The applicant will lead or contribute to the teaching of courses such as Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Data Analytics, Big Data Technologies, Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence, Data mining, the Internet of Things, Cloud Computing, Advanced Databases (NoSQL), Data Stream Processing/Analysis, as well as foundation courses in computer science such as Programming Languages, Mobile Development, Web Technologies, Operating Systems etc.
Research :
The successful candidate is expected to develop an independent and innovative research program aligned with the areas indicated above.
Profil
Candidates must have a doctorate, or be in the final phase of doctoral studies in Computer Science or a related field. Evidence of excellence in research and teaching is required. The position involves teaching in French and English. Salaries are competitive and will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.
