Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

OVERVIEW

Position
Director, Data Protection Administration
(aka the Head of the Data Protection Administration)
Sector
NEOM Authority

Division/Department
Policies & Regulation

Role Purpose
The NEOM Data Protection Administration (the DPA) upholds data protection rights in NEOM, Saudi Arabia, and has responsibility for regulatory governance over, monitoring and independent enforcement of the NEOM Data Protection Law and Data Protection Regulations. The DPA is led by the Administrator the role for which this job description has been created . In other regions, this role is often titled the Information or Privacy Commissioner.

The DPA is a component of the NEOM Authority, which is aiming to establish a new model for governance and set a new regulatory standard in the world. It will institutionalize the Authority of the Future, which is digitally native, adaptive, lean and also citizen and business centric.

Following NEOM s vision, the DPA aims to be a front-runner in the regulatory field of data protection, becoming the world s most forward-looking, digitalised, and efficient DPA. In line with this vision, the NEOM DPA should also be innovative and effective, adopt an outcome and risk-based approach, and enable responsible use of the world s most advanced technologies.

The Administrator will be an outstanding individual, who will provide executive and thought leadership, strategic direction for the DPA, and will be ultimately accountable for all responsibilities, powers and tasks conferred on the DPA by the NEOM Data Protection Law.

Through their leadership, the DPA will be at the forefront of regulatory best practice - delivering effective and practical data protection for individuals, whilst empowering responsible, ethical data use and accountable innovation.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES & ACTIVITIES


Developing function readiness and establishment
• Finalize the End-state operational model and future strategy for the Data Protection Administration

• Drive the establishment of the DPA to achieve the readiness criteria categorized into 5 pillars:

i) Regulations & Policies (Content)
ii) Regulators (People)
iii) Operational Systems & Tools (Infrastructure)
iv) Protocols & Governance (Oversight)
v) Stakeholder Interaction & Interface with Base Economy (Cooperation)

3. Develop/Review and implement a transition plan to end-state for all Department functions
• Ensure there is a phased transition plan for each department function to reach end-state model, using NEOM Vision principles: lean, efficient, and tech-enabled
• Track and communicate progress
• Manage the budgets and finances related to the established Authority in coordination with Finance department and key stakeholders


Core functional
Responsibilities

The Administrator provides executive leadership and strategic direction for the NEOM Data Protection Authority (the DPA) and is ultimately accountable for all responsibilities, powers and tasks conferred to the DPA by the NEOM Data Protection Legislation.
The Administrator makes decisions on issues of strategic importance to the DPA, aligning its activities to its aspiration of becoming a world leading, digital regulator. The Administrator will focus on an outcome-based and participatory approach using co-regulatory tools such as regulatory sandboxes.
Considering the strategic value of data and the opportunities that lie in accountable innovation and the use of emerging technologies, the Administrator will lead a strategy that fosters responsible and ethical uses of personal data and ensures high standards of digital transparency and protection of personal data, in order to drive growth across the NEOM economy.
Representing NEOM s long term vision of international regulatory leadership, the Administrator will build and maintain excellent relationships with key stakeholders including controllers, business service providers, innovators and entrepreneurs, NEOM and Base Economy Authorities, public interest groups, and international counterparts.
Key Accountabilities
• Oversee the implementation of the DPA s strategies, services and operating model, in line with its regulatory mandate
• Lead the promotion of NEOM s innovative data protection regime to all interested parties, including individuals, businesses, and other regulatory bodies
• Supervise the grant of exceptions or approvals for specific processing activities
• Provide executive leadership to the operations of the DPA s divisions including:
• Strategy & Policy
• Regulation & Enforcement Activity
• New & Innovative Tech Policy
• Base Economy Engagement and Stakeholder Management
• Be accountable for carrying out all powers and responsibilities under the NEOM Data Protection Law and Regulations
• Report the DPA s activities and significant developments to the NEOM Governor
• Coordinate and cooperate with relevant Base Economy (KSA) Authorities
• Create and facilitate advisory committees and bodies
• Coordinate development of regulatory strategy and annual public reports
• Enter into international agreements relating to cross-border data transfers
• Where appropriate, represent the DPA internationally, including maintaining international relations with other regulators and the (international) business sector, and identifying where the DPA can best contribute to data protection best practice globally
• Supervise the appointment of DPA personnel and manage their performance

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Aramco energizes the world economy.
Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer.
With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco s value to society.
Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom s vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.
We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.
Overview
We are seeking a Stratigrapher & Data Integrator to join the Northern Area & Offshore Division of Gas Reservoir Characterization Department
The Northern Area & offshore Division is responsible for providing detailed well data correlations, log-log correlation, mapping, and sequence stratigraphy, core descriptions, biostratigraphic, chemostratigraphic, and reservoir data, applying them in the construction of reservoir stratigraphic lateral correlations at field and regional scales; and finally, inputs to the reservoir geological models.
The Stratigrapher & Data Integrator primary role is to integrate different data, pick formation and reservoir tops, as well as producing, correlating reservoir internal layers, and associated mapping.
Duties and Responsibilities
You will be required to perform the following:
manage subsurface unit stratigraphy, pick and maintain formation and reservoir tops, and reads different geological data (data integration) to provide support for geological and sedimentological studies and operational decisions. Responsibilities will include:
Integrate variable data types
Describe of rock properties through petrophysical analysis.
Collaborate with other team members within a multidisciplinary group, which will include participation in well planning activities for designated areas in collaboration with the field geology team, geoscientists, and modeling in accordance with work procedures.
Develop new technologies and workflows to improve reservoir characterization, reduce development cost, and improve work practice.
Prepare/review reports.
Minimum Requirements
As the successful candidate you will hold a Bachelor s degree in Geology-Sedimentology, Petroleum Geology or higher from a recognized and approved program.
You will have fifteen years of experience in the field of reservoir geology, stratigraphy, and reservoir characterization, and stratigraphy.
Considerable prior practical skills and experience in reservoir geology operation, reading wireline logs, can define geological observations and pick correlative stratigraphic unites.
Full understanding of the principles and application of biostratigraphy, chemo-stratigraphy and sequence stratigraphy to siliciclastic reservoirs is required.
Sedimentology of siliciclastic rocks background is favourable
Previous experience in data integration for geological modeling purposes and the ability to use industry software (e.g., Petrel, Decision Space) is desirable for this position.
Ability and skills in working on different scales, field and regional scales is anticipated.
Experience with regional and prospect size structural analysis, seismic analysis, and basin analysis will be advantageous.
Effectively develop project work and manage progress, through work in team environment is crucial.
Prior experience in mentoring of junior geoscience professionals highly advantageous.
Familiarity with qualitative and quantitative micro scale analysis, including reservoir diagenesis modeling, and diagenetic influence on reservoir characteristics.
Core scale sedimentology and correlation to wireline log specifically image log.
Working environment
Our high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities we offer, and are remunerated accordingly.
At Aramco, our people work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, we are faced with addressing some of the world s biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, we invest heavily in talent development.
We have a proud history of educating and training our workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through our workforce development programs one of the largest in the world.

Job description
Department Overview:
Our dedicated Project Management Team at RLB is responsible for managing a project through from the initial planning stages to completion. Their main task is to break down projects into stages, taking responsibility for monitoring and managing the programme, cost, quality and risk of each stage of the project. We pride ourselves on the quality of our service to our clients and enjoy long term relationships with them.
We are a sector focused business actively operating and investing in Commercial, Residential, Education, Data Centre, Mixed Use, Sports and Retail clients and projects. Our Project Managers work in close contact with clients, advising them on financial matters, project risks, procurement and contract matters using our experience
Role Overview:
We are currently recruiting for a project management team comprising a Project Director, Project coordinators/schedules, QA/QC (MEP & CSA), HSE & Cost Consultant. The team will be mainly focused on a large-scale Data Centre project. They will join an existing client focused team and will be able to demonstrate a broad range of project/program experience.
The role-holders will be accountable for the delivery of a significant Data Centre project and prior experience of project delivery in this sector and/or mission critical sectors would be advantageous.
Job requirements
Key Responsibilities:

• Manage the team and contractors to time, quality and cost schedules.
• Respond to RFI s raised by contractors.

• Oversee projects from inception through to successful completion, manage multiple contractor relationships.
• Attend Client meetings where strong diplomacy skills are essential.
Person Specification:
The ideal candidates will have significant Project Management experience constructing Data Centres and/or other Mission Critical facilities (Pharmaceutical, Hospitals, etc). A proven track record in a similar consultancy or client environment and demonstrate a positive proactive approach to the role and will be committed to delivering customer service excellence, with good commercial results.
Essential:
• Bachelor s degree in respective field
• Further qualification or equivalent experience in respective field
• Project Management Professional qualification preferred
• A minimum of 5 years relevant experience post degree qualification
• Saudi Council of Engineers registered or ability to register
• Experience of providing professional advice on multiple build large scale projects specifically on Data Centres.
• Ability to successfully manage complex projects in a proactive and diligent manner within a highly demanding project.
• Client facing, ensuring a high standard of technical delivery with excellent communication skills, with diplomacy and management of client expectations a key driver
• Extremely competent and experienced, preferably with international experience
• Well organised, diligent, proactive, assertive, well-disciplined and commercially astute
• Excellent communication and presentation skills both written and verbal
• Excellent customer service, communication and client/external interface skills
• A track record of working with teams and managing projects by prioritising workloads and delivering to deadlines
• A team player with a can do attitude, outgoing, polite, patient, diplomatic, personable and flexible

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

As technology continuously evolves and more data become digitized, it s evident that data privacy is taking on greater importance. With the standards set out by the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and other privacy laws around the world coming into effect, organizations are facing the challenge to mitigate their compliance and regulatory risks and protect people s personal information. Successful organizations depend on their reputation for keeping promises, respecting laws and behaving ethically to maintain stakeholder trust. EY Forensic & Integrity Services professionals help organizations protect and restore enterprise and financial reputation. We put integrity at the heart of compliance programs to help better manage ethical and reputational risks.
Embracing integrity means doing what you say you will do, with unerring commitment. This can make it easier to attract and retain talented people and harness their skills to grow your business. A foundation built on integrity is critical because today s talent values purpose-driven organizations. It can also help you develop stronger partnerships with suppliers and work more effectively with employees, investors, regulators and influencers. Our integrated approach ranges from enhancements in areas of perceived weakness or issues including governance, controls, culture and data insights to full organizational design and structural implementation.
EY is looking for a Data Protection & Privacy Assistant Manager/Manager to join our Forensics & Integrity Services (FIS) team in our Riyadh office. Within this role, you will be able to apply your skills among a diverse portfolio of clients, which enables you to further expand your knowledge base within the privacy realm. This is an ideal opportunity to develop you career in the consulting space, to work on various projects, gaining exposure to a fast paced market with evolving challenges and opportunities and to support the development of junior team members.
Your key responsibilities
In this role, you will take part in managing and providing end-to-end support on all data privacy & protection projects, which includes being up to date with latest trends, including global data protection compliance regulations, policies, and procedures. You will also manage and lead client communications and regular status updates as well as ensure delivery of high-quality reports to the client.
You will assist in managing the financial aspects of engagements by organizing staffing, tracking fees and communicating issues to project leaders. You will also establish, maintain, and strengthen internal and external relationships. You'll actively contribute to improving operational efficiency on projects and internal initiatives and will consistently drive projects to completion, determining that the work is of high quality.
You and the engagement teams will support and implement a broad range of clients on multiple data privacy & protection areas such as:
Data protection gaps and maturity assessment
Data mapping and classification
Data protection impact assessment (DPIA)
Maintenance of records of processing activities (RoPA)
Data Subject Access Request (DSAR)
Data privacy target operating model, policies, and procedures
Privacy by Design (PbD)
Data retention, backup and archival
Data protection technology such as masking, encryption, pseudonymization, masking or tokenization
To qualify for the role, you must have
Bachelor's degree and approximately 8+ years of related work experience
Knowledge of designing and implementing Data Protection technologies
Experience in privacy and security risk assessment
Knowledge of data protection laws and regulations (International & GCC) and industry standards and frameworks
Experience in developing and implementing data privacy and protection programs
Knowledge of core Information Security concepts related to Governance, Risk & Compliance
Ability to understand client organizations and their business processes to effectively tailor to their privacy requirements
Effective communication skills with different stakeholders about data protection and privacy matters
Technical architecture experience integrating data protection software into clients' infrastructure
Ability to ensure quality in project deliverables and documentation
Ability to develop effective workflows, timelines, budgets for client engagements
Strong project management skills and experience in leading cross-functional teams
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills
Excellent troubleshooting skills
Excellent project management skills and the ability to prioritize when working on multiple engagements
A history of business development and team development success
Ideally, you ll also have
An advanced degree in areas of at least one of the following professional certifications such as CIPT, CISSP, CISM, or CIPP/E, CDPSE, Microsoft Certified: Information Protection Administrator Associate, or other relevant internationally recognized certifications.
What we offer
We offer a competitive compensation package where you ll be rewarded based on performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Plus, we offer:
• Continuous learning: You ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
• Success as defined by you: We ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
• Transformative leadership: We ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
• Diverse and inclusive culture: You ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

Roles & Responsibilities
OVERVIEW
Position
Data Privacy Business Partner Associate
Job Code
Reports to
Direct Reports
n/a

Role Purpose
The Data Privacy Business Partner Associate (the Associate) will operate as a member of the Data Privacy Office at NEOM Company, delivering a range of data privacy activities to ensure compliance with applicable regulations, and undertaking tasks to assist in embedding and maturing a state-of-the-art data privacy framework at NEOM.
The NEOM Data Privacy Office is a new function and is evolving rapidly to support the changing needs of the business. The Associate will be required to support the Data Privacy Business Partner in her day-to-day tasks as they evolve and will be expected to multi-task within the office in addition to focusing on the specialist areas set out below.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES & ACTIVITIES
Training and Awareness
• Assist in the execution of a data privacy training and awareness plan
• Develop materials for training and awareness on all components of the data privacy framework
• Support delivery of both general awareness activities and targeted training initiatives
Record of Processing Activities (RoPA)
• Work with all entities across NEOM Company to maintain the ROPA
• Assist with the implementation of procedures across all NEOM entities for updating and validating the ROPA
• Assist with the implementation and maintenance of tools to automate the ROPA process
• Ensure that the ROPA is maintained, updated and validated according to procedures
Data Subject Rights (DSR) Requests

• Maintain procedures for managing DSR requests
• Assist with the implementation of procedures across all NEOM entities for managing DSR requests
• Assist with the implementation and maintenance of tools to automate the DSR management process
• Ensure DSR requests are managed according to procedures
Stakeholder Management
• Handle inquiries and requests from stakeholder across all NEOM entities
• Build an effective relationship with stakeholders across all NEOM entities
BACKGROUND, SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge, Skills and Experience

• Minimum 3 years of data privacy experience in a global organisation (first or second line) with other commercial experience of process and change implementation an advantage
• Experience of working with multiple departments to support the delivery of team goals
• Experience in developing and delivering training and awareness initiatives in a regulated environment a distinct advantage
• Experience in drafting privacy procedures and processes (first or second line)
• Demonstrated understanding and application of data privacy laws and regulations
• Experience in implementing process changes and controls to mitigate risks and address regulatory requirements (first or second line)
• Experience in project management and change management an advantage
• Experience in building and maintaining a RoPA
• Good written and oral communication skills and ability to engage a variety of stakeholders and tailor messages to intended audience
• Good commercial awareness and ability to develop and implement practical compliance solutions which enable business objectives
• Motivated self-starter with ability to work on own initiative

Qualifications
• Bachelor Level Degree
• Data Protection certifications preferred or willingness to pursue certification on take up of role
COMMUNICATION - MAIN STAKEHOLDERS
Internal
External
GRC Departments
Business Departments / Privacy Champions
Communications Teams

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Reporting to : Chief Product Officer
Based: Dubai
Follow: You can find us on LinkedIn

Are you ready to be part of a financial revolution? Imagine a world where financial services are not just convenient but also accessible to everyone, where transactions are seamless, secure, and tailored to your needs. This is the future that Open Banking is shaping in the dynamic and rapidly evolving landscape of the MENA region, and Tarabut Gateway is at the forefront of this revolution.
We are currently live in Bahrain and Saudi Arabia. Soon, we'll be bringing our cutting-edge solutions to the UAE, revolutionizing the way people and businesses manage their finances. We're not just building a company; we're building a movement, and we want you to be part of it.
Saudi Arabia, Bahrain & the UAE lie at the heart of the MENA region and Open banking is the key to unlocking a myriad of financial challenges for the citizens of the region. From limited access to traditional banking services to complex cross-border transactions, our company is at the forefront of solving these problems. We're here to create opportunities where there were once barriers, to empower individuals and businesses to take control of their finances like never before.
As we expand our footprint across the region, we're seeking dynamic, forward-thinking individuals who are passionate about innovation and ready to take on the challenges that Open Banking can address. Join us in redefining finance, making it more inclusive, secure, and efficient for everyone in MENA. This is not just a job; it's a chance to be part of a transformative journey that will shape the financial future of the region. Embrace the future of finance with us, and let's change the world of banking together!

What you'll do...
As our Head of Insights, you ll be one of earliest hires and playing a key role in the delivery of this product line.
Our team s mission is to build, support, improve and scale our platform that ultimately provides a world class user experience. From high-end, responsive applications, to event driven microservices, our AWS hosted platform will enable a new wave of customer experience in the region. You ll be responsible for leading a product focussed team building data driven insight products with a focus on the lending and fraud space.
Our Technology team will be spent on designing a scalable and repeatable architecture. Products focus is on value creation through new features and enhancements in line with strategic business outcomes. Your focus is ensuring a delightful customer experience and long term enable new revenue streams for TG.
Initially hands-on and soon building and leading several teams, we ll rely on you to drive our insights based product domain and the open banking ecosystem, working with wider product teams to align and set best Product practices across TG s platform. You ll have experience supporting products through their entire lifecycle.
Combined with competitor/market analysis and data, you ll enjoy interviewing customers and prospective partners to identify product opportunities and validate hypotheses through discovery. You ll work with customers and stakeholders on research, needs, and translate these into requirements, a strategy, roadmap, and deliverables. You ll define key metrics to drive product performance and improvement. You ll support product positioning and collaborate with product marketing and wider teams on product documentation and collateral.
In turn you ll closely with our software engineers to deliver features from validated hypotheses. You ll be hands-on across the business planning our iterations, sprint planning, setting commitments and priorities. You ll need to ensure that products and feature development meet required regulatory specifications too.
You will be an active contributor to supporting team growth and delivery as we continue to create a progressive, modern Product function. We seek team players that have low ego but high ambition. You ll want to join a mission driven company, building a world class customer experience, creating a market leading technology culture and inspiring high performing agile teams.

What we need from you...
• Track record of designing and delivering innovative products either in a bank lender/FinTech lender/card issuer or lending software company
• Deeply knowledgeable of insight based financial products within banks, fintechs and telcos
• Experience leading a go to market product delivery
• Experience with strategies for acquiring customers, driving engagement and product usage
• Experience in setting and monitoring appropriate lending software KPIs by product line
• Experience being accountable for relevant lending product collateral
• Experience across the product life cycle including Product approvals, launch and rollout, Product change, margin and pricing reviews, Product review
• Experience in the design process, user research and user feedback to iterate on product, experience, and own decision making
• Knowledgeable of modern product discovery methodologies
• Innovative and commercially minded, passionate about creating products that reinvent or disrupt the industry
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Naturally cross-functional in approach, acting as SME support to Commercial, Ops, Technology, Compliance & Risk and Finance.
• Experience with local and remote/distributed teams a plus
• B2B background (SaaS) a plus
We don t expect you to meet every requirement so please still apply if you feel you are a match.

Join u s if you want...
• To work for one of the top FinTech s in the MENA region you will have the opportunity to work on meaningful and impactful projects that have the potential to change the financial industry.
• The chance to build a product from scratch and make a difference.
• We value collaboration and teamwork at Tarabut Gateway. You will be working with a talented and diverse team of professionals who are passionate about creating innovative solutions in the FinTech industry. You will have the opportunity to learn from your colleagues and contribute to exciting projects.
• To work with an incredibly talented team, who have experience of scaling open banking platforms in other regions.
• A competitive compensation package (base + equity) with reviews every year

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

We are currently looking for a Data Specialist to support the Amman-based REACH team.
REACH Syria is currently seeking a Data Specialist (DS) to manage the in-country data team and oversee data workstreams across the research units. Additionally, the DS will lead a data task force encouraging a collaborative and innovative data environment in-country. Data workstreams include the production of analysis products, including the preparation of research design, support in designing sampling methods, data analysis plans, data collection tools, data cleaning scripts and processes, analysis scripts, analysis outputs and (as relevant) production of web maps and information management systems.
Under the line management of the Deputy Country Coordinator, the DS, in close liaison with the assessment teams, engages with partners to promote their participation in data processing, analysis or relevant topics, to maximize the uptake and use of IMPACT/REACH research. When relevant, or managing a project, he/she also ensures an efficient and transparent use of resources required for project implementation. This can include the direct supervision of data and assessment teams during data collection, analysis or output production.
The DS will maintain the strictest confidentiality on all data collected and related processes, ensuring full compliance with IMPACT s data protection policy and SOPs. He/she will actively take measures to prevent the unauthorized sharing of any information and data belonging to IMPACT and its partners, or collected during his/her assignment with IMPACT.
COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS
• For this position, salary between 3 060 CHF and 3 240 CHF monthly (before income tax), etc as well as a monthly living allowance of 300 USD NB IMPACT salaries are strictly determined by our salary grid depending on the grade of the position and the level of education of staff. A location-dependent security and/or isolation adjustment is then applied as a recognition that some staff are required to work in difficult places where living and working conditions are much more difficult than elsewhere.
• Accommodation and food provided in the guesthouse.
• Enrolment in Swiss private pension fund (Swisslife approx. 9.975% of staff gross salary), health insurance, life insurance and repatriation assistance.
• Flight tickets every 6 months & visa fees covered (in-country travel costs and professional expenses are fully covered).
• Contribution to the luggage transportation: between 20 and 100 kgs, depending on the length of the contract (+ luggage and personal property insurance)
• Annual leave of 36 days per year. Public holidays of the country of assignment. Family/compassionate leave when applicable.
• Predeparture induction 3 days at IMPACT Initiatives s HQ in Geneva + one week pre-departure training in ACTED HQ in Paris, including a 4-days in situ security training;
• IMPACT prioritizes the psychological safety of its staff and the health insurance provided covers, among others, up to 1000 per year of psychosocial counselling fees.

Who We Are:
Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

If you are

• Experienced in selling ERP/RDBMS is a must, especially on SAP

Additional Skills:
Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Assertiveness, Bias, Building Rapport, Buyer Personas, Coaching, Complex Sales, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Customer Experience Strategy, Customer Interactions, Dealing with Ambiguity, Design Thinking, Empathy, Financial Acumen, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Identifying Sales Opportunities, Industry Knowledge, Intellectual Curiosity, New Business Acquisition {+ 6 more}

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

WHO WE ARE
Powered by Cenomi Group, we are a new and independent venture, focused on building the leading lifestyle e-commerce platform in MENA. We're a tight-knit founding team with diverse experiences and backgrounds, but with a united passion for creating inspiring solutions for consumers and retailers.
Join our mission to create a true omni-channel e-commerce to make selling, shopping and delivery simple and enjoyable for everyone.

The Tech & Data Lead - CX is responsible for leading a team of technology and data professionals to develop and implement customer experience (CX) solutions across the organization. This individual will work closely with stakeholders to identify CX opportunities, design and implement CX technology and data strategies, and leverage data to improve customer experience. The Tech & Data Lead - CX will also be responsible for managing a team of technology and data professionals, and ensuring that all CX initiatives are delivered on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.

Key Responsibilities:

• Develop and implement a CX technology and data strategy that aligns with the organization's business objectives
• Lead a team of technology and data professionals, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement
• Work closely with stakeholders to identify CX opportunities and develop CX technology and data solutions that address their needs
• Develop and implement processes for data collection, storage, processing, and analysis, ensuring data accuracy and integrity
• Leverage technology tools and techniques to improve CX, such as chatbots, personalization, and automation
• Develop and implement quality assurance measures to ensure that all CX initiatives meet or exceed customer expectations
• Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in CX technology and data, applying this knowledge to continuously improve programs and processes

Requirements:

• Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as computer science, information technology, or data analytics
• 8+ years of experience in CX technology and data, with at least 3 years in a leadership role
• Strong knowledge of technology tools and techniques used to improve CX, such as chatbots, personalization, and automation
• Proven ability to develop and implement CX technology and data strategies that align with business objectives
• Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, and deliver on-time and on-budget
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with stakeholders at all levels of the organization
• Experience managing and developing a team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze data and use insights to drive decision-making
• Up-to-date knowledge of industry trends and best practices in CX technology and data, with a passion for innovation and continuous improvement

Working Conditions:
The Tech & Data Lead - CX will work primarily in an office environment, but may also be required to travel to other locations for meetings and presentations. The role may involve working outside of regular business hours, depending on project deadlines and other business needs.

WHAT TO EXPECT AFTER APPLYING
We will review your application and will contact you if your qualifications match our requirements for the role by email. If you are not selected for this position, keep an eye out for future opportunities.
Our primary focus is to build a world-class collaborative team that values hard-work, authenticity and purposefulness and is focused on execution and making a difference (solving a real problem). Our setup offers the best of both worlds: start-up setup, growth and upside on the one hand, while being part of an established and well funded group with significant assets on the other.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Data & Analytics Technical Delivery Director Description
Job #: 90477
Are you an avid technologist who enjoys solving complex architectural and technology consulting challenges and solutions within the Data & Analytics space? Are you hungry to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and take ownership for critical technical and business decisions that directly impact EPAM and our clients? If so, then EPAM has a rare opportunity for you to join us as a Senior Data & Analytics Technical Delivery Director at Senior Manager or Director level in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.
This is a great opportunity for you to play a highly visible and leading role driving the Data Technology Consulting landscape whilst working closely with multiple clients and our Data leadership teams globally as we rapidly expand our presence in the country.
This position requires a fluent English/Arabic speaker with a strong data technical consulting background with the ability to assist clients in defining their overall technology strategy and delivery.
Responsibilities
• Lead Data & Analytics Technology Consulting and Architecture projects for a variety of clients in Saudi Arabia, working with the delivery teams in large scale complex programmes
• Lead initiatives, produce relevant deliverables and manage EPAM s Data Analytics offering and go-to market strategy across the region
• Drive engagements and major transformation through execution phases and where applicable, lead internal, client and third-party vendor mixed teams
• Stay abreast of current and emerging trends, unique opportunities and challenges of the space/markets and geographies in which the clients operate, and how it affects clients business and initiatives
• Undertake service design and continuously improve our methodology and consulting offering and lead implementation of the solutions from establishing project requirements and goals to solution "go-live"
• Engage client organisations at the executive / C-level, helping customers drive enterprise-wide agendas as well as external and internal partners to maximise growth within an account/client portfolio
• Responsible for shaping data solutions and properly scoping / pricing engagements, establishing optimal operating models and project team organization, and leading the transition from the sales process to the delivery phase
• Understand the full end-end product cycle, from product vision/strategy, user experience design through development and release
• Lead Practice development, driving and orchestrating transformation and product solutions, teams, strategic roadmaps, and continuous improvement/optimisation programs
• Support sales / pre-sales activities by assessing data opportunities, responding to RFP s, creating proposals and presentations, establishing relationships with clients and prospective clients, and helping to close / sign new deals
Requirements
• Fluent English and Arabic speaker with knowledge of working in Saudi Arabia
• Industry visionary, avid technologist at heart, with extensive technology experience in the areas of Data Analytics in driving large scale D&A transformation projects
• Experience in leading the Data Analytics consulting/architecture arm of a complex business
• Extensive experience developing and growing client relationships, leading multi-disciplinary teams, delivering end-to-end solutions and driving scalable enterprise initiatives
• Cloud data platforms, BI, data warehousing, data lakes and awareness of Cloud (Azure, GCP, AWS), Big Data, Analytics, Data Science technologies and trends
• Able to articulate the pros and cons of technology choices and solution design decisions and to construct and present rational options to clients and prospective clients on the options they have
• Confident in expressing points-of-view, making recommendations and presenting analysis and recommendations up to C-level where appropriate
• Ability to operate at the strategic level, yet being close enough to the details to add value to clients and be a real support to your team
• Proven ability to manage client engagements under pressure to successful completion
• Involvement in Pre-sales or supporting core sales teams in driving revenue and creating new opportunities
• Desire to learn and expand beyond your comfort zone whenever a new technological trend in the relevant areas arises
We Offer
• Competitive compensation depending on experience and skills
• Opportunity to work on leading edge platforms, working in a fast-paced, agile, software engineering culture
• Knowledge-sharing with colleagues from EPAM's global tech communities
• Regular performance feedback and salary reviews
• Opportunities for professional growth
• Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
•

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a dynamic individual to join our regional EMEA (Europe, Middle East and Africa) New Business Team in leading and winning regional pitches.
Job Title:
Data Lead, Media (EMEA)
Job Description:
The role
We are looking for a dynamic individual to join our regional EMEA (Europe, Middle East and Africa) New Business Team in leading and winning regional pitches.
EMEA is a large and complex region within the dentsu global business, spanning 50 countries and 7000 people delivering media services to thousands of local (country-specific), pan-region and global clients.
Working closely with local dentsu Media teams and the EMEA New Business Team, you will use your deep expertise regarding audience management and identity to deliver compelling, robust narratives that showcase the best of our expertise and capabilities to clients through both written and presented content.
You are passionate about the value that data brings to brand and performance media and have your finger on the pulse of both what is happening in the wider media and communications industry, and home-grown innovations within the dentsu network, bringing best-in-class thought leadership and real-world case studies to clients.
You are a team player and thrive in a time-pressured, competitive environment this role is all about doing everything you can to convert every opportunity into a win.
The difference you ll make
• Maintain and further improve our highly successful EMEA new business performance
• Deliver market leading data and audience content in pitches
• Mobilise the best talent in the network to deliver as a team
What you ll be doing
• Leading and evolving the audience data proposition for EMEA new business projects; ensure it is fully integrated with the overall pitch proposition, executable, clear, and easy to articulate at all levels
• Leading fulfilment of data and tech pitch deliverables across all elements of new business projects; commercial, written and presentation
• Working with global practice leads and data and analytics delivery teams to connect BAU delivery with pitch content
• Keeping up to date with industry media effectiveness trends
What you ll bring
• Outstanding ability to communicate complex concepts and data in a simple and compelling way
• Significant experience and passion for audience data, digital media and technology
• Deep understanding of the marketing technology landscape and the ability to consult clients on how to develop / leverage their stacks to develop audience-driven capabilities
• An influencer, able to communicate effectively at all levels of the company and with the ability to flex communication style and approach depending on the audience and outcomes required
• Very good listener
• Ability to manage and coach matrix teams
• Team player, high levels of drive and ambition you need to love the thrill of the chase and have a strong desire to win every project
• Thinking and doing the ability to come up with big ideas and to be happy completing detailed commercial submissions
• You thrive under pressure and excel in meeting short deadlines
• Diplomatic, able to develop strong relationships with key network stakeholders at all levels within the business and externally
• Capable of picking up projects and running with them
• Ambitious self-starter, able to spot ideas and inspiration
• European languages desirable, but not essential
• A technical expert and a leader, understands and operates using the Dentsu 8 Ways
•
As a leadership role, the job holder will also role model the leadership competencies:
SET The Direction
Shapes strategy, creates shared purpose and navigate change
GROW Our Talent
Nurtures talent, builds teams and fosters inclusivity
ACTIVATE Radical Collaboration
Connects & influences, Works as one and innovates together
DELIGHT Our Clients
Transforms client thinking, deepens client relationships and delivers meaningful progress
INSPIRE Others
Working with us
Joining dentsu international, you ll join a team of 46,000 people. It s an opportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you ll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures and experiences. We offer exciting challenges, memorable experiences and opportunities to shape your future.
Inclusion and Diversity
We re proud to be different and that starts with our people. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone. We won t define people by their race, gender, sexual-orientation, age or disability. Individuality is what makes us great, we want everyone to bring their full self to work and create something amazing. That s what we care about.
So, whether you re joining us, or looking to move to a different part of the business, we work hard to make sure we create equal opportunities for everyone.

London
Brand:
Dentsu Emea
Time Type:
Full time
Contract Type:
Permanent

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

In addition to providing the essential foundation for all Sciences and Engineering programs, and electives to the University-wide community, the Department of Mathematics and Actuarial Science (MACT) provides rigorous pedagogy to Mathematics majors, as well as its applied Actuarial Science and Data Science programs. The School also boasts graduate, Masters and Doctorates, in the Natural Sciences, Global Public Health and in Engineering, thereby providing opportunities for collaborative didactics and research. In that context, MACT welcomes applicants that are well-grounded in Statistics and Data Analysis and their diverse applications, with the flexibility to participate in the curriculum across various sub-disciplines, from freshmen to graduate.
For all positions, applicants should be committed to excellent classroom teaching and learning as well as demonstrating a strong research record (senior faculty) or a clear potential for research (junior faculty). Preference will be given to applicants who will contribute to the Department, School, University, and the outside communities in the field. English is required as it is the language of instruction at AUC. Research opportunities within the School of Sciences and Engineering and with colleagues across AUC are strongly encouraged.
Requirements:
Tenure-Track Faculty Position in Data Science
Applicants should hold a Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, or a related field. Applicants should be committed to excellent classroom teaching and learning as well as demonstrating a strong research record (senior faculty) or a clear potential for research (junior faculty). ?Successful applicants are also expected to engage in scholarly research as well as other professional activities such as external funding, applied project-based consulting. Preference will be given to applicants who will contribute to service activities to the Department, School, University, and the outside communities in the field. English is required as it is the language of instructions at AUC. Review of applications will begin immediately and continue until the positions are filled.
Additional Information:
Review of applications will begin immediately and will continue until the position is filled.

All Amazon teams and businesses, from Prime delivery to AWS, are guided by four key tenets: customer obsession rather than competitor focus, passion for invention, commitment to operational excellence, and long-term thinking.
We are driven by the excitement of building technologies, inventing products, and providing services that transform the way our customers live their lives and run their businesses.
Our mission: To be Earth's most customer-centric company
What unites Amazonians across teams and geographies is that we are all striving to delight our customers and make their lives easier. The scope and scale of our mission drives us to seek diverse perspectives, be resourceful, and navigate through ambiguity. Inventing and delivering things that were never thought possible isn't easy, but we embrace this challenge every day.
By working together on behalf of our customers, we are building the future one innovative product, service, and idea at a time.
Come build the future with us.

In this role, you re comfortable with, and understand, the changes to the conventions deployed in response to internal customers requests. You demonstrate ability to adjust your workflows accordingly and you prioritize strict compliance with regulatory requirements.
What we offer
Attractive and competitive salary
Possibility of career development within the company
Benefits package
Your responsibilities will include
Analysing data to identify trends.
Implement point fixes to address problems.
Perform root cause analysis to identify and escalate underlying issues. Desired Candidate Profile
Native-level proficiency in Arabic language (Saudi Arabia Najdi and Hejazi/UAE dialects): both verbal and written skills
Business English skills both verbal and written
Experience with MS Office software

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Position description:
The Data Scientist will handle the following roles/functions:
• Collects large amounts of data using analytical, statistical, and programming skills
• Responsible to use data to develop solutions tailored to meet the organization s unique needs
• Uses statistical and analytical methods plus AI tools to automate specific processes within the organization
• Helps the organization analyze trends to make better decisions
Duties and responsibilities:
• Design and develop a data warehouse
• Use appropriate tool to pull, merge and analyze data
• Analyze raw data by using statistical and mathematical techniques and computing
• Design predictive data models
• Address data analytics challenges (e.g. collect large volumes of data from varying sources, clean and interpret data, create solutions to overcome challenges, and communicate with interested parties)
• Automate and integrate processes
• Develop and maintain databases, and data systems reorganizing data in a readable format
• Build data visualizations and perform analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data
• Analyze local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry
• Prepare reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
• Troubleshoot the reporting database environment and reports
Requirements
Minimum requirements:
• Bachelor s Degree in Data Science or Computer Science (Master s Degree is preferred)
• Minimum Years of Experience: 3 in relevant field
• Experience with common data science tool-kits such as R, SQL and Python; familiarity with AI tools is an asset
• Experience with data visualisation tools, such as Power BI, Tableau, Qlik Sense, etc.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Data Scientists are professionals who use their analytical and technical skills to extract meaningful insights from large datasets. They apply statistical modeling and advanced algorithms to analyze data and solve complex problems. Data Scientists work in various industries, including finance, healthcare, marketing, and technology. They possess strong programming and data manipulation skills and are proficient in tools and technologies such as Python, R, and SQL. Data Scientists play a significant role in decision-making and strategy development within organizations.
Responsibilities
• Collect, clean, and preprocess large datasets.
• Analyze data using statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms.
• Develop models and algorithms to predict trends and patterns.
• Design experiments and conduct hypothesis testing.
• Create data visualizations and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and solve business problems.
• Identify opportunities to leverage data for process optimization and business growth.
• Implement data pipelines and workflows for efficient data processing.
• Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover hidden patterns or anomalies.
• Stay updated with advancements in data science methodologies and tools.
Requirements
• Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
• Strong programming skills, particularly in Python and/or R.
• Proficiency in SQL and database management.
• Knowledge of statistical modeling and machine learning algorithms.
• Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau or Power BI.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
• Excellent communication and data storytelling skills.
• Ability to work with large, complex datasets.
• Familiarity with cloud platforms and big data technologies.
• Continuous learning and curiosity to explore new data science techniques.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

• Requirements & Summary
Company : Saudi Aramco (ASC)
Skills : Business Analyst , IT - Analysis & Management
Experience : 5 + Years
Education : Masters Degree
Location : Saudi Arabia
Aramco energizes the world economy.
Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer.
With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco's value to society.
Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations' spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom's vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.
We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.
Overview
Digital Transformation (DT) is responsible for providing AI-powered solutions to various business functions within Aramco. The solutions leverage the latest technological advancements of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and analytics to create business values across the value chain. The DT AI&A organization will be a center of excellence in Saudi Aramco for Artificial Intelligence technologies and data science.
The data scientist primary role is to work closely with business functions, stakeholders, functional teams to give consultations on AI use case, identify potential value from data, formulate AI and data science ideas and conceptualize them. In addition, to building, evaluating and productionalizing models as appropriate.
Duties & Responsibilities
• Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions
• Mine and analyze data from company data sources to drive optimization and improvement of product development, and business strategies.
• Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
• Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
• Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize production facilities, revenue generation, and other targeted outcomes.
• Develop A/B testing mechanisms and test model quality and validate hypothesis accordingly.
• Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
• Develop necessary documentation as per established standards.
Minimum Requirements
• As the successful candidate you will hold a Master's degree in in data science, computer science, computer vision, applied mathematics or a related field from a recognized and approved program. A PhD degree is preferred.
• You must have at least 5 years of experience with hands-on data science, NLP, computer vision, and/or machine learning projects/products in industry.
• You must also be able to bring ideas from conceptualization to productionalization (putting models in production) using the right tools (e.g. mlflow, kubeflow, tensorlight, etc).
• Having very strong expertise in data collection, cleaning, preprocessing, and wrangling is a requirement.
• You must be fluent in either R or Python, preferably both, and familiarity with golang is a plus.
• Proficiency in visualization tools and packages; and in communicating data science topics to non-technical audience is a requirement.
• You must be experienced in Information Retrieval (Content Recommendation, Search Metrics, Search Query, document classification, entity recognition, topic modelling, etc).
• Proficiency in transfer learning and in fine tuning open-sourced models like BERT is necessary.
Working environment
Our high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities we offer, and are remunerated accordingly.
At Aramco, our people work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, we are faced with addressing some of the world's biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, we invest heavily in talent development.
We have a proud history of educating and training our workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through our workforce development programs - one of the largest in the world.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
The Sales & Operations Planning Division's (S&OP) charter is to optimize crude allocation and the operations of global manufacturing facilities in order to maximize revenue, increase profitability, and capture international market opportunities. The division also acts as the linear programming (LP) gatekeeper for wholly owned refineries and the integrated global MPIMS model, which is used for optimizing global crude allocation and exploration of new international markets and integration options.
Data scientist is to analyze and structure large amounts of raw live and historical data, build algorithms and solutions around the data to drive decision making within the company. This role will be at the core of the forecasting and predictive digital strategy of the company, to support the development of state-of-the-art solution for the Downstream Digital Center. In this role, the data scientist should be highly analytical, with strong skills in analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. The position requires in-depth knowledge of research, machine - learning, artificial intelligence and complex algorithmic development.

The data scientists will work as part of the Technical Support team of the Downstream Digital Center under Fuels. They will be working on developing solutions and algorithms for the whole downstream business. The solutions will have cross downstream entities scope and will be relying on a database consolidating all downstream entities live and historical data. The solutions developed will have a high impact, as they will drive collaboration and decision making, for day-to-day operations as well as long-term business development. The Downstream Digital Center Technical Support team will be interacting with all the downstream entities to collect their solution request. The Technical Support team will also be interacting and leveraging the other SAO IT and technical entities for support in developing the solutions.

Education & Experience Requirements
• Master's degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or related fields
• 5-7 years of professional experience
• Proficient with one or more programming languages (Java, C++, Python, R, etc.)
• Demonstrated experience applying data science methods to real-world data problems
• Experience utilizing visualization tools to take advantage of the growing volume of available information
Working environment
Our high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities we offer, and are remunerated accordingly.
At Aramco, our people work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, we are faced with addressing some of the world's biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, we invest heavily in talent development.
We have a proud history of educating and training our workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through our workforce development programs - one of the largest in the world.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
About the Company
This company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. The Upstream segment includes crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids exploration, field development, and production. The Downstream segment focuses on refining, logistics, power generation, and the marketing of crude oil, petroleum and petrochemical products, and related services to international and domestic customers. The Corporate segment offers supporting services including human resources, finance, and information technology. The company was founded on May 29, 1933 and is headquartered in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
Job Summary
This Company is seeking a Data Scientist &and Artificial Intelligence Engineer to join the AI Center of Excellence (CoE) within its Research & Development Center (R&DC). The AI CoE is responsible for accelerating R&DC s incremental and breakthrough discoveries and technology deployment using data science, artificial intelligence and digitalization. This important role e Data Scientist and Artificial Intelligence Engineer will be involved in multiple projects and tasks associated with accelerating the discovery of breakthrough technologies and solutions to resolve significant challenges in the hydrocarbon industry, and will complement existing experimental work through advanced digitalization solutions.
Responsibilities:
• Develop and use state-of-the-art machine learning techniques for predictive modeling.
• Propose data-driven insights, solutions, and designs based on experimental results.
• Accelerate technology discovery and optimize the performance of R&D solutions.
• Keep updated with the latest advancements in the field and publish technical findings in peer-reviewed journals.
• Promote awareness of the latest tools and techniques within This Company.
• Provide technical leadership to a team of junior scientists and engineers.
• Train and develop junior mentees.
• Organize and lead teams for specific projects and tasks.
• Manage discussions with internal and external project teams.
Requirements:
• This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
• PhD in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence Engineering, Computer Science, Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Physics, Materials Science or a related field from a recognized institution.
• Five plus years relevant experience.
• Strong background in data science, artificial intelligence engineering, machine learning, digitalization, and software development skills.
• Robust background in materials, catalysis, Density Functional Theory, Computational Fluid Dynamics, and/or exposure to process engineering preferred.
• Proven ability to use data science and artificial intelligence to accelerate the discovery of breakthrough technologies, generate surrogate models to propose new solutions based on limited experimental data, and work with experimentalists to validate these solutions.
• Strong record of publications in recognized peer-reviewed journals and presented research outcomes in international events preferred.
• Granted patents based on novel research results preferred.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description: A data entry specialist in Dubai, UAE, is responsible for accurately entering and maintaining data in computer systems and databases. They handle large volumes of information, ensuring data integrity, accuracy, and confidentiality.
Key Responsibilities:
Data Entry: Enter a wide variety of data into computer systems, including alphanumeric data, customer information, financial records, inventory details, and other relevant data.
Accuracy and Quality: Ensure high levels of accuracy and attention to detail when inputting data to maintain data integrity and minimize errors.
Data Verification: Verify the accuracy and completeness of entered data by comparing it with source documents or conducting periodic audits.
Database Management: Update and maintain databases by adding new information, modifying existing records, and performing data cleaning and validation tasks.
Data Confidentiality: Handle sensitive and confidential information with utmost discretion and maintain data privacy and security protocols.
Documentation and Reporting: Prepare and maintain records, reports, and documentation related to data entry activities, ensuring proper organization and filing.
Timeliness: Complete data entry tasks within designated timeframes to meet deadlines and ensure efficient workflow.
Problem-Solving: Identify and resolve data-related issues or discrepancies, working collaboratively with relevant stakeholders to address any concerns.
Communication: Communicate effectively with team members and supervisors regarding data entry tasks, requirements, and updates.
Process Improvement: Suggest process improvements and automation opportunities to enhance efficiency and accuracy in data entry tasks. Desired Candidate Profile
Job Requirement: Requirements: Education: A high school diploma or equivalent is typically required, but additional data entry or computer-related certifications may be advantageous. Typing Skills: Proficient typing skills with a high level of accuracy and speed. Attention to Detail: Keen attention to detail to ensure accurate and error-free data entry. Computer Literacy: Proficiency in using computer systems, databases, spreadsheets, and data entry software. Time Management: Strong organizational and time management skills to meet deadlines and prioritize tasks effectively. Confidentiality: Ability to handle sensitive information with discretion and maintain data confidentiality. Communication Skills: Effective verbal and written communication skills in English to collaborate with team members and follow instructions. Multitasking: Ability to handle multiple data entry tasks simultaneously while maintaining accuracy. Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing data entry requirements and systems. Problem-Solving: Basic problem-solving skills to identify and resolve data-related issues.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
About the Company
This company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. The Upstream segment includes crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids exploration, field development, and production. The Downstream segment focuses on refining, logistics, power generation, and the marketing of crude oil, petroleum and petrochemical products, and related services to international and domestic customers. The Corporate segment offers supporting services including human resources, finance, and information technology. The company was founded on May 29, 1933 and is headquartered in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
Job Summary
We are seeking a Data Visualization Specialist to join the Business Communication Planning Division of the Corporate Communication Department within HR & Corporate Services. Working within the Business Communication Planning Division, you will be responsible for creating compelling graphics, charts and multimedia visuals to enhance and promote the programs, reports and presentations of the division. The successful candidate will be a trusted member of the team, playing an active role to promote and support key deliverables by transforming data sets, quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals.
Responsibilities:
• Interpret business problems and develop technical solutions for data architecture, database queries, report layout, data visualizations and user interaction
• Work as an analytics partner, extending and improving the knowledge and capabilities of the team.
• Conduct quantitative and qualitative analyses of the data both independently and on teams.
• Communicate findings in written, graphical and oral forms.
• Work with stakeholders to understand their information needs and tailor the analyses to address those needs
• Create charts, graphs and visuals to make large and/or complex data more accessible, understandable and usable.
Requirements:
• This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
• Minimum two years of similar experience in a consulting firm, agency, or market research firm. Industry experience in energy, chemicals, industrial is preferred
• Education Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Marketing Analytics, or related field.
• Experience in data visualization, UI design and report development techniques
• Ability to work well in a diverse team environment and develop working relationships with multiple stakeholders
• Excellent visual skills, including demonstrable design knowledge, such as layout, typography, color, interaction design and fluency with tools such as Adobe, Tableau, Power BI, Excel, etc.
• Expertise with charting and other data visualization techniques.
• Ability to work quickly and efficiently under tight deadlines.
• Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail
• Strong interest in corporate communications, corporate reputation, and brand research and management, as well as predictive analytics and social media analytics.

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description: We are currently seeking a skilled Data Mining Specialist to join our team in Abu Dhabi, UAE, within the Information Technology (IT) & Telecommunication industry. As a Data Mining Specialist, you will be responsible for extracting valuable insights and patterns from large datasets to support business decision-making processes.
Key Responsibilities:
Identify and understand business requirements and data mining objectives.
Collect and preprocess large volumes of data from various sources.
Apply data mining techniques and algorithms to discover patterns and trends.
Conduct statistical analysis and predictive modeling to generate insights.
Develop and implement data mining models and algorithms.
Validate and evaluate the accuracy and reliability of data mining results.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to interpret and communicate findings.
Provide recommendations for process improvement and optimization.
Stay updated with the latest data mining techniques and tools. Desired Candidate Profile
Job Requirement: Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field. Proven experience as a Data Mining Specialist or a similar role in the IT industry. Strong knowledge of data mining techniques, algorithms, and tools (e.g., machine learning, clustering, regression). Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL. Experience with data visualization and reporting tools. Familiarity with data preprocessing and cleaning techniques. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. Excellent communication and collaboration abilities. Understanding of statistical analysis and predictive modeling concepts. Knowledge of big data technologies and frameworks is a plus. Fluency in English is required, Arabic language skills are a plus.

Position Overview:
We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Data Entry Clerk with proficient English skills to join our dynamic team based in the UAE. Previous experience in a data entry role is required. The selected candidate should be patient, meticulous, and preferably ready to start working immediately.
Key Responsibilities:
- Research Tasks: Conduct internet research with the aim of sourcing new suppliers

- Email Communication with Suppliers: Communicate with suppliers via email for routine inquiries, updates, and documentation.

- Communication: Collaborate with team members and managers to understand data entry requirements and address any data-related queries promptly.

Skills

• Excellent English language skills (both written and spoken)
• Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry tasks.
• Patience and the ability to handle repetitive tasks efficiently.
• Good organizational and time-management skills.
• Ability to work well independently and in a team.
