Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Requirements & Summary
Company : Saudi Aramco
Skills : Geologist
Experience : 15 + Years
Education : Bachelors/3-5 yr Degree
Location : Saudi Arabia
Aramco energizes the world economy.
Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer.
With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco's value to society.
Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations' spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom's vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.
We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.
Overview
We are seeking a Stratigrapher & Data Integrator to join the Northern Area & Offshore Division of Gas Reservoir Characterization Department
The Northern Area & offshore Division is responsible for providing detailed well data correlations, log-log correlation, mapping, and sequence stratigraphy, core descriptions, biostratigraphic, chemostratigraphic, and reservoir data, applying them in the construction of reservoir stratigraphic lateral correlations at field and regional scales; and finally, inputs to the reservoir geological models.
The Stratigrapher & Data Integrator primary role is to integrate different data, pick formation and reservoir tops, as well as producing, correlating reservoir internal layers, and associated mapping.
Duties and Responsibilities
You will be required to perform the following:
manage subsurface unit stratigraphy, pick and maintain formation and reservoir tops, and reads different geological data (data integration) to provide support for geological and sedimentological studies and operational decisions. Responsibilities will include:
Integrate variable data types
Describe of rock properties through petrophysical analysis.
Collaborate with other team members within a multidisciplinary group, which will include participation in well planning activities for designated areas in collaboration with the field geology team, geoscientists, and modeling in accordance with work procedures.
Develop new technologies and workflows to improve reservoir characterization, reduce development cost, and improve work practice.
Prepare/review reports.
Minimum Requirements
As the successful candidate you will hold a Bachelor's degree in Geology-Sedimentology, Petroleum Geology or higher from a recognized and approved program.
You will have fifteen years of experience in the field of reservoir geology, stratigraphy, and reservoir characterization, and stratigraphy.
Considerable prior practical skills and experience in reservoir geology operation, reading wireline logs, can define geological observations and pick correlative stratigraphic unites.
Full understanding of the principles and application of biostratigraphy, chemo-stratigraphy and sequence stratigraphy to siliciclastic reservoirs is required.
Sedimentology of siliciclastic rocks background is favourable
Previous experience in data integration for geological modeling purposes and the ability to use industry software (e.g., Petrel, Decision Space) is desirable for this position.
Ability and skills in working on different scales, field and regional scales is anticipated.
Experience with regional and prospect size structural analysis, seismic analysis, and basin analysis will be advantageous.
Effectively develop project work and manage progress, through work in team environment is crucial.
Prior experience in mentoring of junior geoscience professionals highly advantageous.
Familiarity with qualitative and quantitative micro scale analysis, including reservoir diagenesis modeling, and diagenetic influence on reservoir characteristics.
Core scale sedimentology and correlation to wireline log specifically image log.
Working environment
Our high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities we offer, and are remunerated accordingly.
At Aramco, our people work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, we are faced with addressing some of the world's biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, we invest heavily in talent development.
We have a proud history of educating and training our workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through our workforce development programs - one of the largest in the world.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary
We are seeking a Lead Data Analytics Auditor to join the Digital Audits and Solution Group of Internal Auditing at This Company. The Digital Audits and Solution Group is responsible for augmenting Internal Auditing capabilities with high-quality data analytics and ad hoc data analytics based on audits objectives using tools like ACL and Alteryx. The Lead Data Analytics Auditor s primary role is to create and sustain an effective system of data analytics and models which provides an enhanced insight into risks and controls. The successful candidate will establish efficient/automated means to analyze and test large volumes of data for outliers, irregularities, patterns, trends and evaluate the appropriateness and effectiveness of controls. Assist in compiling and analyzing statistical data for audit planning, Audit fieldwork & Reporting. Perform sustainable analytical tests of controls by obtaining and analyzing audit evidence, preparing audit workpapers, evaluating test results, and drawing conclusions on the adequacy and effectiveness of controls. Identify, design, and develop data analytics procedures to support audit activities performed by the Internal Audit team. Use data analysis tools to automate audit testing and develop advanced analytics techniques for risk assessment, audit automation and analyzing large volumes of data. Work in assigned audit/project teams and report to management to identify appropriate data sources, data elements required for analytics. Applying professional judgement to identify assess & implement data extraction from multiple business sources and ensuring accuracy of implemented reports. Interact collaborate and contribute with Internal Audit team members in working towards accomplishing departmental goals.
Responsibilities:
• Perform data gathering and data cleaning.
• Perform statistical hypothesis and analysis of structured data and unstructured data to gain insights and detect anomalies.
• Assist in the development of machine learning modelling and evaluation.
• Develop predictive analytics utilizing data mining, statistics, modelling, machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to analyses current data to make future predictions.
• Assess effectiveness, performance and accuracy of data models.
• Perform testing, deployment and maintenance of predictive models.
• Design, execute, document and report on audit testing.
• Identify key business processes for identifying and assessing current and emerging risks.
• You must mentor new employees joining the Data Analysis team.
Requirements:
• Willing to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
• Bachelor s degree or higher in Computer science, Computer Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Analytics and Data science, Mathematics and Statistics, Management Information Systems, Business Management, Accounting or a relevant field.
• 7+ years of experience in relevant areas of Data Analytics, Audit Reporting & Advanced data analytics. You shall apply your extensive experience in understanding complex SAP business processes & identification of underlying table structures.
• Exhibit acumen to understand, identify & implement new tools and technologies as required by advancement roadmap of Internal audit systems & technologies.
• Hold at least one professional certification such as CIA, CISA, CAP, ACDA or any relevant certification related to data analytics/data science.
• Demonstrate excellent oral and written communications in the English language, and excellent presentation and interpersonal skills.

Use data analysis tools to automate audit testing and develop advanced analytics techniques for risk assessment, audit automation and analyzing large volumes of data. Work in assigned audit/project teams and report to management to identify appropriate data sources, data elements required for analytics. Applying professional judgement to identify assess & implement data extraction from multiple business sources and ensuring accuracy of implemented reports. Interact collaborate and contribute with Internal Audit team members in working towards accomplishing departmental goals.
Responsibilities:
• Perform data gathering and data cleaning.
• Perform statistical hypothesis and analysis of structured data and unstructured data to gain insights and detect anomalies.
• Assist in the development of machine learning modelling and evaluation.
• Develop predictive analytics utilizing data mining, statistics, modelling, machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to analyses current data to make future predictions.
• Assess effectiveness, performance and accuracy of data models.
• Perform testing, deployment and maintenance of predictive models.
• Design, execute, document and report on audit testing.
• Identify key business processes for identifying and assessing current and emerging risks.
• You must mentor new employees joining the Data Analysis team.
Requirements:
• Willing to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
• Bachelor s degree or higher in Computer science, Computer Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Analytics and Data science, Mathematics and Statistics, Management Information Systems, Business Management, Accounting or a relevant field.
• 7+ years of experience in relevant areas of Data Analytics, Audit Reporting & Advanced data analytics. You shall apply your extensive experience in understanding complex SAP business processes & identification of underlying table structures.
• Exhibit acumen to understand, identify & implement new tools and technologies as required by advancement roadmap of Internal audit systems & technologies.
• Hold at least one professional certification such as CIA, CISA, CAP, ACDA or any relevant certification related to data analytics/data science.
• Demonstrate excellent oral and written communications in the English language, and excellent presentation and interpersonal skills.

About the Company
This company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. The Upstream segment includes crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids exploration, field development, and production. The Downstream segment focuses on refining, logistics, power generation, and the marketing of crude oil, petroleum and petrochemical products, and related services to international and domestic customers. The Corporate segment offers supporting services including human resources, finance, and information technology. The company was founded on May 29, 1933 and is headquartered in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

Job Description
The Financial Controller is responsible for overseeing the accounting and financial functions of an organization. They ensure the accuracy and integrity of financial records, monitor financial performance, and provide management with insights and analysis to support decision-making. The Financial Controller plays a crucial role in maintaining strong financial control and driving operational efficiency.
Responsibilities
• Manage day-to-day accounting operations, ensuring accuracy and compliance.
• Oversee the preparation of financial statements, reports, and budgets.
• Monitor and analyze financial performance, providing insights and recommendations.
• Develop and implement internal controls and financial policies.
• Manage the relationship with external auditors and ensure timely completion of audits.
• Coordinate the preparation of tax filings and compliance with tax regulations.
• Optimize cash flow management, forecasting, and working capital.
• Lead and develop the accounting team, fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or a related field. CPA certification preferred.
• Proven experience as a Financial Controller or in a similar role.
• In-depth knowledge of accounting principles, financial reporting, and regulations.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent leadership and communication abilities.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

This major international law firm has an excellent new opportunity for an ambitious mid- to senior-level data protection focused lawyer to join their busy and thriving IP & Technology practice in Dubai. The role will focus on supporting a variety of major clients with an emphasis on data protection compliance programmes for both private and public organisations, as well as assisting on large-scale IT outsourcing and digital transformation matters, and advising on new and evolving data protection regimes.

 A full range of sectors are covered by their highly-rated practice including finance, health, transport, entertainment, consumer goods, media and sport. Within an established and thriving setup, you'll play a key role in developing ongoing relationships with an existing client base, while also be actively involved in identifying and pitching for new opportunities. This is a dynamic team where you'll have every opportunity to truly excel and make your mark. You'll can expect immediate and high-level responsibility within a supportive and collaborative environment, across a varied and interesting mix of project, transactional and strategic advisory work, and working closely with the firm's leading Dubai IP/Tech lawyers as well as DP specialists in other international offices, whilst also supporting the development of more junior team members.

 Applicants should ideally be UK or Commonwealth qualified lawyers, with high-level experience, gained from either a well-recognised IP and Technology law firm or in-house with a major international company. The firm are keen to receive applications both from people looking to relocate, or to move within the Dubai market from another local practice. Don't miss this excellent UAE opportunity - please apply now for details!

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

• Part of a world-leading innovation hub
• Progressive environment and opportunity to apply leading global practices
About Our Client
Ambitious development initiative located in the North of Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. It is designed to create a technologically advanced and sustainable city with a strong focus on innovation and economic diversification. This project encompasses various sectors, including technology, renewable energy, biotechnology, tourism, and entertainment. It is expected to play a pivotal role in the country's long-term economic and strategic goals.
Job Description
• Develop and maintain Data Privacy Policy, procedures, and guidance for implementing data privacy practices, including templates and tooling support.
• Continuously review and update the Data Privacy Programme in response to changes in data privacy laws and shifts in operational model.
• Plan and execute the transition of Data Privacy Strategy from a centralised to a decentralised model over a 5-year period.
• Create customised data privacy strategies for specific target sectors to facilitate the transition to a decentralised privacy framework.
• Provide expertise and support to the Privacy Data Protection Officer (PDPO) and functional entities within the organisation to ensure compliance with data privacy obligations.
• Develop, implement, and operate procedures for reporting key information to the Board of Directors and relevant data privacy regulatory authorities.
• Respond to information requests and inquiries from stakeholders, including regulatory bodies.
• Conduct risk assessments, identifying potential threats and opportunities, and formulate risk mitigation measures, with a focus on compliance with global privacy laws due to the expanding international presence.
• Play a crucial role in devolving operational responsibility for data privacy from the Data Privacy Office as per the evolving operational model.
The Successful Applicant
A successful candidate for this role should have over a decade of data privacy, data protection, or compliance experience, along with in-depth knowledge of data privacy laws across various regimes. They should possess leadership experience as a Data Protection/Privacy Officer, proficiency in designing Data Privacy Frameworks, and a track record of interacting with regulatory authorities. Additionally, the candidate should demonstrate a strong understanding of effective Data Privacy Program requirements, the ability to assess regulatory risks and align them with business needs, offer strategic guidance, adapt to diverse industries, communicate effectively with C-Suite stakeholders, and possess excellent analytical, problem-solving, and report writing skills. Fluency in written and verbal English is essential.
What's on Offer
A promising career track with a renowned organisation and an attractive compensation package with best in class benefits

Requirements & Summary

Education : High School/Secondary
Employment Type : Full Time Contractor

Job Title:
Testing Data Acquisition (TDA) Specialist.
We are seeking a dedicated Testing Data Acquisition Specialist to join our dynamic team within the oil and gas sector. This position entails the rigging up, operation, and maintenance of Data Acquisition Systems (DAS) and Emergency Shutdown Systems (ESD) to ensure accurate and reliable data collection. If you possess the necessary skills and qualifications, along with a strong commitment to safety and compliance, we invite you to apply.
Responsibilities:
Rig up, operate, and maintain Data Acquisition Systems (DAS) and Emergency Shutdown Systems (ESD) at wellsite locations.
Provide timely and accurate data to wellsite drilling engineers upon request.
Collaborate with wellsite teams to ensure seamless integration of data acquisition systems.
Troubleshoot and resolve any issues or malfunctions related to data acquisition systems.
Adhere to company safety standards and procedures.
Maintain and update documentation related to data acquisition systems and activities.
Minimum Training Requirements:
H2S (Hydrogen Sulfide) Training.
CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation) Certification.
First Aid Training.
Permit to Work Certification.
Medical Certificate.
Familiarity with company safety standards and protocols.
Qualifications:
Relevant experience in data acquisition within the oil and gas industry.
Strong technical knowledge of Data Acquisition Systems (DAS) and Emergency Shutdown Systems (ESD).
Proficient in troubleshooting and maintenance of data acquisition systems.
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to work effectively in a team and communicate well with wellsite drilling engineers.
Familiarity with safety procedures and adherence to industry regulations.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Leading retail company with a strong commitment to providing exceptional products and services to customers looking to appoint a head of data protection.
Job Summary: As the Head of Data Protection, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of data protection and privacy compliance within organization. Your primary focus will be to establish and maintain effective data protection policies, practices, and procedures to safeguard sensitive customer information and ensure compliance with relevant data protection regulations.
Key Responsibilities:
• Develop and implement comprehensive data protection policies and procedures in alignment with local and international data protection laws and regulations.
• Ensure that data processing activities are conducted in accordance with applicable data protection standards, including GDPR, CCPA, and other relevant regulations.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to conduct data protection impact assessments (DPIAs) and ensure data privacy considerations are integrated into all business processes.
• Oversee and provide guidance on data subject access requests (DSARs) and data breaches, ensuring timely and appropriate responses.
• Monitor changes in data protection laws and regulations and update company policies and practices accordingly.
• Conduct regular data protection training for employees and raise awareness of data privacy principles throughout the organization.
• Act as the primary point of contact for data protection authorities and ensure timely reporting of any data protection incidents or breaches.
• Conduct internal audits to assess data protection compliance and work with teams to address any identified areas of improvement.
• Collaborate with IT and cybersecurity teams to implement necessary technical measures to enhance data protection and security.
Requirements:
• Proven experience in data protection management, preferably in a retail or consumer-oriented organization.
• Strong understanding of relevant data protection regulations and frameworks (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
• Certified Data Protection Officer (CIPP/E, CIPM, or equivalent) credentials are highly desirable.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
• Demonstrated leadership and people management skills to guide and mentor a team of data protection professionals.
• Highly analytical with the ability to assess and mitigate data privacy risks effectively.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Our client is a well-financed new Data Center business currently operating in stealth mode. They are looking to rollout data centers across Saudi Arabia, the wider MEA and APAC.
As the Senior Project Development Executive, you will be responsible for management of the entire development lifecycle of data center projects, from the initial site
identification to the commencement of construction. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in successfully developing data center projects, demonstrating a deep understanding of the
industry, project management methodologies, and technical requirements.
The Senior Project Development Executive will be the overall development lead of one or more data centers and will in this position work closely and coordinate with the sales, technical, legal,
financial, strategy, and other relevant teams of the Company.
Responsibilities:
Lead the end-to-end development process for data center projects, from inception to construction start, ensuring adherence to budget, timeline, and quality objectives.
Identify potential sites for data center development, conduct feasibility studies, and collaborate with the technical, legal and financial teams to evaluate and secure land rights over suitable properties.
Manage relationships with external stakeholders, including landowners, real estate brokers, government agencies, utilities and optic fiber providers, to facilitate smooth project execution; coordinate with the strategy team on relationships with government agencies.
Conduct comprehensive due diligence on potential sites, including zoning, environmental assessments, permitting requirements, and utility infrastructure availability.
Lead the preparation and submission of permit applications, working closely with regulatory authorities to obtain necessary approvals and permits.
Collaborate with internal teams, such as engineering, design, and construction, to develop and refine project requirements, ensuring alignment with business objectives, industry
best practices and customer requirements.
Manage and oversee in cooperation with other teams (including technical, financial, legal), the tendering and selection process for contractors, consultants, and vendors,
ensuring competitive pricing and adherence to quality standards.
Cooperate with the technical team to:
Assess the power and water requirements of the data center.
Evaluate and implement sustainable energy solutions, such as renewable energy sources and energy-efficient technologies, to optimize power consumption and
reduce environmental impact.
Evaluate and implement sustainable cooling solutions, to optimize power and water consumption and reduce environmental impact.
Procure power and water resources for the data center project, ensuring reliable and cost- effective supply, in cooperation with the technical team.
Procure optic fiber connections, in cooperation with the technical team.
Manage the Environmental and Social Impact Assessment and any other ESG requirements for a project.
Coordinate with the sales team on any sales-related matters that have to be considered during the data center development process, including customer requirements.
Coordinate with the technical, sales and financial teams to build the assumptions for the financial model.
Coordinate with the financial team with respect to building the financial model and with respect to the financing of the data center projects.
Coordinate with the strategy team on stakeholder management.
Work and coordinate with co-developers / co-shareholders during the development of the data center.
Prepare and manage project budgets, track expenses, and optimize costs throughout the development process.
Develop and maintain project schedules, ensuring timely completion of milestones and proactively identifying and mitigating potential delays or risks.
Monitor progress of the development.
Act as the primary point of contact for internal and external project stakeholders, providing regular updates on project status, milestones, and key deliverables with respect
to a data center project.
Foster a collaborative and high-performance project team culture, providing guidance, mentorship, and support to team members as needed.
Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data center development, incorporating innovative solutions into project strategies and processes.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master s degree in engineering, project management or a related field, or equivalent and relevant experience.
10-15 years of progressive experience in critical infrastructure project development, with a strong focus on data center projects (build to suit or colocation for hyperscalers) for at
least three years.
Demonstrated experience in successfully delivering data center projects from origination to construction start.
Proven track record in site identification, land rights acquisition, due diligence processes, permitting, infrastructure procurement, power and water procurement and other aspects
related to project development.
Deep knowledge of data center industry trends, design principles, and infrastructure requirements.
Good understanding of construction practices, customer requirements, and regulatory requirements related to data center development.
Ability to think with and challenge the technical teams with respect to data center design and optimization.
Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively.
Proficient in project management software and tools for budgeting, scheduling, and reporting.
Experience in data center sales to hyperscalers, corporates and/or government agencies is a plus.
Strong negotiation and contract management skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and external stakeholders.
Results-oriented mindset with a focus on delivering projects on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Prevention is better than cure. If you don t want others to hack your system, then upgrade it before they do.
An International Telecommunication Company located in Beirut is looking for a Data Protection Officer (DPO) .
We are searching for an experienced Data Protection Officer (DPO) to join our team and guarantee that all data protection standards and best practices are followed.
As a Data Protection Officer (DPO), you will be in charge of securing our company s data and ensuring compliance with privacy requirements. Your understanding and proactive approach will help us retain trust and respect the privacy rights of persons whose data we manage.
Responsibilities:
• Develop and administer a comprehensive data security program that complies with all applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards.
• Conduct privacy impact assessments (PIAs) to detect and analyze the impact of data processing activities on individuals privacy rights.
• Develop and implement data protection policies, practices, and guidelines to ensure compliance with applicable privacy laws such as GDPR, CCPA, and other regional data protection standards.
• Act as the principal point of contact for all internal and external enquiries about data protection.
• Work with cross-functional teams to give data protection information and support, such as data processing and sharing agreements and permission mechanisms.
• Monitor and review the data security procedures of the organization, finding opportunities for improvement and suggesting corrective actions.
• Conduct regular audits and reviews to ensure that data security rules and procedures are followed.
• Employees should be taught and informed on data security rules, policies, and best practices.
• Respond to requests for individual data subject access and other data protection-related inquiries.
• Coordinate with regulatory authorities and data protection oversight groups as appropriate.
Qualifications:
• Monitor and review the data security procedures of the organization, finding opportunities for improvement and suggesting corrective actions.
• Conduct regular audits and reviews to ensure that data security rules and procedures are followed.
• Employees should be taught and informed on data security rules, policies, and best practices.
• Respond to requests for individual data subject access and other data protection-related inquiries.
• Coordinate with regulatory authorities and data protection oversight groups as appropriate.
• Understanding of relevant regulations and standards, such as ISO 27018, ISO 27701, or industry-specific requirements.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are necessary, as well as the ability to recognize complicated privacy risks and design effective mitigation strategies.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are essential to properly communicate data protection standards and policies to stakeholders at all organizational levels.
• The ability to work independently and multitask while prioritizing assignments to meet deadlines.
• Certifications such as Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP) or Certified Data Protection Officer (CDPO) are in great demand.
Benefits:
Attractive Salary + Medical Insurance + Bonuses

Roles & Responsibilities
Salary from 150,000 - 180,000 per annum + Bonus & Benefits (Tax Free)
This major international law firm has an excellent new opportunity for an ambitious mid- to senior-level data protection focused lawyer to join their busy and thriving IP & Technology practice in Dubai. The role will focus on supporting a variety of major clients with an emphasis on data protection compliance programmes for both private and public organisations, as well as assisting on large-scale IT outsourcing and digital transformation matters, and advising on new and evolving data protection regimes. A full range of sectors are covered by their highly-rated practice including finance, health, transport, entertainment, consumer goods, media and sport. Within an established and thriving setup, you'll play a key role in developing ongoing relationships with an existing client base, while also be actively involved in identifying and pitching for new opportunities. This is a dynamic team where you'll have every opportunity to truly excel and make your mark. You'll can expect immediate and high-level responsibility within a supportive and collaborative environment, across a varied and interesting mix of project, transactional and strategic advisory work, and working closely with the firm's leading Dubai IP/Tech lawyers as well as DP specialists in other international offices, whilst also supporting the development of more junior team members. Applicants should ideally be UK or Commonwealth qualified lawyers, with high-level experience, gained from either a well-recognised IP and Technology law firm or in-house with a major international company. The firm are keen to receive applications both from people looking to relocate, or to move within the Dubai market from another local practice. Don't miss this excellent UAE opportunity - please apply now for details!

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description Overview
The purpose of the role is to:
• Serve as an expert within DMO with knowledge on in MTD process and other specifics to the market such as: business, systems, language (if needed), etc.
• Plays a key role in building & growing the DMO team in the responsible market as a market DMO MTD champion
• This role is accountable to closely collaborate with the GBS DMO team to support E2E MDM process
• Identify opportunities for process optimization and automation within the MTD process to improve operational efficiency and reduce manual efforts.
• Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance data quality, streamline processes, and optimize the MTD process cycle
• Ensure the integrity and accuracy of data throughout the MTD process, including material information, material details, etc.
• Ensure that data management practices, processes, and controls are in place to facilitate smooth and accurate material management in the MTD process.
• Drive master data quality agenda through GBS execution and business engagement
• Drive operational effectiveness through GBS capabilities
• Increase master data culture through business and GBS training
• Support GBS on specific issues related MTD process.
• Communicate with other DMO domain champions and business functions to drive the data management processes continuous improvement based on global/sector/local business needs
• Support business projects from a DMO side (data analysis, data cleansing, data requirements identification, change management, etc.)
• Work together with the other DMO sector teams to identify best practices and implement them to standardize and harmonize processes across the sector
Responsibilities
• Provide 2nd level escalation for master data management (MDM) exception and issue resolution
• Perform E2E MDM maintenance process in SAP & legacy applications through strong communication and engagement with business and ensure high quality data per the defined templates rules/standards
• Lead data cleansing activities according to business needs/PepsiCo governance standards
• Interface with business as an expert in explaining and relating how data impacts their business function
• Understand the priorities for the business and ensures that these are acted upon to meet or exceed the expectation of the business.
• Interface with business units, process experts and IT resources to resolve master data issues
• Take ownership of data tasks and prioritize work to deliver results within agreed upon project deadline
• Assists in training business users on data governance policies, data forms and related tools
• Provide assurance information on data quality to Internal & external audit
• Supports DMO Lead and develop master data management (MDM) policies/methodology, role model, data quality standard and maintain governance processes improvement plans
• Supports DMO Lead to structure market master data management (MDM) domain, data model and maintain master data glossary
• Drives continuous master data management (MDM) improvement by managing processes, monitoring compliance/ security, data quality and key master data entities, conducting risk assessment
• Initiates technical improvement on the change request for upgrade/change master data management (MDM) process flows
• Proactively analyzes data to increase quality, completeness, consistency, integrity, timeliness, conformity and validity
• Projects support from the master data management (MDM) side including data extracts, data cleansing, data enrichment, data analyses, data archiving
• Ensure Data Governance in market through providing data standards and methodologies and closely collaborating with Global Data Governance team and peers in other markets
• Analyzes KPIs, main metrics, SLAs, OLAs across the regions and provides guidance as needed to business and GBS
• Main point of contact for GBS and business functions for all questions related to master data management
• Supports and builds expertise in GBS DMO team and business through the process training, system training (SAP WF or other) to Material, Product, Customer, Vendor, Finace and other non-core domaines
• Create and maintain OFL (Object Field list) document for the OTC objects (customer, routes, pricing and etc)
Qualifications
• 5 years of master data management or related experience, especially in material/product data domain
• Bachelor degree or equivalent international qualification
• Experience in Fast Moving Consumer Goods Companies preferred
• Proficient in basic Microsoft applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, Outlook and other)
• Ability to understand complex functional and IT requirements, and ability to identify and offer multiple solution options and recommend best solution
• Extensive knowledge and experience in the following tools, disciplines, and processes: Microsoft Visual Studio Team Services (MS VSTS), MS 365 Dynamics, MS Power Platform (Apps, Automate, etc.), SAP, SAP WF
• Good communication skills to communicate with customers, team members, vendors, and management
• Ability to speak and write in English and fluency in Arabic language
• Strong influencing, negotiation and consulting skills in working with stakeholders at all levels in the organization and across departments (including at a global or corporation-wide level)
• Ability to quickly adapt to changes in timelines and sequences, deal with ambiguity, and succeed against in a high-pressure environment
• Strategic thinker, self- starter and self -managed
• High degree of problem solving and analytical skills
• Ability to align various stakeholders to a common set of standards and business rules
• Project Management experience (preferred)

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Position Summary
Location
Amman - JDC, Riyadh
Risk Advisory | Risk Data, RPA, Financial Risk Management Data Governance - Senior Consultant
When you work for us, you commit to a career at one of the largest and most prestigious professional services firms in the world. Looking for a rewarding career? Take a closer look at Deloitte & Touche ME. You'll understand that Deloitte is a Tier 1 Tax advisor in the GCC region since 2010 (according to the International Tax Review World Tax Rankings). It has received numerous awards in the last few years which include Best Employer in the Middle East, best consulting firm, and the Middle East Training &
Development Excellence Award by the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (ICAEW).
A career in Risk Advisory is all about the challenge of helping our clients manage risk and uncertainty, from the boardroom to the network. The spectrum of risk is broad, and our core competencies encompass control assurance, internal audit, corporate governance consulting, risk management, regulatory consulting, and IT security services. To be a Risk Advisory professional with Deloitte & Touche Middle East means you will gain a wealth of experience across a wide spectrum of industries. Diversity is not just a part of the business landscape in the region but also an integral part of Deloitte & Touche Middle East. Just as we are committed to seeing our clients excel, we are committed to providing you with the right environment to learn and grow and to tailor a career to your needs.
Our Purpose
Deloitte makes an impact that matters. Every day we challenge ourselves to do what matters most for clients, for our people, and for society. We serve clients distinctively, bringing innovative insights, solving complex challenges and unlocking sustainable growth. We inspire our talented professionals to deliver outstanding value to clients, providing an exceptional career experience and an inclusive and collaborative culture. We contribute to society, building confidence and trust in the markets, upholding the integrity of organizations and supporting our communities.
Our shared values guide the way we behave to make a positive, enduring impact:
• Lead the way
• Serve with integrity
• Take care of each other
• Foster inclusion
• Collaborate for measurable impact

During your tenure as a Senior Consultant in Data Governance you will demonstrate and develop your capabilities in the following areas:
• Delivery:
• To contribute to the overall success of a client engagement and support senior team members by delivering high quality work within the appropriate timelines and adhering to the methodologies.
• Take responsibility for key deliverables on engagements.
• Team Working:
• To collaborate and work with other team members, coach junior people and share knowledge and experience.
• Must work well independently and in a team-oriented environment.
• Client:
• To build an understanding of client business and markets.
• Show a personal commitment to understanding and meeting client needs.
• Business Development:
• Carry out research to write White Papers/ Point of views or create proof of concepts for a tool that will support team in business development.
• Personal Development:
• To proactively identify opportunities to understand and build on known strengths and to address development areas.
• Conduct current state assessment and Data Maturity Assessment to determine data strategy, governance framework, target operating model for data organization.
• Participate in data management policy (Data Governance, Data Quality, Metadata Management, Data Sharing etc.) and process creation, and analyzing potential impacts of Policies & Processes to the organization.
• Support the development and maintenance of an end-to-end data lifecycle management approach by being responsible for applying data governance framework including the management of data, operating model, data policies and standards.
• Assist with data architecture reviews and advise on data solutions that pertain to Data Governance programs (Data Catalogue, Data Quality, Business Glossary, data tools/software, metadata management, master data management, Lineage etc.)
• Conduct workshops to understand database structure/data lineage analysis in order to understand relevant data elements along with their definitions and use.
Leadership Capabilities:
• Builds own understanding of our purpose and values; explores opportunities for impact.
• Demonstrates strong commitment to personal learning and development; acts as a brand ambassador to help attract top talent
• Understands expectations and demonstrates personal accountability for keeping performance on track
• Actively focuses on developing effective communication and relationship-building skills
• Understands how their daily work contributes to the priorities of the team and the business
Qualifications:
• A Bachelor s degree in any of data management analysis, computer science, computer engineering, statistics, or another IT-related field
• MBA, MSc., MTech in fields related to Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science would be an added advantage
• A minimum of 5 years post-qualification experience as a data manager/analyst in a reputable organization.
• Should be familiar with data management trends and standards (like DMBOK), including data management principles and methodologies.
• Understanding of Information Architecture, Data Modelling, Data Storage, Data Integration, Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence, Master Data Management technology landscape, processes and design principles
• Operational familiarity in the use of leading commercial vendors or tools/platform that relate to data quality, governance, catalogues, meta-data management, reference & master data management.
• Proven track record in operating large data governance programs and experience in managing enterprise data assets in a large, complex organization
• Experience in developing and operationalizing data-based guidelines, policies, procedures, and standards
• Certifications related to Data Governance, Applicable Vendor or Industry certification is preferred not mandatory
• Must possess good numerical and analytical skills. This is necessary for the daily analysis and evaluation of data
• Must have good communication and interpersonal skills

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES & ACTIVITIES
Collaborate with business leaders and decision-makers to understand their data requirements and support strategic planning initiatives with data-driven insights.
Clearly articulate the objectives of the data gathering effort and identify the research questions that need answering.
Identify the specific data elements and variables that are necessary to answer the research questions. This includes considering both quantitative (numeric) and qualitative (descriptive) data, depending on the business model.
Determine the appropriate sources for obtaining the required data. This may include primary sources (collected directly from original data providers) or secondary sources (existing data collected by others). Common data sources include surveys, interviews, databases, public repositories, and APIs.
Gather data from various sources within the organization, such as databases, data warehouses, and external data feeds, including from Third Parties. Integrate and cleanse the data to ensure it is accurate and reliable.
Choose the most suitable data collection methods, based on your research objectives and available resources. Time the output and level of quality, as to achieve constant improvement, without holding slowing the business planning process.
Create a comprehensive data catalog that documents available data assets and their characteristics.
Create a and gain support for the regular update of data and assumptions, and manage the regular update of models and their consolidated outcomes.
Support the sector leadership and divisions in developing their respective commercial models and funding models, including identifying the best structures (e.g., subsidiary, JV, etc.).
Provide input to divisions and sector goals/objectives that support NEOM's overall strategic plans.
Report and Dashboard Development: Create and develop visualizations, reports, and interactive dashboards to present data in a meaningful and easily understandable way. These tools should help stakeholders quickly grasp important information and make informed decisions.
Translate data gathered into financial statements; able to build Profit and Loss, Balanace Sheet, Cash Flow and consolidation statements through automated business analytical tools (Excel, MS Access, SQL etc.).
Develop a robust data gathering strategy and implement an effective data collection process to obtain high-quality and relevant datasets for analysis, decision-making and forecasting.
Extract data from different source systems, databases, applications, APIs, and other data repositories.
Convert data from its original format into a standard format suitable for the target system or data warehouse. Data transformation may involve data cleansing, aggregation, and enrichment.
Load data into a centralized data storage system, such as a data warehouse or data lake and ensure that data remain consistent and up-to-date across different systems, by making sure data are synchronised.
Enhance data by adding relevant and missing information from trusted sources.
Define and track data quality metrics to assess the effectiveness of data quality efforts.
Support the creation of a comprehensive set of financial, operational and commercial KPIs that allow the organisation to periodicall assess its performance and the maturity of its own business planning
Apply statistical and analytical techniques to explore data, identify patterns, correlations, and trends, and gain valuable insights into business performance.
Continuously monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and other metrics to track the progress of business initiatives and identify areas for improvement.
Effectively communicate findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, enabling them to make informed decisions based on the data.
Support the division management in building and maintaining relationships and establish working relationships with relevant internal and external stakeholders.
Support in inter-sectoral efforts in identifying inputs as it relates to strategy, planning, risks, etc.
Prepare relevant progress reports as required to update relevant stakeholders on progress.
Collate stakeholders feedback on issues, challenges and unmet requirements and develop action plans.
Ensure management is kept abreast of related developments, risks arising and progress.
Ensure that data is accurate, consistent, and trustworthy, leading to better decision-making and improved business outcomes.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security throughout the data lifecycle. Implement data governance processes to maintain compliance with NEOM policies and industry standards.
Support the design and implementation of policies for data governance and guidelines to support the procurement of external analysis and benchmark data.
Support the definition of roles and responsibilities for data ownership and stewardship, ensuring accountability for data management throughout the organization.
Create and maintain data standards, data definitions, and data classifications to ensure a common understanding and interpretation of data across the organization.
Define procedures for data creation, storage, usage, archival, and disposal (Data lifecycle).
Support the implementation of processes to monitor and improve data quality continuously.
Manage the metadata, including providing information about data, their sources, base assumptions to models, structure, and usage through formulas.
Stay up to date with the latest BI and analytics tools and technologies, and recommend suitable solutions that align with the organization's needs and budget.
Proactively identify opportunities to enhance data analysis processes, improve data accuracy, and optimize reporting capabilities.
Utilize predictive modelling and machine learning techniques to forecast future trends and outcomes, helping the organization proactively address potential challenges and opportunities.

All Health Wellbeing and Biotech divisions
Strategy Office / Finance
NIO / NIF / Financial Services
SMO/PMO
Vendors and contractors as necessary
Potential partners and investors as necessary

3+ years experience in Structured Data Gathering, Business Research, Business Evaluation
5+ years programming in: SQL, Power BI and visualization tools.
5+ years experience in cross-functional large data management and visualization initiatives in Multinational

EXPERIENCE

We are looking for an exceptionally well-rounded candidate for our Retail and Commerce Systems team who will be a dedicated hands-on Salesforce Administrator responsible for managing and optimizing our Salesforce system and the needs of our Stakeholders. This role is ideal for someone with a solid understanding of the SFDC platform and who has experience in making an impact in rapidly growing companies.
Responsibilities:
• Create Salesforce technology and integration approaches to solving complex business problems.
• Follow and understand Salesforce s latest product and technical capabilities resulting from product releases, events, and User Communities.
• Create and maintain custom objects, object relationships, standard, and custom fields with the Salesforce Platform.
• Manage dashboards, reports, forms, templates, page layouts, workflows, and approval.
• Maintain data quality and data cleanup in CRM system through data quality rules to remove duplicate data and cleanse inaccurate data including the movement of relevant Data to Tableau.
• Able to standardize data entries, scheduled data analysis, scheduled reports, bulk data loads, and validation rules.
• Produce quality deliverables that will scale as our system and data footprint is growing super-fast.
• Design, build and enhance integrations using middleware or REST APIs with various systems, including internal and external web services and ERP systems, and ensure data integrity.
• Work with end-users to provide best practices and tips on Salesforce usage including training, documentation, and support as necessary.
• Never be complacent of how much you know, constantly improve your skills and training using Trailhead and other knowledge-sharing services.
• Be Innovative and be a team player who will look to explore best practices and approaches from cross-functional teams.

• B.S. Computer Science, Software or Other Engineering, MIS, and 6 years of relevant work experience with at least 5 years in Salesforce administration
• 4+ years Enterprise application development and administration including Integration principles and tools.
• 4+ years Enterprise Data Management tools and methods
• 4+ years experience with API and Event centric design patterns with Principles of sound information security

Job Description
What this opportunity involves:
We seek an experienced Sustainability Analyst to join our team. You will provide detailed data analysis, reports and consulting advice to help our clients reduce and manage their environmental footprint.
JLL s high-performing sustainability team has a proven track record of delivering environmental performance and compliance reporting for our clients.

An Overview of the role:
Respond to daily ad-hoc user queries and where required report issues to the IT development team.
Process, validate and review environmental and asset data into JLL s proprietary application, Canopy, and/or other business intelligence and data visualization tools.
Assist in the transition of new client datasets into the application, including client liaison and providing feedback on data quality issues including a gap assessment.
Provide data management and reporting to clients to meet their sustainability and compliance reporting requirements such as NGERs, DEFRA, CDP and GRESB reporting frameworks.
Be an integral part of the reporting team, contributing to the efficient monitoring and management of support and project requests, following internal processes and ongoing performance improvement of the team.
Accurate and timely processing of data updates and reporting to external and internal clients
Be an integral part of the data and reporting team, contributing to the efficient monitoring and management of support requests, following internal processes and ongoing performance improvement of the team.
Accurate and timely processing of data updates and reporting to external and internal clients.
Identify support and management processes that can be improved to increase scalability and efficiency.

Sounds like you?
This is what we are looking for:
2-5 year's experience in a similar role
High proficiency in Microsoft Excel and data management.
Strong communication skills.
Lateral thinking/problem-solving skills.
Ability to multi-task and manage priorities/deadlines.
Experience and understanding of sustainability and compliance reporting and in processing utility, water or waste data will be highly regarded.
This role requires high attention to detail and a systems/process-driven approach. You should be methodical and thorough in handling data and willing to work on routine data management and processing as part of your role.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

BE PART OF SOMETHING BIGGER.
Interim Tech Project Manager Consulting Project In Dubai
Scene-Setter only apply if interested in coming to Dubai for 2 weeks this summer.
Welcome to the MENA Catalysts, an American-owned, strategy consulting startup in Dubai, which guides
Fintech, Crypto, and New Media multinationals toward successful Middle Eastern market expansion. Our
forte lies in the realms of, and we re backed by years of experience and a proven track record in public policy
consulting for market expansion in Gulf markets. Our firm is a premium-brand government relations
company for high tech multinationals. The firm started in 2017 as a team of three colleagues with a passion
to be a part ofsomething bigger. Together, they changed government relations, reinventing tech innovation in
the Middle East in one swoop. Their vision is to be the voice of the high tech sector in the Middle East.
The company advises on market entry and government relations strategy for high tech multinationals which
want to enter, explore or expand in Middle Eastern markets. We provide world-class project execution,
insights to high tech companies, and then create new markets.
Our team doesn t just craft government relations and world-class industries we revolutionize them. It s
the diversity of our people and ideas, inspiring the innovation that runs through everything we do. Our core
values are more than just words; they re how we live and build our team.
Role Summary
We re looking for an interim data scientist to join our team in Dubai. You will be the linchpin in
leverage/adapt a GPT to transforming our disorganized Google Drive into a seamless, internal AI-powered
GPT, that can) turn disparate qualitative data into well-articulated proposals and marketing content. The
purpose is to adapt an externally available AI agent or software for our own private internal company GPT
that can read all of my laptop and team Google drive to give the business development, content marketing,
and project execution abilities of our senior people to our junior staff and newcomers.
This pivotal role is about converting diverse, incomplete data into compelling, AI-driven proposals and
marketing strategies targeted at a specific audience.
The successful candidate will harness the power of AI
to give junior staff:
sharp, focused libraries of prompts to craft precise outreach messages, leveraging our existing
content
Auto-populate client prospects change of positions from scraping linkedin
Segment the market
Create visually engaging content.
This role requires strong data management skills, a deep understanding of AI, and exceptional
communication abilities. As part of our firm, you will be entrusted with the digital transformation of our
small (but mighty!) company, a role that will need you to tap into your problem-solving skills, innovative
thinking, and eagerness to learn and adapt in the ever-evolving field of AI and NLP.
Responsibilities
The role will involve leveraging AI to craft personalized outreach messages and auto-populate client
outreach tracking from various sources, including LinkedIn, press releases, and Google alerts.
You will be responsible for analyzing tracked data to identify key trends and market segments,
turning our data into actionable insights.
Utilize AI to transform our text-based content into engaging visual formats for marketing initiatives.
Consolidate and organize our diverse range of documents, reports, and research into a unified
system.
You ll be expected to handle various tasks efficiently. These include using LinkedIn to populate our
client prospect list, personalizing outreach messages, and organizing our data into a unified, easily
accessible system.
Analyzing and visualizing our outreach data, to identifying trends and promising market
segmentations from our data unleashing your inner Picasso , turning our text content into
visually engaging marketing videos, infographics and visual carousels like you see on linkedin.
Qualifications
Demonstrated experience delivering digital transformation of a small company A-Z with leveraging
AI for business solutions, preferably within a consultancy environment.
A communicator who can speak tech as fluently as non-technical English, and can break down AI
complexities to your grandparents.
Proficiency in Python, and other leading programming languages used in AI. Experience with GPT-4
or similar models is a plus.
Familiarity with AI and Natural Language Processing (NLP): Basic understanding of AI concepts,
particularly NLP, to comprehend the underlying principles of GPTs and how they can be applied to
text processing tasks.
Strong Data Management Skills: Able to organize, manage, and streamline large volumes of data
effectively. This includes structuring and categorizing at scale documents in Google Drive,
ensuring data quality, and discoverability.
Familiarity with Google Drive and Collaboration Tools: Proficiency in Google Drive and related
collaboration tools is essential to manage, and access the company s documents. Be comfortable
setting up shared folders, granting appropriate access permissions, and facilitating collaboration
among staff.
Text Pre-processing and Cleaning: GPTs may require clean, well-structured data to produce
accurate results. Skilled in techniques such as text normalization, tokenization, and removing
irrelevant information to preprocess the documents before feeding them to the GPT model.
Understanding of GPT Models: While not necessarily needing to develop GPT models from scratch,
Have a good understanding of how GPTs work, including their strengths, limitations, and potential
biases. This knowledge will help in fine-tuning and optimizing the model s outputs.
Priority on client service: A knack for problem-solving, and ways to troubleshoot, not only escalate
problems.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities


Summary

The process controls The SWRO desalination engineer is responsible for the execution plan, field implementation, commissioning, digitalization, and optimization processes to support water supply, i.e., water treatment (plants and mobile), storage, transmission, and distribution. The position ensures the plant's operations are compliant with NEOM water management guidelines, regulations, and standards.

The role includes the execution of the strategies and supporting the process plans to enable the OT team to be at the cutting edge of engineering innovation, providing support for the OT digitalization team, and implementing AI platform tools for water supply assets.

Cross-sector, cross-function, and cross-team collaboration on all SWRO desalination process-related matters

The Process Control and Desalination Engineer is responsible for SWRO desalination plant control optimization support and integration with the OT team.



Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities



• The engineer will be optimizing the configuration of the design, both in terms of efficiency and the assembly of the SWRO process and the water treatment components. As the process control engineer, she or he will be in charge of making the water treatment process as cost-effective and reliable as possible while maintaining the water quality.

• Review the existing and coming projects, the water desalination process system architecture, design, and process optimization including the automation control philosophy.
• Owner of the P&ID, skid/system design, and functional description, which align with NEOM s standards and data architecture.
• Assist on the selection of filters, pumps, valves, fittings, instruments, and skid designs when required.
• Prepare performance validation tests on a semi-yearly basis for an asset, commissioning checklists, and maintenance planning.
• The candidate should be well versed in water treatment process design, preferring SWRO and UF/MF Technology.
• A broad experience working with different types of process control systems (DCS or PLC).
• Adequate experience in desalination technologies and their pretreatment, membrane water treatment, tendering of desalination plants, and bid submittal deliverables.
• Experience in the preparation of scope split matrixes for vendor package requirements Review process design calculations, projections for RO and UF/MF systems, process flow diagrams (PFD), process and instrumentation diagrams (P&ID), and general arrangement drawings for the reverse osmosis plant.
• Provide process-related inputs for other engineering disciplines during tendering and project execution phases and interact with RO and other process equipment vendors. The process engineer should bring technical support to the SWRO team and be involved in the commissioning and start-up of operations at the SWRO plant.
• Knowledge of OT hardware and software and a clear understanding of IT and OT convergence
• Lead field activities include planning, implementation, commissioning, and maintaining the SCADA, DCS, and AI systems for the plant to ensure instrumentation data quality and a reliable and robust system to support the water desalination plants in their daily operations and business enterprises.
• Assist on the planning, timelines, execution plans, commissioning schedules, and coordination of field work with the plant operation manager, and the OT Digitalization team.
• Knowledge in Industrial Control Systems (ICS), Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES), Instrumentation, Control, and Automation (ICA) to support all NEOM water central plants, including water bottling plants.



Background, Skills



Knowledge, Skills and Experience



• 5 - 10 years experience in SWRO desalination control system design, system architecture, data analytics and AI.

• 5 - 10 years experience with DCS, PLCs for machinery control and related systems software such as Rockwell Automation, Siemens, Schneider, Delta, and Yokogawa, etc.

• Experience in process - filtration, separation, skid design, commissioning, etc.

• Demonstrate advanced understanding and cyber risk management in the following areas:

• SCADA with experience in securing ICS (Industrial Control Systems) security
• Internet of Things (IOT) architecture and security.

• Demonstrate advanced understanding of business processes and cyber risk management in the following areas:
• Service continuity management
• Data management
• Service continuity management



Qualifications



• Bachelor s degree in chemical / mechanical / industrial engineering or equivalent related field.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the presence and poise to present to OT Lead and gain consensus on complex topics.

• Fluency in English is essential. Arabic is an advantage.

ROSHN is a national real estate developer powered by the Public Investment Fund, committed to delivering high quality communities to the Saudi citizens.
OUR VISION

We will deliver homes to thousands of people across the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and create improved standards of living for all, working in partnership with the very best organizations their respective fields. The construction of high quality, prosperous places, blending state-of-the-art design and development methods with local culture and tradition will strengthen and enrich our country s socio-economic fabric, in line with Vision 2030.

OUR VALUES

Delivering through teamwork is our core strength. We are united by our common goals and commitment to work as one to achieve them and deliver against our promises. We care about and respect our customers, our partners and the neighborhoods we build. We attach great importance to both the beauty and the heritage of our places and to the quality of life they offer for all people who enjoy a ROSHN home

OUR PEOPLE

We are only as good as our ability to deliver on our promises and our ability to deliver comes down to the people we employ. We are a highly skilled, experienced and talented team. As an ambitious company we employ only the best people, and attach great value to their skills, expertise and potential. We have built a team capable of producing the creativity, big ideas and solutions to deliver desirable neighborhoods where the people who live there will shine.

16. Supervise and review performance of individuals in the team.
17. Give direction and leadership towards the achievement of the division s strategy, annual goals and objectives.

Build and deliver new data pipelines to speedup, scale and improve performance while simplifying data access for internal and external customers

A technical educational background, BS in Computer Science or equivalent
2+ years of programming experience in Python
Experience writing SQL and data processing in Python

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Operating in the UAE for over 50 years, CBD manages the financial requirements of some of the largest corporates and businesses operating in the country, driving the UAE economy. Over the years, CBD has transformed into a progressive and modern banking institution winning multiple awards for its digital initiatives, credit cards, bank accounts, mobile app features and services.
CBD has been recognized as the number one bank in the UAE on the Forbes list of The World s Best Banks 2022.
As we continue to build upon our successes, we are looking for ambitious individuals who are passionate about the banking and finance industry and the markets in which CBD operates. Just as important to us is your ability to demonstrate a talent for dealing with people - your colleagues and our customers - and delivering service that really goes the extra mile.
Job Purpose
To manage the Risk and ensure governance of PBG customers for compliance with regulatory, compliance and operational framework of the bank. This includes on-boarding of new Business Banking and individual customers followed by portfolio data governance and management of applicable process/system controls.
Manage the customer on-boarding process for business banking/ Retail Digi Accounts and ensure new customer on-boarding is as per Central Bank guidelines and banks internal processes. This will entail approving low/medium risk accounts and coordinating with compliance team for high risk accounts for Business Banking, as well as managing alerts/fraud escalation for Digi Accounts / Retail accounts
Develop and review policies to ensure proper implementation of Business Banking Onboarding Due diligence.
Monitor the conduct of new on-boarded business banking customers and as well as existing portfolio to identify / pro-actively remedy accounts with suspicious transactions / business conduct
Approving cross border remittances for new on-boarded accounts / restricted accounts
Executing remedial actions on accounts identified by compliance / fraud team , including placing restrictions or exiting relationships
Developing policies and procedures and implementing Dynamic Monitoring measures of the different assets Portfolios under Business Banking / overall PBG umbrella.
Manage a team of 6 Business Risk Officers / Senior Officers, and drive them towards implementing effectively and efficiently the Objectives of the Bank and the Department s strategy.
Conduct Due Diligence on identified accounts to prevent their deterioration at an early stage.
Conduct random reviews of the liability portfolio under the PBG umbrella by mean of EDDs, and provide the feedback to senior management, in order to maintain quality book.
Address the AML queries related to the PBG Digi accounts.
Review the rejections of the high Risk DFC accounts, and address them in order to complete the customer s onboarding.
Establish effective & professional communication (both internal and external) to ensure turnaround time within designated parameters and higher client satisfaction levels.
Develop a strong level of local contacts with the local businesses and financial institutions community.
Assist the Head of products and the Head of Business on various projects having the goal of reduce the cost of risk within the Biz Banking portfolio.
Manage vendors performing customer site visits , documents verifications etc Desired Candidate Profile

Skills & Experience
15-17 years banking experience of which Minimum 5 years in similar role with a reputed Financial Institution. Good experience background in Central Bank guidelines / requirements, AML / KYC processes and Ops Risk
Good command of English, Arabic language will be an added advantage.
Planning and organizing skills
Negotiation skills
Strong investigative and persuasive skills

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
About the Role:
As a Product Manager in the Rides Customer team, you will be supporting the Product vision and Strategy for Careem s Rides vertical, bringing together Careem s vision of simplifying mobility for customers. The key purpose of the Product Manager is to execute the strategy and roadmap as well as build and maintain high quality products in the dynamic business environment of ride hailing.
This role requires a unique blend of product excellence, strategic / commercial thinking, technical acumen, design thinking, distinctive communication and collaboration; including the ability to zoom out and see the big picture, but also the willingness and intellectual prowess to zoom in to the finer details that need to be addressed. Working across all areas of the company, you will serve as an internal/external liaison between leadership, function heads, engineering, design, operations, commercial, marketing and executive management. You will have tremendous ownership, and it is an invitation to do the most meaningful work of your career. This role would also require close collaboration with the commercial teams for launching & scaling new products.
Responsibilities:
• Product Areas: Owning & executing the product roadmap for Careem s In-ride squad with end to end ownership of the in-ride user journey to drive growth while enabling success of the business
• Strategy & Vision: Developing the strategy and vision for the in-ride squad, working closely with the engineering, product managers from different squads, data analyst, UX designers, UX researchers,data scientist, commercial counterparts from each country & marketing teams.
• Roadmap: Building and delivering the roadmap and being accountable for the impact and outcome and timely execution.
• Collaboration: Working closely with commercial teams to build scalable features that can adapt to different market nuances & can be launched at scale.
• Stakeholder Management: Shielding the team and managing stakeholders, bringing stability and principled framework for decision making and prioritization.
• Culture of Impact and Shooting for the Moon: Responsible for growing a best in class team, guided by first principles from science and economics, grounded by data, iterating fast with experimentation and compounding improvements, and constantly pushing the envelope through 10x ideas and pilots.
Qualifications:
• 3+ years of Product management experience in customer-facing products
• Clear evidence of unlocking crazy, product-led growth in the B2C space e.g. Urban mobility, Marketplaces, e-commerce, quick commerce (food, grocery delivery), SuperApps or similar
• UX background preferred, experience with building customer facing products and working on UX design & research
• Global mindset experience in building scalable and flexible solutions that enable a variety of use-cases & regions
• Champion in product management best practices and working in empowered product teams that deliver great outcomes for customers
• Facilitate thoughtful and constructive conversations between members of your team, as well as with other members of leadership and senior executives
• Excellent collaboration and influencing skills
• Impact driven with experimentation and simulation mindset , with experience in common pitfalls.
• Proactiveness and Clarity: Proactively unblocking and managing cross-vertical and cross-functional dependencies.
• Strong leadership and communication skills, critical thinking , and sound judgment
• Drive and Motivation: You are motivated to make an impact, deliver results quickly, and raise the bar in the region s ecosystem
• Educated to BS/MS level (or equivalent) within a subject relevant to the position such as Computer Science, Engineering or Management
What we ll provide you
We offer colleagues the opportunity to drive impact in the region while they learn and grow. As a Careem colleague you will be able to:
• Work and learn from great minds by joining a community of inspiring colleagues.
• Put your passion to work in a purposeful organisation dedicated to creating impact in a region with a lot of untapped potential.
• Explore new opportunities to learn and grow every day.
• Enjoy the flexibility that comes with the trust of being an owner; work in a hybrid style with a mix of days at the office and at home, and remotely from any country in the world for 30 days a year with unlimited vacation days per year.
• Access to healthcare benefits and fitness reimbursements for health activities including: gym, health club and training classes.
