Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Title: GET Program Manager/Digital manager
About ENGIE
ENGIE group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Together with our 170,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are committed to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally friendly solutions. Inspired by our purpose ( raison d tre ), we reconcile economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet, building on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers.
Description about the Entity: Head office/ Country
ENGIE s Business Unit for the Asia Middle East and Africa (AMEA) region is headquartered in Dubai. The region has activities in large scale power generation, water desalination, district cooling, energy solutions and renewables including green hydrogen, wind and solar. We act throughout the value chain: strategy, design, engineering, energy-efficient asset construction, digital platforms, operations management, financing syndication and outcome assurance. And, by using globally leading technologies, we create innovative energy and smart solutions that help to make the world a better place.
About the job:
Business Line: AMEA
Reporting to : GET Steerco for GET Program and, for the role of Digital manager, to the regional CIO
Primary Location: UAE
Employee Status: Permanent
Schedule: Full Time
Purpose of the job:
With Engie being a worldwide leader in the energy transition in a market that is evolving rapidly in terms of digital technologies and data management, information technology today has become a crucial business enabler. With a significant SAP implementation program (GET) ahead in our AMEA region, we are looking for a Program manager to coordinate the projects in our different countries in the next 2 to 3 years. The role would be combined with the Digital manager role in the regional IT team.
The Program manager role will report to the Steerco as long as the program is running. The Digital manager role is part of the regional IT team and will be responsible to drive the digital transformation within the region.
Key activities and competencies
1 Strategic
• Implement the Group Digital strategy within the region, potentially adapting it to specific local circumstances; consolidate, monitor and report the related KPIs
• Drive digitalisation within the region
• Liaise with the internal customers to determine their needs and look for solutions
• Create regional governance for (digital) business applications
Specifically for GET Program:
• Work with the Group GET Program and translate the Group GET principles to the region and countries (Golden rules, Core Model)
• Develop the regional and local governance for GET platform(s) and ensure alignment with Group Global Platform Governance
• Prepare and organise the Regional Steering Committee and ensure proper communication of updates of the projects under the GET umbrella, including progress, results, risks, budget, look-back, etc.
• Participate in the Country Project Steering Committees
2. Operational
• Map, oversee and coordinate digitalisation actions in the region
• Understand solutions that will convert the business needs into the corresponding technical requirements
• Create and maintain standards, procedures, and documentation
• Perform quality assurance to ensure that all initiatives meet the expectations
• Develop and maintain an application architecture
• Manage digital projects
Specifically for GET Program:
Specifically for GET Program:
• Coordinate and drive the GET projects in the different countries, working closely with the local Project managers
• Promote best practice sharing and knowledge transfer between different countries
4. Planning & Delivery of Work
• Define and manage the budget allocated to digital transformation at the level of the region and oversee and challenge the countries
• Monitor the application architecture and formulate proposals for upgrades in view of (changing) business needs
Specifically for GET Program
• Deliver the GET Program in the AMEA perimeter, ensuring coherent implementation in the different countries as well as compliance with the Group s vision and requirements
• Ensure that the project is delivered within the defined timelines, at the right level of quality and within budget
• Make sure that SAP support is delivered in an efficient and effective way whilst remaining compliant with internal policies e.g., change/release/incident management processes
• Coordinate the transition period from project to business as usual.
5. Decision Making

Specifically for GET Program:

Staff: 0 direct reports / 4 indirect reports

Experience

Knowledge and Skills

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose:
The Executive Assistant will have a broad set of responsibilities that range from supporting the Senior Leadership Team, to supporting the day-to-day operations of the larger School Leadership team.
This position requires exceptional organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask and prioritize tasks efficiently.
Devising and maintaining office systems, including data management and filing;
Take notes at meetings or to provide general assistance during presentations.
Screening telephone calls, enquirers and requests, and handling them when appropriate;
Meeting and greeting visitors at all levels of Seniority;
Organizing and maintaining diaries and making appointments.
Dealing with incoming email, faxes and post, often corresponding on behalf of the SLT;
Organizing and attending meetings and taking dictation and minutes; - Organising and facilitating meetings, workshops, and events involving the secondary schools' leadership team, ensuring accurate filing and distribution of meeting minutes.
Identify, prepare, and compile necessary materials to ensure the SLT have the appropriate information for meetings, reports, presentations, and special projects.
Responsible for organizing and maintaining the SLT s diary, managing e-mail, school communications, distributing minutes, organizing school events, and a range of further administrative responsibilities as required.
Carrying out background research and presenting findings;
Liaise with internal administration and marketing (various) departments to create and implement projects.
Ensure necessary records are maintained that can readily provide current, accurate and accessible information
Provide senior level administrative support to the directors through the facilitation of communication on their behalf (follow-up with letters, memos, reports, e-mail, and telephone calls)
Act as liaison between the directors and staff to ensure appropriate coordination and follow-up on day-to-day issues
Provide coordination support to the Senior Management Team and academic staff
Coordinate all logistics for Board meetings
Assist in budget management and financial record-keeping, tracking expenses, reconciling accounts, and processing purchase requisition orders as needed.
Own and improve existing processes that support the School Leadership team; and
Support the SLT members with various ad-hoc projects and other administrative duties as needed.
Job specification:
We will be excited to hear from you if you
Are a Graduate in any discipline, preferably Business Administration with a minimum of 5 years of professional administrative experience working effectively in a dynamic and in a cross-functional environment.
Experience in a school or an education sector in the UAE is preferred but not essential.
An excellent communicator, both written and verbal, and have experience building interpersonal relationships with diverse audiences;
Ability to effectively communicate information and ideas in written and verbal format, and build and maintain relationships.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

We are seeking a dynamic and versatile individual to join our HR team as a Recruitment Specialist and HR Generalist. This role will primarily focus on recruitment activities, but the successful candidate will also take on various HR generalist responsibilities, business partnering, talent management, and stakeholder management to support the organization's growth and success
Your Responsibilities
Recruitment Attracting, Sourcing, and Screening
• Source, screen/short list for open positions
• Establish recruiting requirements by learning the job description and understanding department objectives; meet with hiring managers for a job assignment brief and propose a sourcing plan
• Build talent pools by researching and contacting universities/colleges, employment agencies, recruiters, media and internet sites
• Determine applicant suitability by conducting interviews and assessments, and evaluating qualifications and experience against the job assignment brief and job description
• Coordinate interview arrangements for the hiring department: arrange applicant s travel and accommodation, schedule and escort applicant to interviews, arrange local look and see tours
Employee Pre-boarding
• Coordinate work visa application
• Provide candidates with an overview of the pre-boarding and onboarding processes
• Coordinate with the department on the hiring progress and arrangement of employee asset requirements
Data Management and Administration
• Ensure all recruitment trackers/dashboards/reports are updated

Business Partnering
• Be the SPOC for different departments to understand their specific HR needs and challenges.
• Provide HR advice and support to managers and employees, fostering a positive work environment.
• Address HR-related issues and contribute to conflict resolution and employee engagement efforts.
Talent Management
• Support the implementation of talent management initiatives, including the annual performance management process and employee development programs (e.g., learning needs analysis, learning management administration, competency development etc.
• Maintain TM related data, update trackers, and generate reports.
• Research, compile, analyze, and present data and information to support Talent Management initiatives
• Assist in internship program arrangements.
• Assist in documentation (drafting, distribution, and filing) of talent management related forms and material. Desired Candidate Profile

Your Qualifications
• Bachelor s Degree in Human Resources or related field
• HR certification or higher studies an advantage
• Fluent in Arabic and English
• Minimum 3 years of progressive professional Human Resources experience, exposure to recruitment/onboarding preferred
Your Proficiencies

• Time management and multi-tasking skills; ability to organize and prioritize
• Good analytical skills and decision-making skills
• Attention to detail

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Action Against Hunger leads the global movement to end hunger. We innovate solutions, advocate for change, and reach 24 million people every year with proven hunger prevention and treatment programs. As a nonprofit that works across 50 countries, our 8,300 dedicated staff members partner with communities to address the root causes of hunger, including climate change, conflict, inequity, and emergencies. We strive to create a world free from hunger, for everyone, for good.
Action Against Hunger USA is part of the Action Against Hunger International network. As an independent NGO, Action Against Hunger USA currently manages operations in 8 countries: Kenya, South Sudan, Somalia, Tanzania, Uganda, Ethiopia, Zambia and Haiti. Action Against Hunger-USA has over $100 million in programs, and approximately 1,800 permanent staff based in New York City, Washington D.C, Nairobi, and country offices. Additional growth is anticipated.
Nairobi, and country offices.
Summary of position
Action Against Hunger Somalia seeks an experienced Finance Manager for the anticipated Damal Caafimaad call. The purpose of the Damal Cafimaad call is to deliver the Essential Package of Health Services in Bay Region for better health outcomes through strengthened essential health services provision. The project is funded by World Bank through the Federal Republic of Somalia. The Finance Manager will be responsible for the overall management of the finance of the project.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
• Overall management of finances for this project
• Oversee financial aspect of sub-grant tracking and subcontracting when applicable.
• Ensure forward planning and preparation for donor reporting, adherence with donor requirements and timelines, and timely submission of sub-grantee reports.
• Ensure that financial management systems and records are effective and robust in order to identify and protect the assets and interests of the consortium.
• Consolidate cash flows, reporting templates, and financial plans throughout the project life.
• Review and monitor budgets to support financial stability, efficiency and value for money.
• Maintain a filing system for financial and accounting deliverables to facilitate access during internal and external audits.
• Monitor budget burn rates and recommend appropriate action in the event significant variances are observed.
• Oversee financial management practices of health facilities.
• Participate in procurement committee for procuring joint items and large capital assets for the consortium members.
• Ensure all transactions are entered into QuickBooks.
• Consolidate financial reports, fund requests and budgets in a timely fashion.
• Follow up on timely implementation of the recommendations to remedy significant variances.
• Prepare end of year accounts and any ad-hoc reports that may be required in the course of the year.
• Ensure that all financial records and accounts are compiled on time, accurately and in line with international accounting standards and donor regulations. Desired Candidate Profile
Required Qualifications
• A University degree in Finance, Business Administration, Accounting or similar.
• An internationally recognized professional accounting qualification (ACCA/CA/CPA) OR an advanced degree - Master s or equivalent - in Financial Management or similar.
• At least five years of financial management experience, preferably for health projects
• Experience in fragile, conflict-impacted settings required; experience working in Somalia or similar contexts.
• Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and be initiative.
• Strong computer skills and ability to use standard computing packages such as word, excel, spreadsheets
• Strong team working and interpersonal skills.
• Ability to plan ahead and output oriented.
• Self-motivated, result-driven and reliable.
• Experience working with International NGO s, UN agencies, line ministries and/or local authorities, in complex emergencies.
• Demonstrated data management and analytical skills, with demonstrated experience in managing financial systems.
• Excellent skills in financial data analysis and report writing.
• Demonstrated experience working with multiple partners and stakeholders.
• Ability to provide technical support and feedback with a high degree of tact and diplomacy.
• Excellent communication, facilitation, interpersonal and representation skills.
• Professional proficiency in spoken and written English is required.
Benefits
Action Against Hunger-USA provides all staff with an attractive salary & benefits package. We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees & qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, ancestry, sexual orientation, national origin, age, handicap, disability, marital status, or status as a veteran. Action Against Hunger-USA complies with all applicable laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.
Application Process
Interested? Then apply for this position by clicking on the apply button. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job description
You :
Are you a diversified professional looking for a role within an ambitious Company? Are you confident, able to influence, challenge and build relationships at all levels? We are recruiting a Cyber Security Lead - to join our exceptional team. This is an exciting and challenging opportunity for someone with proven experience who is personable and capable to quickly establish their credibility.
If you are excited by a challenge, have a can-do attitude and a passion for leaving your mark on an organization then this is the opportunity for you. We want to encourage you to grow and challenge yourself because when we pursue excellence, we create great experiences together and with our customers.
. Sounds like YOU? Then read on.
In this role you will have the opportunity:
To advance your career and be trained by the top specialists in the industry, work in multiple sites and various type of establishments.
Job requirements
Key Accountabilities And Responsibilities
• IT Governance Reviews information systems for compliance with legislation and specifies any required changes. Responsible for ensuring compliance with organizational policies and procedures and overall information management strategy.
Information Systems Coordination -
• Maintains an awareness of the global needs of the organization, and promotes (to both information systems and business management) the benefits that a common approach to information Security will bring to the business as a whole.
• Information Security Explains the purpose of and provides advice and guidance on the application and operation of elementary physical, procedural and technical security controls. Performs security risk, vulnerability assessments, and business impact analysis for medium complexity information systems. Investigates suspected attacks and manages security incidents. Uses forensics where appropriate.
• Information Assurance Interprets information assurance and security policies and applies these in order to manage risks. Provides advice and guidance to ensure adoption of and adherence to information assurance architectures, strategies, policies, standards and guidelines. Uses testing to support information assurance. Contributes to the development of policies, standards and guidelines.
• Technical Specialism Maintains knowledge of specific specialisms, provides detailed advice regarding their application and executes specialized tasks.
• Innovation Actively monitors all threats and seeks opportunities for new methods, trends, capabilities and products to the advancement of the organization. Clearly articulates, and formally reports potential risks and benefits from both structural and incremental change. Encourages and motivates colleagues to share creative ideas and learn from failures.
• Business Risk Management Carries out risk assessment within a defined functional or technical area of business. Uses consistent processes for identifying potential risk events, Conflicts, quantifying and documenting the probability of occurrence and the impact on the business. Refers to domain experts for guidance on specialized areas of risk, such as architecture and environment. Co-ordinates the development of countermeasures and contingency plans.
• Emerging Technology Monitoring Maintains awareness of opportunities provided by new technology to address security challenges or to enable new ways of working. Within own sphere of influence, works to further organizational goals, by the study and use of emerging technologies and products. Contributes to briefings and presentations about their relevance and potential value to the organization.
• Continuity Management Provides input to the service continuity planning process and implements resulting plans.
• Data Management Assists in providing accessibility, retrievability, security and protection of data in an ethical manner.
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience:
Mandatory experience
• Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Computer or Information Technology, Computer Science, Management Information Systems or other information technology or related fields.
• At least 5+ years of experience working in IT Security / Information Security and an overall IT experience of 8+ years.
• Experience with Technology Governance i.e. Creation of Policy, Standards, Guidelines & Procedures
• Experience with Information Risk Management including Cloud and On Premise Resources
• Experience of full-lifecycle implementation of ISO 27001
• Experience with Technology Compliance i.e. regulatory compliance, ISO 27001, ISO 20000, ITIL V3, COBIT, CIS/NIST security baselines etc.
• Solid experience with enterprise level "Security Incident & Event Management" technology
• Solid knowledge of: malware, vulnerabilities, exploits, network forensics, packet analysis
• Good understanding of IDS, IPS, Firewalls, Web Filtering technologies, ATP method
Qualities:
• Natural curiosity and ability to learn new skills quickly
• Strong analytical, documentation, reporting and communication skills
Benefits :
In return, we offer you a path towards your most rewarding career and an opportunity to be part of one of the leading family groups within the UAE. Additionally, we provide a competitive benefits package for all successful candidates.
Location: Abu Dhabi
What will it be like to work for United Al Saqer Group?
Established more than 37 years ago, the United Al Saqer Group (UASG) is one of the leading multi-sector business groups in the United Arab Emirates. The UASG owns and operates a diverse yet complementary portfolio of six UAE-based companies encompassing several key industry sectors, which includes Abu Dhabi Motors, Dalma Motors, Al Saqer Heavy Equipment, Al Saqer Property Management, Awraq Islamic Financial Brokerage, Royal International Construction, and Royal Joinery.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

JOB DESCRIPTION
Company Description
One of the best-known Swiss brands in the world, Swiss tel Hotels & Resorts offers contemporary hotels infused with the freshness and vitality of alpine energy, rooted in the tradition of Swiss hospitality. Respected for its intelligent design, quality craftsmanship and mindful approach to sustainability, Swiss tel gives its guests peace of mind to explore the world, discover life s true rewards and embrace opportunities to live it well . The Swiss tel brand was founded in 1980 and today numbers more than 30 hotels globally including flagship properties such as Swiss tel The Bosphorus in Istanbul, Swiss tel The Stamford in Singapore and Swiss tel Krasnye Holmy in Moscow. Swiss tel is part of AccorHotels, a world-leading travel and lifestyle group which invites travellers to feel welcome at more than 4,500 hotels, resorts and residences, along with some 10,000 of the finest private homes around the globe.
Step into a world of ease, luxury and Swiss hospitality at Swissotel Al Murooj located in the city s favoured destinations for business or leisure. Directly opposite The Dubai Mall, one of the largest malls in the world, the iconic Burj Khalifa and within a few minutes drive to Dubai International Financial Centre and World Trade Centre with its many exhibition halls. The unique urban-style feel and ambiance at Swissotel Al Murooj Dubai cleverly combines hotel and apartment style accommodation, arranged around a central leisure complex. Quality in service is demonstrated through the warmth, diligence and entrepreneurial mind-set of its team, ensuring individual guest needs are anticipated and exceeded, that every detail has been thought of and executed in advance.
Job Description
• Recruitment Strategy: Develop and execute comprehensive recruitment strategies in liaison with the Director of Talent & Culture to fulfill the staffing needs of Swissotel Al Murooj Hotel, Collaborate with department heads and managers to understand their hiring requirements and create customized recruitment plans.
• Sourcing and Networking: Utilize various recruitment platforms such as Smart Recruiter, LinkedIn, job boards, and other relevant channels to source, identify, and engage potential candidates. Build a strong network and maintain relationships with potential candidates for future opportunities.
• Candidate Evaluation: Review and evaluate incoming applications and resumes. Conduct initial screenings and assessments to ensure candidates meet the required qualifications and align with the hotel's values and culture.
• Interview Process: Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and stakeholders. Conduct interviews, both in-person and virtually, to assess candidates' suitability for the roles. Provide timely feedback to candidates and internal teams.
• Employer Branding: Collaborate with the L&D team to enhance the hotel's employer brand by creating compelling job descriptions, employer profiles, and engaging recruitment materials. Represent the hotel positively at industry events and career fairs.
• Selection and Offer: Participate in the selection process by presenting shortlisted candidates to hiring managers. Facilitate communication between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring a seamless and positive candidate experience. Extend offers of employment and negotiate terms as needed.
• Onboarding Support: Assist in the onboarding process for new hires, ensuring they have a smooth transition into their roles. Coordinate with relevant departments to provide necessary information and resources to new employees.
• Data Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of candidate information, recruitment activities, and hiring metrics. Generate regular reports to monitor recruitment effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.
Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
• Proven experience (2 years) in recruitment, preferably in the hospitality industry.
• Familiarity with recruitment platforms such as Smart Recruiter, LinkedIn, and other job boards.
• Strong networking and relationship-building skills.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities
In line with the Business and Digital Strategy of ENOWA (NEOM Energy & Water), the successful candidate will:

• Business Engagement: Cultivate robust relationships with business stakeholders to gain a comprehensive understanding of their strategies and objectives within the realm of physical asset management, encompassing field equipment, plants, and more. This scope may also extend to field workforce management or tanker operations. Implement a structured approach to execute the Digital Portfolio Management process, involving methodologies such as workshops, interviews, and validation sessions.
• Digital Requirements Translation: Translate business strategies and challenges into clear and actionable digital requirements, ensuring alignment with organisational goals. Ensure alignment with Digital & AI department s Enterprise Architecture, Cyber Security and Data Management functions.
• Digital Portfolio Oversight: Strategically manage a portfolio of digital initiatives, prioritising projects for maximum business value and overseeing their successful execution. Having the ability to both identify and articulate value for all stakeholders (Business as well as Digital & AI department).
• Stakeholder Communication: Effectively communicate between business and technology teams, facilitating a shared understanding of objectives and project progress.
• Technology Collaboration: Collaborate with IT teams to identify and implement technology solutions that meet business needs in EAM and O&M. Keep abreast of both best-in-breed as well as value-based third-party solution providers.
• Problem-Solving: Utilise problem-solving skills to address complex challenges in the industry, proposing innovative digital solutions.
• Data Analysis: Analyse data and metrics to evaluate the impact of digital initiatives, making data-driven decisions to optimise performance.
• Project Management: Apply project management methodologies to ensure digital projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget; including the development of project (Epic) charters (Idea Cards, Epic One Pagers), schedules and budgets.
• Adaptability: Stay updated on industry trends and regulatory changes, adapting digital strategies accordingly.
• Leadership: Provide leadership and guidance to cross-functional teams, inspiring collaboration and achievement of common goals.
• Reporting: Provide regular reports to senior management on the progress, impact and the ROI of digital initiatives.
• Team Collaboration: Collaborate with colleagues and stakeholders to foster a culture of innovation and excellence in ENOWA s EAM/O&M functions.
• Risk Management: Identify and mitigate risks associated with digital initiatives, ensuring business continuity.
• Quality Assurance: Ensure the quality and reliability of digital solutions and their alignment with business objectives.

Background, Skills

• Subject Matter Expertise: In-depth knowledge of the EAM and/or O&M in the energy and/or water sector. Knowledgeable about industry trends and regulations with the specific application of emerging digital technologies as well as software applications such as IBM Maximo and Hexagon.
• Sustainability: Understanding of how emerging technology will support sustainability in EAM and O&M initiatives.
• Business Acumen: Strong understanding of business strategies and the ability to translate them into digital requirements and solutions.
• Stakeholder Management: Proven experience in serving as a "customer success manager" for business actors, nurturing relationships and effectively communicating between business and technology teams as well as third-party partners.
• Digital Portfolio Management: Expertise in strategically aligning and managing a portfolio of digital initiatives to maximise business value.
• Technology Aptitude: Familiarity with technology solutions relevant to the energy industry, enabling effective collaboration with IT teams.
• Problem-Solving: Exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to address complex challenges in the field.
• Communication: Strong verbal and written communication as well as persuasive skills to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and vice versa.
• Project Management: Proficiency in project management methodologies to oversee the successful execution of digital initiatives.
• Analytical Skills: Ability to analyse data and metrics to assess the impact of digital initiatives and make data-driven decisions.
• Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to rapidly changing industry dynamics and technologies.
• Leadership: Demonstrated leadership skills in guiding cross-functional teams towards common goals.
• Regulatory Compliance: Awareness of regulatory compliance requirements relevant to EAM/O&M in the energy and water industries.
• Continuous Learning: A commitment to staying updated on industry advancements and best practices.
• Experience: A minimum of seven years of experience in a similar role within the energy and/or water industry, preferably with a reputable company. Regional experience in the Middle East will be beneficial.

Qualifications

• Master s degree in business or technical field.
• Familiarity with frameworks such as ISO 55000 is desirable.

We deliver high quality solutions to our customers and we are leaders in the logistics industry. Join us and become a part of our great team. To provide front-line support for clients and customers and to ensure that customers are satisfied with products, services, and features. • Quotation Management: Qualification of customer inquiries, provide KN quotations and updates, set final selling price with individual adjustments within the given price band and in line with the national leeway in decision-making (front-line empowerment)

Management: overseeing and assessing customer care members'
activities and providing them with regular performance-related feedback

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Job Description:
Parsons is looking for an amazingly talented Special Economic Zone (SEZ) Growth And Business Development Manager to join our team! In this role you will get to provide management and oversight for all financial, contractual and regulatory matters on a large project. Responsible for creating and updating the financial model and supplying critical financial information to the Project Manager and GBU management on a timely basis. Responsible for project change order control, as well as the startup, administration and closing of project field offices. Willingness to relocate to the project job site at the appropriate time (if required) is a prerequisite for this position.
What You'll Be Doing:
•Develop and implement strategic plans for the growth and development of the SEZ in alignment with RC JCPDI Strategic Plan & Objectives.
•Raise international profile & awareness of JCPDI SEZ as an attractive investment location destination through various avenues including organization of seminars, participation at selected trade fairs and exhibitions as well as digital marketing channels.
•Identify and target potential investors, industries, and businesses that can foster growth within the SEZ, while taking into account the zone's competitive advantages and unique features.
•Establish and maintain strong relationships with local and foreign investors, government officials, and other stakeholders to ensure seamless and transparent communication.
•Develop and promote investment incentives, schemes, and policies in collaboration with relevant government entities to attract potential investors.
•Coordinate with stakeholders to streamline business operations, reduce bureaucratic hurdles, and improve ease of doing business in the SEZ.
•Monitor economic and market trends to adjust strategies, identify potential investors, and address any challenges or obstacles faced by businesses within the designated zone.
•Evaluate and assess the performance of the SEZ in terms of business growth, job creation, and infrastructure development to ensure it meets established goals and contributes to overall regional development.
•Organize conferences, seminars, and other events to promote the SEZ to potential investors, institutions, and the general public.
•Facilitate negotiations and mediate conflicts between businesses, stakeholders, and government entities within the SEZ, ensuring a conducive environment for business expansion and economic growth.
•Provide regular updates and reports to senior management and stakeholders regarding project progress, economic growth indicators, and investment opportunities.
•Maintain and develop SEZ investment promotion data management including but not limited to internal CRM and pipeline dashboards management.
•Recommend and/or coordinate updates to Investment Promotion websites, social media and campaigns as needed.
•Recommend and support the development of marketing plans or campaigns that aim to achieve the goals and targets set within the RC Investment Development Division.
•The successful applicant will be based in JCPDI but will be required to travel extensively both within and outside of the Kingdom.
•Perform all other duties and tasks as assigned.
What Required Skills You'll Bring:
•Proven track record of generating strong business and attracting investments in projects, including blue-chip investors.
•Demonstrable exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively liaise with stakeholders and potential investors across diverse cultural backgrounds.
•Strong ability to identify competitors and identifying unique selling points and initiatives to beat them.
•Knowledge of Saudi Government organizations and current Kingdom level initiatives and policy is preferred but not required.
•Able to work under minimal supervision, with initiative and proactiveness.
•Excellent English communication skills required and additional fluency in other languages preferred but not required.
•Proficiency in Microsoft Office software and CRM tools.
What Desired Skills You'll Bring:
•A recognized Bachelor s degree in Business, Marketing or related field, MBA/Master s degree preferable.
•Minimum 15 years of business development experience, including a minimum of 5 years experience in SEZ investment promotion and attraction.
•Business Development experience within the regional Middle East is preferred but not required.

Roles & Responsibilities

2023-08-24

The Talent Acquisition Professional Recruiter is responsible for recruitment and sourcing of roles within Raytheon Saudi Arabia and other entities as required. The Recruiter develops and implements recruiting solutions to hire the right skills and quantity of talent to achieve the staffing objectives. A motivated, detailed and process-oriented recruiter with strong client and candidate management skills is ideal for this position. To be successful in this role, you must develop and maintain business relationships and be recognized as a trusted HR business partner.
This position is located in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia.
Responsibilities:
• Manage full life cycle recruitment including, but not limited to, phone screens, candidate assessments, candidate tracking and status updates, interview feedback sessions, compensation analysis, offer extension and onboarding.
• Educate stakeholders on the recruitment process, set expectations and maintain communication throughout the process.
• Partner with department managers and HR colleagues to develop job description content that is thorough, alluring to candidates, and aligns with business strategy. Build candidate profiles to understand overall requirements and success factors.
• Drive the hiring process; actively engage with managers, provide ongoing status of requisitions, advise and influence managers throughout the hiring process, and close requisitions in a timely manner.
• Demonstrate a deep understanding of the business area, capabilities, market challenges and key skills to function as a subject matter expert to the business.
• Manage active candidates throughout the recruitment process through effective communication to ensure a positive candidate experience.
• Maintain talent pipelines through ongoing, targeted communication to stay in contact with potential candidates who have experience that aligns with current and future business requirements.
• Identify and present a diverse candidate slate to support business diversity and inclusion efforts.
• Complete reports to provide requisition status and measure recruiting performance.
• Responsible for data management and integrity within the applicant tracking system and other HR systems, and compliance of local laws and internal policies and procedures.
• Attend local and national career fairs and professional events.
• Perform/participate in other HR operation tasks as required.
Required Skills:
• Must have a minimum of two years' experience managing all phases of the recruitment and hiring process in a high volume, fast paced work environment.
• Proven success in attracting and hiring professionals and executives.
• Proven ability to build effective, collaborative work relationships with colleagues and internal clients.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
• Excellent interpersonal skills with good negotiation tactics
• Proactive and independent with the ability to take initiative.
• Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
• Familiarity with laws, regulations, and best practices applicable to hiring and recruitment.
• Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn applicant-tracking software or other recruitment systems.
• Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and popular ATS systems such
Required Education:
• Bachelor s degree in Human Resources, Business or related area.
Notes:
This position requires a Saudi person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Key Responsibilities:

Administrative Management:
• Supervise and support administrative staff.
• Establish and maintain office policies and procedures to optimize efficiency.
• Develop and update company documents, reports, and presentations as needed.
• Manage office budgets and expenses, striving for cost-effectiveness.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Majid Al Futtaim Global Solutions invites you to join us in our quest to create great moments for everyone, everyday! We are the leading shopping mall, residential communities, retail and leisure pioneer across the Middle East, Africa and Asia, serving over 560 million visitors a year. For the past two decades, we have shaped the consumer landscape across the region, transforming the way people shop, live and play, while maintaining a strong sustainability track record and the largest mall in the world to attain LEED Gold EBOM Certification. We have over 45,000 team members in 17 international markets representing over 100 nationalities all keeping the customer at the heart of everything we do. If you enjoy being BOLD, PASSIONATE and TOGETHER, then Majid Al Futtaim is the destination for you.
ROLE SUMMARY
As Empolyee Life Cycle Specialist you will own day-to-day human resource maintenance within specific business groups and/or functions. Our goal is to ensure outstanding customer service in responding to questions and resolving issues, timely HR Systems employee life cycle data entry, electronic employee file and Human Resources records maintenance, and assistance with various Human Resources special projects.
ROLE PROFILE
• Providing hands on support to the Human Capital Business Partners, Human Capital functional team and business employees in all areas to include SuccessFactors, reporting, payroll preprocessing and time keeping, and all other HR Operations activities.
• Ensuring high quality Human Capital transactional data management. Owns employee data and accuracy.
• Enable a culture of data accuracy and integrity by creating and implementing data maintenance processes and audits.
• Support data corrections, organization changes, transfer of employees as well as participate in set up of Human Capital programs throughout the year.
• Maintain the long-term integrity of the SuccessFactors Environment while being flexible and nimble to the business and new business requirements
• Partner and collaborate with all HCDX team members to drive solutions and processes that are key to Human Capital operations solutions.
• Support any internal and external audits regarding Human Resouces processes, ensuring compliance to existing audit standards, responding to, and complying with any internal/external investigations, audits, assessments.
• Maintaining appropriate controls for information, files, data, etc.
REQUIREMENTS
• Minimum of 2 years of experience in areas of HR Operations, Compensation and Benefits and HRIS
• Understanding of shared services model and partnering both as a customer and provider.
• Excellent MS Office skills (MS Excel, MS PowerPoint)
• Excellent Communication skills
• Strong Time Management skills
• Self-management skills

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

We are in search of a dedicated Operational Excellence Engineer to join our team. This critical role involves overseeing the management of **Arena Product Lifecycle Management (PLM)** and **Engineering Quality Management System (QMS)**. Your expertise in quality control, process enhancement, and documentation management will contribute significantly to elevating product quality, optimizing processes, and fostering operational excellence. Working collaboratively with cross-functional teams, you will implement strategies to improve our products and processes, ensuring they align with the highest quality standards and operational efficiency.

Oversee and manage the **Arena Product Lifecycle Management (PLM)** system, ensuring accurate and organized documentation and efficient data management.

Collaborate with stakeholders to define and optimize key performance indicators, contributing to data-driven decision-making.

Cultivate a culture of continuous improvement, providing training and support to team members on relevant tools and methodologies.

Utilize process excellence methodologies like **Six Sigma and Lean** to drive operational efficiency, minimize waste, and enhance productivity.

Manage product lifecycle phases, ensuring smooth transitions from design to Production and maintaining adherence to rigorous quality standards.

Facilitate the execution of **Engineering Change Orders (ECOs)**, ensuring seamless approvals and accurate implementation.

Collaborate closely with cross-functional technology teams to identify opportunities for process enhancement, analyzing data from process performance, and customer feedback.

Devise, implement, and manage quality control measures and process improvement/automation initiatives to enhance product quality and operational efficiency of our R&D and engineering team.

Lead the **Engineering Quality Management System (QMS)**, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards and adherence to internal quality benchmarks.

Design, implement, maintain dashboards for all sensor systems functions. Desired Candidate Profile

- Bachelor's degree in electrical/mechanical Engineering or a related field.
- Proven experience in PLM and engineering QMS (3-5 years).
- Certification in quality management (e.g., ASQ Certified Quality Engineer), Six Sigma, or Lean methodologies is a plus.
- Proficiency in using quality management software, data analysis and process improvement tools.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with meticulous attention to detail.
- Exceptional communication and interpersonal abilities, fostering effective collaboration.
- Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects and priorities efficiently.
- Commitment to staying updated with related industry advancements in quality and process improvement.
- Adapting and proactivity to learning and applying new techniques.
**Benefits:**
- Competitive salary and benefits package.
- Exposure to world class products and technology
- Opportunity to work with a diverse and talented team.
- Career growth and professional development opportunities.
- Contribution to meaningful projects that impact product quality and operational excellence.
Join our team and play a crucial role as an Operational Excellence Engineer in managing Arena PLM and engineering QMS, contributing to enhanced product quality, efficiency, and overall customer satisfaction. Apply your expertise in quality management, process improvement, and collaboration to drive our commitment to excellence.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

POSITION
Costumer Experience Manager Onsite - preferable Saudi National or else Arabic Speaker who understands our client channel of communication with customers - mobile apps IOS/Android - Portal Chatbot experience Call Center forecasting/enhancement.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Technology Leadership

• Manages our clients integrated suite of CX applications consisting of customer-facing SAP applications and non-SAP applications.
• Leads in-house teams and supervises outsourced contracts to drive unified and coordinated service delivery.
• Owns delivery of operational services in accordance with IT standards and committed service levels.
• Supervises resolution of escalated incidents by drawing support of required parties and removing obstacles in alignment with IT leadership
• Orchestrates the on-time and accurate resolution of all application malfunctions and guides the resolution of urgent or complex incidents to ensure business continuity.
• Ensures maintenance of complete, accurate, and up to date knowledge of all CX applications
• Works closely with BCP/DR stakeholders to maintain a reliable service continuity posture
Application Modernization and Development
• Orchestrates design, build, testing, deployment, support, and maintenance of CX applications, brokers SaaS applications, and manages master data and application configurations
• Ensures system integration between CX applications and oversees major upgrades and technology-driven refreshes.
• Organizes solution validation workshops for new projects and CRs and approves functional, technical, and operational specifications.

CX Governance
• Facilitates internal audits, cybersecurity compliance monitoring and validation, and external assessments and drives corrective and preventive measures.
• Supports procurement activities by providing technical input to bid documents, undertaking bid evaluation and vendor selection.
• Supports organizational change management and training, provides coaching to team members, builds consensus with Business users, and promotes continual improvement.
• Provides periodic and on-demand status reporting and owns risk management related to customer applications.
• Stimulates subordinates and contributes to the identification of opportunities for continuous improvement of systems, processes and practices considering international best practice, improvement of business processes, cost reduction and productivity improvement and reduction in turnaround time.
• Ensures all staff have clear objectives, regular performance feedback sessions, formal annual appraisals, and individual development plans.
• Facilitates the employment, training and development of staff within the unit.
• Performs other related duties or assignments as directed.
Other Managerial Responsibilities
• Ensure subordinates comply with organizational policies, procedures, and quality standards in the department, cascading the objectives and KPIs to all members of the team.
• Oversee the selection of workforce in the department, in line with the business and operational plans.
• Take necessary actions that boost subordinate engagement and enhance capability development by providing ongoing feedback and by coaching team members within the department.
• Ensure all department staff adhere to the companys safety and security regulations and take precautionary measures within the relevant scope of work.
• Optimize the departments performance and cost-effectiveness through designing and monitoring of challenging KPIs.
• Review the departments performance against budget targets and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and initiate remedial action to correct adverse variances and enhance performance.
• Manage all government and regulatory matters following company policies.
• Demonstrate effective compliance with all legal requirements.
• Ensure department employees follow all safety & security regulations.
• In conjunction with all parties, ensure all company policies are adhered to and maintained effectively.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary:
Provides in country technical leadership for all Patriot programs in the United Arab Emirates. This position will report into the Raytheon engineering function and will be matrixed to the UAE Patriot Program Director located in Abu Dhabi, UAE and the program Chief Engineer. The key overall responsibility is to provide technical support, oversight, and decision-making approval of activities associated with training, operations, maintenance, and sustainment of current Patriot configurations throughout UAE. In addition, this position involves communication between various CONUS and OCONUS entities. We value diverse skills and experience, so don t hold back. Your qualification could add tremendous value to our team. Our customers come from all different backgrounds, and so do our employees. If you re passionate about what you could accomplish here, we d love to hear from you. This is an international assignment on a 3-year MOU.
Responsibilities to Anticipate:
Technical management of technical support associated with Patriot programs, located at several different locations in UAE.
Supporting the Patriot Technical Assistance team with technical issue resolution to ensure minimal downtime for all fielded assets throughout UAE.
Primary point of contact for technical sustainment needs including logistics analysis, reach-back support for maintenance, TM updates, training, site surveys, and defense planning
Interfacing with various UAE entities supporting and inspecting all tactical site units, including data collection, investigations, upgrades, and emplacement issues.
Developing content and briefing program status, technical issues and impacts, requirements, and new products to inform, advise, and guide UAE decisionmakers.
Communicating to CONUS and connecting with UAE Patriot Chief Engineers and their teams on field/tech issues, customer priorities, and customer RFIs and RFQs
Drive 100% compliance with export regulations for technical data within the in-country team, ensuring all export activities are logged with the in-Country EXIM team.
Management of all engineering changes and assuring proper configuration management of all build documentation.
Achieving critical program schedules, daily program updates and personnel movement, coordination with base commanders, and overall on-site coordination of upgrade activity and technical issue resolution.
Qualifications You Must Have:
Bachelor s Science degree in an Engineering field or equivalent technical degree and 8 years experience Engineering, technical support and/or Program Management Experience with Patriot Program hardware
The ability to obtain and maintain a US security clearance. U.S. citizenship is required as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance.
Demonstrated technical expertise with the Patriot Config 3+ weapon system.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

About HALCON
HALCON is a regional and international leader that offers next-generation Weapons Systems and Robotics Expertise to meet the challenges of a rapidly changing world. HALCON has developed in-house expertise across the entire value chain for gravity-release bomb guidance systems. This includes design, development, testing, manufacturing and assembly. Our end-to-end capabilities ensure exceptional quality and competitive pricing. As well, we are faster and more flexible in meeting customer requirements.
Key Accountabilities:
• Test Plan Development:
• Develop comprehensive test plans for parts and assemblies, covering all phases of testing from development to qualification and acceptance.
• Performance Evaluation:
• Evaluate the performance of mechanical equipment, structures, fluid systems, and mechanisms against established performance requirements. Analyze test results to determine positive margin and compliance.
• Instrumentation:
• Define and select instrumentation for test setups, analyze test responses, and correlate them with analysis and predictions to ensure accurate data collection.
• Test Equipment Design:
• Conceptualize and design test jigs, stands, and equipment. Authorize fabrication drawings, wiring schematics, and instrumentation lists to support testing requirements.
• Test Setup Integration:
• Lead the integration of jigs or test stands, including fabrication, mechanical assembly, and data/control systems integration.
• Flight Hardware Handling:
• Assemble and disassemble flight hardware and test equipment as required for testing purposes, ensuring proper handling and maintenance.
• Facility Maintenance:
• Further develop and maintain in-house testing facilities, ensuring they are up to industry standards and operational at all times.
• Mentoring:
• Provide guidance and mentorship to technical staff, sharing your expertise and knowledge to enhance the team's skills and capabilities.
Experience & Education Qualifications:
• Expertise: At least 11 yr. (NTC5), 9 yr. (T3), 7 yr. (T4 / B.Tech) or 4 yr. (M.Tech) of related experience, preferably, in the aerospace industry
• Minimum Qualification: NTC5, T3, B.Tech / T4 or M.Tech Diploma or higher and/or equivalent technical qualification in mechanical or aerospace engineering
• Defence Industry: At least 4 yr. of Test and Evaluation experience, in the aerospace or defence industry, Knowledge in the application of environmental testing in the design process.
Key Skills:
• Able to deal with work-related deadlines
• A thorough understanding of defence product development and production
• Assume accountability and responsibilities
• Strong math, CAD and Product Data Management skills
• Technical communication (Written and oral.) with technical and non-technical personnel, suppliers and customers+
• Visual and spatial awareness, attention to detail, problem solving

About the Job
As a Cloud/ DevOps Engineer, you will play a crucial role in managing and supporting multiple AWS environments while contributing to development efforts. You will collaborate with counterparts across the firm to create a cohesive approach to cloud engineering. Your expertise will be pivotal in integrating services and access routes within hybrid cloud environments, enhancing efficiency and performance. Automation will be your ally as you design, improve, and fully automate CI/CD development cycles, enabling seamless software delivery.
What you ll do
• Manage and support multiple AWS environments, contribute to development, and work with counterparts across the firm to unify cloud engineering efforts.
• Integrate services and access routes in hybrid cloud environment.
• Create, improve, and fully automate CI/CD development cycles.
• Provide recommendations and create demonstration examples of hybrid cloud technology solutions
• Stay abreast of new developments in the areas of cloud technology, services, and networking.
• Work with vendors and vendor solutions to evaluate products, produce recommendations for the firm, and educate internal clients.
What you ll need
• A minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), Oracle Cloud, or Microsoft Azure, configuring different components in Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS).
• Proficiency in infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform, CloudFormation, and related technologies.
• Strong command of at least one back-end programming language such as Python, Java, Ruby, or NodeJS.
• Expertise in cloud automation and serverless architectures, including services like Lambda, SQS, API Gateway, and DynamoDB.
• Proven ability to create highly available and fault-tolerant client-facing environments.
• Skilled in implementing security-first systems, adhering to security policies, and utilizing tools such as IAM, WAFs, and cloud security posture management.
• Deep understanding of cloud-native tools and services for data management and pipe-lining, encompassing virtual private networking, security groups, object storage, and data lakes.
• Working knowledge of networking in hybrid cloud environments.
• Adaptability to a fast-paced, dynamic work environment with a strong work ethic and initiative.
• Proven troubleshooting skills, making effective decisions under pressure.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills, along with a knack for documentation and knowledge management.
• Cloud vendor-specific certifications are a plus.

Job Description
SNC-Lavalin s Atkins Business is hiring an experienced Electrical BIM for our Middle east delivery team. • Problem solving abilities
• Creative thinker with a can-do attitude.
• Confident and professional manner
• Work independently and take proactive initiative.

Diploma / Degree with minimum 5 years of relevant experience in similar position performing the above listed tasks.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

At Aggreko, we provide energy solutions so communities can thrive and businesses can grow. We bring power, heat and cooling to customers and communities wherever they need it. We are hiring immediately for a Senior Development Engineer - a role that will help us to power progress for our customers.

Why Aggreko? Here are some of the perks and rewards.
• A competitive salary and benefits package (including but not limited to pension plan, bonus scheme, and Life Assurance)
• Hybrid working
• Generous holiday entitlement, with option to buy or sell
• A focus on continued personal development
• Discounts & perks
• Cycle to Work scheme
• Paid time off work for volunteering in the community
• Access to our Employee Assistance Programme, which helps promote and support a healthy lifestyle
About this job:
The Senior Development Engineer can lead the technical specification of products (including change requests). The role assists the product management lifecycle support from a technical perspective, but the incumbent must also be commercially aware.
Aggreko operates in a fast-moving, highly commercial environment. To be successful in this role, you will need to be comfortable in a pressurised environment and have the ability to weigh up the commercial impact of balancing competing demands in cost, time and engineering complexity.
Accountability Level:
Experienced individual contributor (specialist operational/technical role, or experienced professional). Works independently, with limited supervision. Problems faced may be difficult but can be addressed within an established framework
Key Responsibilities
• Technology prospecting
• Optimisation of existing products to meet changing market demands
• TC & OFA product data integrity, including the timely delivery of work instructions for product installation, testing, servicing, maintenance & operation and including the required technical competencies
• Assist with specification of new products which meet the design brief and deliver the required compliance, interoperability (across all relevant fleet and customer interfaces), fungibility, reliability, utilization, total cost of ownership and durability
• Define the development costs for a project and be cognisant that budget is not exceeded
• Identify intellectual property used in designs
• Enable continuity of enduring product knowledge
People you'll work with:
Collaboration with a broad range of people and groups is essential. The incumbent will work closely with:
• Product Manager(s) who will provide user requirements from which products can be specified
• Project manager(s) who will support delivery of fleet optimisation and new product development
• The full range of the product management team to enable maximum interoperability
• A variety of engineering resources from across the group
• The Product Data Management team to ensure the information for which the role is responsible is properly maintained and made available
• Suppliers for the purpose of establishing enduring partnerships with the aim of getting the very best from the service they provide, which also involves close collaboration with the internal procurement function
The global engineering community to whom the role provides the ultimate point of escalation for technical product questions and from whom can be gleaned product optimisation opportunities as well as a shared understanding or Regional product development programs.

Typical Experience:
• Engineering degree or similar
• 10 years of product engineering experience in industry, preferably in rental markets or with OEM rental suppliers
• Program management
• Communication: engaging and influential
• A sense of urgency and determination to meet tight timelines for complex deliverables
Join us, bring your energy, and grow your career.

We encourage everyone to be themselves at work because we know that s how we do our best, for each other, for our customers, for the communities where we work, and for our careers.

Roles & Responsibilities

Position Summary
Location
Doha
Consulting | Customer & Marketing | T echnicalArchitect
When you work for us, you commit to a career at one of the largest and most prestigious professional services firms in the world. Looking for a rewarding career? Take a closer look at Deloitte & Touche ME. You'll understand that Deloitte is certified as a Great Place to Work (GPTW) and on the list of the Top 20 Best Workplaces in the UAE. It has also received numerous awards in the last few years which include Best Employer in the Middle East, best consulting firm, and the Middle East Training & Development Excellence Award by the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (ICAEW).
Our experienced technology professionals offer deep technical experience in their area of focus and are committed to delivering efficient, technology-based solutions to our clients. Our professionals are also aligned to industry sectors. By combining our technical capabilities with our industry experiences, we create unmatched market offerings to solve our clients' business issues. Additionally, we have long-term partnerships with many of the world's leading technology companies, allowing us to understand solution alternatives and recommend and support the most appropriate solution for our clients. By leveraging these elements, we are able to help our clients convert leading edge ideas into tangible results.
Our Purpose
Deloitte makes an impact that matters. Every day we challenge ourselves to do what matters most for clients, for our people, and for society. We serve clients distinctively, bringing innovative insights, solving complex challenges, and unlocking sustainable growth. We inspire our talented professionals to deliver outstanding value to clients, providing an exceptional career experience and an inclusive and collaborative culture. We contribute to society, building confidence and trust in the markets, upholding the integrity of organizations, and supporting our communities.
Our shared values guide the way we behave to make a positive, enduring impact:
• Integrity
• Outstanding value to markets and clients
• Commitment to each other
• Strength from cultural diversity
We are looking for a Technical Architect that will be able to to understand requirements, analyse complex business processes, and translate them into scalable and efficient technical solutions on the Salesforce platform.
Responsibilities:
• Lead the architecture and design of Salesforce solutions, ensuring alignment with business goals, industry best practices, and Salesforce platform capabilities.
• Gather and analyse business requirements, translating them into functional and technical specifications.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables.
• Develop comprehensive technical designs, including data models, integration strategies, and custom development solutions.
• Provide expert guidance and mentorship to development teams throughout the project lifecycle.
• Perform code reviews to ensure adherence to coding standards, best practices, and optimization techniques.
• Oversee the implementation and configuration of Salesforce platform components, including custom objects, workflows, triggers, and validation rules.
• Identify areas for process improvement and recommend solutions to enhance system performance and user experience.
• Stay up to date with the latest Salesforce features and releases, leveraging new functionalities to drive innovation and efficiency.
• Act as a subject matter expert and provide technical guidance to stakeholders, project managers, and development teams.
• The candidate must be inquisitive about the enhancements, changes as part of Salesforce releases, industry changes and motivate team to align with latest trends in the industry and technology
Experience Requirements :
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
• 8+ years of experience in delivering Salesforce solutions.
• Proven experience as a Salesforce Technical Architect, with a strong track record of successfully delivering complex Salesforce solutions.
• Salesforce certifications such as Salesforce Certified Technical Architect (CTA), Salesforce Certified System Architect, or Salesforce Certified Application Architect.
• In-depth knowledge of Salesforce platform features, capabilities, and limitations.
• Proficiency in Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Web Components (LWC), and other Salesforce development tools.
• Strong understanding of integration patterns and experience with integration technologies (REST, SOAP, JSON, XML, etc.).
• Experience in DevOps processes and tools like JIRA, BitBucket, Bamboo, etc.
• Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to quickly comprehend complex business processes and propose effective solutions.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders.
• Proven ability to lead and mentor development teams, providing technical guidance and support.
• Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and experience working in Agile teams.
• Experience with data migration and data management strategies in Salesforce.
• Expert understanding of Design Patterns and Architectural Styles
• Integration experience with on-premises systems leveraging platforms such as Mulesoft, Dell Boomi or Informatica
• Knowledge of Salesforce best practices.
Location:
KSA/Qatar/Jordan/UAE

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

The Application Specialist will use their healthcare, business and InterSystems product knowledge to ensure that we contract and implement InterSystems products in a successful, standard and timely manner. The Application Specialist will become an expert in Billing/ Healthcare Revenue Cycle Management & Claims resource for customers and will be expected to understand the customer process, assess solution best fit and advise the customer how to best implement the standard solution as early as possible. Advise the customer on driving maximum benefits from the solution, whilst keeping customer specific work to an absolute minimum and liaise with various areas of the business on these accordingly. It is therefore essential, that they keep up to date with new product developments as they become available through the normal product release cycle. The Application Specialist must be available to visit customer sites and may be assigned to projects that require regular travel with the possibility of spending up to 5 days away from home each week.
The Application Specialist will act in accordance with the latest version of the InterSystems ARIES Customer Engagement Methodology, which will be modified from time to time as part of our ongoing culture of continuous improvement. The Application Specialist will undertake the following:
Essential
• Excellent communication skills and experience of conducting customer training, workshops and/or presentations
• Excellent consultative skills ability to articulate and communicate ideas
• Experience interacting directly with customers, including clinicians, and confidently delivering strong messaging
• At least 3 years experience working in healthcare and a good understanding of administrative and/or clinical processes/ Billing RCM
• Experience implementing software solutions
• Experience contributing to a multi-disciplined team
• Experience with writing functional documents
• Experience of business process mapping
• Knowledge of Information Systems
• Proficiency in English
• University degree
Desirable
• Experience in communicating with key stakeholders at various levels within healthcare organisations which may be government/public and/or private sector businesses
• Experience with EMR systems
• Exposure to IT services in a customer-facing setting
• Previous experience as an Application or Configuration Specialist
• Previous experience of change management
• Good computer skills
• Experience conducting software testing
About InterSystems
Established in 1978, InterSystems provides innovative data solutions for organizations with critical information needs in the healthcare, finance, and logistics sectors and beyond. Our cloud-first data platforms solve interoperability, speed, and scalability problems for organizations around the globe. InterSystems also develops and supports data management in hospitals through the world s most proven electronic medical record, as well as unified care records for health systems and governments through a powerful suite of healthcare data integration solutions. The company is committed to excellence through its award-winning, 24 7 support for customers and partners in more than 80 countries. Privately held and headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, InterSystems has 25 offices worldwide. For more information, please visit InterSystems.com .

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

About HALCON
HALCON is a regional and international leader that offers next-generation Weapons Systems and Robotics Expertise to meet the challenges of a rapidly changing world. HALCON has developed in-house expertise across the entire value chain for gravity-release bomb guidance systems. This includes design, development, testing, manufacturing and assembly. Our end-to-end capabilities ensure exceptional quality and competitive pricing. As well, we are faster and more flexible in meeting customer requirements.
Key Accountabilities:
• Mechanical Design:
• Provide in-house mechanical design capabilities to support the various development design programs.
• Design Life Cycle:
• Execute mechanical design and support work throughout the life-cycle of the system under development, including conceptual design, preliminary design, detail design, development, manufacture, production, end-use support, and phase-out/disposal.
• Engineering Calculations:
• Perform precise engineering calculations using theoretical methods and computational simulations to validate and optimize designs.
• Engineering Arrangements:
• Devise, organize, and ensure engineering arrangements and revisions are effectively implemented throughout projects.
• Test Specifications:
• Establish test specifications and procedures to ensure that all design requirements are met during testing and validation phases.
• Performance Evaluation:
• Evaluate the performance of mechanical equipment against set performance requirements, recommending modifications as needed.
• Mentorship:
• Mentor and monitor junior mechanical engineers within the team, providing guidance and technical support to enhance their skills and capabilities.
• Team Leadership:
• Supervise and support technical personnel reporting to your function, ensuring they deliver on their responsibilities as designated by the Lead Engineer
Experience & Education Qualifications:
• Expertise: 8 yr. (Bachelor s), 7 yr. (Master s) or 6 yr. (PhD) of related experience, preferably, in the aerospace industry
• Minimum Qualification: Bachelor s or Master s degree and/or equivalent technical qualification in mechanical or aerospace engineering
• Defence Industry: Working knowledge in the broad spectrum of mechanical engineering as related to guided munition development and manufacturing
Key Skills:
• Able to deal with work-related deadlines
• A thorough understanding of defence product development and production
• Assume accountability and responsibilities
• Strong CAE, math and Product Data Management skills
• Technical communication (Written and oral.) with technical and non-technical personnel, suppliers and customers
• Visual and spatial awareness, attention to detail, problem solving
#HALCON

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview Active Directory System Engineers support our Enterprise-class infrastructure in the RCC-SWA. RCC-SWA engineers provide optimization, administration, and technical documentation of all enterprise infrastructure systems. Resolves and appropriately completes assigned cases and change requests and acts as an escalation of support issues. The core infrastructure technology duties include enterprise Microsoft Active Directory and Windows file services architecture creation and management, system security and policy configuration, and top-level support for enterprise-wide initiatives. This position offers company-paid housing and transportation, a completion bonus and tuition reimbursement program! Important Note: You must satisfy all host country requirements to legally work in the host country in order to be qualified for this position. Responsibilities Produce enterprise-level support for Active Directory and Windows File Services for global initiatives following those through to implementation via collaboration with project and support teams. Own Root Cause Analysis and Problem Management for corporate Identity Management environment. Serves as escalation point for application support and troubleshooting, provides guidance and direction in the resolution of escalated issues and complex production, application or system problems. Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs. Install, configure, and maintain Active Directory and third-party software utilities for hardware systems within operational guidelines. Create and maintain system documentation for domain technologies, including installation, configuration, and appropriate troubleshooting steps. Improve existing processes through solutions to recurring problems and enhancements to existing solutions or documentation. Ability to troubleshoot servers and infrastructure equipment Ability to assess networking requirements and provide solutions Ability to make accurate and independent decisions under pressure Experience with a customer service oriented company Excellent organizational, interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills Ability to perform comfortably in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented work environment Ability to successfully execute many complex tasks simultaneously Qualifications Minimum Qualifications Associates Degree or equivalent experience preferably in Computer Science or MIS, IS, Engineering or related field. One-year related experience can be substituted for one year of education if the degree is required. One year of related academic study above the high school level may be substituted for one year of experience up to a maximum of a 4-year bachelor's degree in a Software Engineering or Business Information Systems discipline for three years general experience. Candidate must be able to withstand extreme heat physically. Experience Minimum of four (4) years' of experience in administrative, technical work, which demonstrated the ability and aptitudes, required to perform technical, managerial, or analytical work and coordination involving management information systems. Platforms including a combination of the following: Microsoft, Networking services for Directory, DNS, DHCP for devices and users in a worldwide WAN. Certifications This position requires candidates to adhere to DoD 8570.01-M. All candidates are required to maintain at least one (1) baseline certification and one (1) computing environment (CE) certification. The authorized certifications for this job title are listed as follows: IAT Level IAT III Baseline CASP, CCNP Security, CISA, CISSP (or Associate), GCED, GCIH CE MCSA: Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate: Cloud Platform MCSA: Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate: Windows 10 MCSA: Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate: Windows Server 2012 MCSA: Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate: Windows Server 2016 MCSE: Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert: Cloud Platform and Infrastructure MCSE: Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert: Data Management and Analytics MCSE: Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert: Productivity.
