Roles & Responsibilities

CAD Draughtsman
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
Position status: Open
About our Client
Our client is a leading manufacturer of land systems. They design and manufacture a variety of platforms for international military and law enforcement.
Description
As a CAD Draughtsman your main objective will be to provide computer-aided design (CAD) and detail drafting support to existing & new product development and standard CAD support to engineering activities using CAD Software CREO V3.0
You will draw using computer hardware and software, Model Check for Design Department, Update and troubleshoot existing Workflows, draft routine working sketches and layouts, create and revise CAD models.
You will also update and revise 2D drawings on changes needed by the Design team, manage drawing system integrity in the product data management system (Windchill), improve equipment, manufacturing methods and processes to meet safety, quality, and reliability requirements as well as ensuring appropriate application of GD&T requirements.

Bachelors/ Vocational degree in Engineering (Mechanical / Electrical) with advanced knowledge of CAD tools, updating and troubleshooting existing PDMLink / Windchill workflows.
4-5 years of CAD designing experience, 2+ years of experience; preferably in a manufacturing environment.
You must possess and apply critical thinking and collaborative approaches to improve services and solve technical challenges.
Excellent writing skills in both technical and non-technical terminology, advanced English, and Arabic language skills as well as advanced computer skills are required for this role.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

About HALCON
HALCON is a regional and international leader that offers next-generation Weapons Systems and Robotics Expertise to meet the challenges of a rapidly changing world. HALCON has developed in-house expertise across the entire value chain for gravity-release bomb guidance systems. This includes design, development, testing, manufacturing and assembly. Our end-to-end capabilities ensure exceptional quality and competitive pricing. As well, we are faster and more flexible in meeting customer requirements.
Key Accountabilities:
• Manage the catering services from collection of daily requirements & coordination with Catering service provider
• Conduct monthly Food committee meeting, confirmation of menu and coordination with service provider
• Collect and process the catering invoice claims and follow up with the Finance department on payments
• Generate monthly grocery requirements and coordinate with Halcon procurement department to place the order of the required quantity
• Distribute grocery items to various facilities and maintain documentation of vendor delivery and issues to facilities
• Collect and process invoice claims for electricity, water & BTU, follow up with Finance on payments where required
• Monitor facility building rent contracts and follow up with Halcon contract department for contract renewal
• Review and develop the Asset Management policy and procedures as required
• Oversee the effective functioning of the Asset Management process and system in line with the Company s Asset Management policy and procedures
• Operate Asset Management software ensuring data accuracy, integrity and maintenance
• Maintain and regularly update the Physical Asset Register (PAR) ensuring all assets are recorded and barcoded including printing of RFID tags and tagging of assets
• Ensure all assets are properly classified, categorised and recorded in the AM software
• Conduct periodic audits, checks and physical verification of current and new assets to ensure compliance with fixed asset accounting rules
• Arrange meeting with various departments for reconciliation of asset data with Purchase order & SAP
• Process asset transfer requests including the response to emergency requests as required
• Ensure record and prepare report on the details of lost, theft and defective assets
• Prepare monthly asset statistical data and report to Management and the Leadership team
• Assess Scrap items before proceeding to the next level as per approved policies and procedures

_____________________________________________________________________________________
Job Title: Customer Service Specialist
Location: Dubai, UAE
Reporting structure: Giulia Beccaria, Operations Coordinator
Peter Davos, CEO
Hale Education Group
Hale Education Group is a leading independent educational consulting firm focusing on US university admissions in
the GCC. We provide college admissions counseling to Emirati and international students seeking admission to the
full spectrum of US and Canadian universities and colleges. Our innovative model has evolved from our deep
background and broad experience in admissions counseling in the United States. We center our services on
providing intensive one-on-one counseling and guidance to students in every aspect of US college admissions,
based on the philosophy of finding the right “fit." Hale’s mission is to guide and empower students seeking to
realize their maximum personal, academic, and professional potential through the pursuit of American higher
education.
Hale Education Group employs an entire team of American university professionals with relevant firsthand
admissions experience, education, and knowledge. Our admissions counseling model is highly personalized, as all
Our sessions are conducted one-on-one with students. We are defined by our collaboration with parents and
students, as well as our innovative use of technology. Our team is composed of highly qualified Americans with
advanced degrees.
SUMMARY
Do you want to join a fast growing small company that has helped positively impact young people’s lives?
Do you want to live in one of the world’s most dynamic and cosmopolitan international cities, live tax-free and
enjoy generous benefits?
Are you passionate about providing extraordinary customer experience?
The purpose of this position is to interact with our guests and ensure that you are delivering exceptional clerical,
administrative, and customer service skills at all times.
You will join a company with an excellent reputation in the Gulf region in US admissions counseling and will work
with a team of counselors with whom you share responsibility for guiding students through the complicated maze
of US college admissions. You will be asked to attend events as a representative of Hale Education Group, meet
with parents and prospects, and monitor and manage the admissions processes.
_____________________________________________________________________________________

The Customer Service Specialist’s responsibilities include:
● Excellent communication skills.
● The ability to manage various deadlines.

specific service.
● Interacting with customers via telephone, email, online communication, or in person to provide support
and information on requested services.
● Ensuring that appropriate actions are taken to resolve customer’s satisfaction.
● Maintains accounts and records of client interactions with details of inquiries, feedback, or comments.
● Uses knowledge of a specific service or other assigned area of expertise to answer inquiries or to forward
to the appropriate personnel.
● Answer incoming calls and assist with confirmations, and other scheduling duties.
● Provides data management, ensures all systems are updated consistently, and customer information is
updated accurately.
● These duties are included as above, but not limited to.
QUALIFICATIONS
Required Qualifications:
● High school diploma.
● Customer service experience required.
● Front office experience in hospitality required.
● Must be fluent in written and spoken English.
● Strong attention to detail, time management and organizational skills.
● Team player.
LOGISTICS
Salary:
● Negotiable depending upon experience.
Employment and Working Hours:
● 45 hours per business week, including 1 hour break daily.
Benefits:
● Stipend for annual r/t ticket home.
● 30 calendar days of paid vacation per year.
● All government-private sector holidays are off.
● Health insurance, residence visa, and Emirates ID paid at company expense.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Aramco energizes the world economy.
Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer. With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco s value to society.
Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom s vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply. We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.
Overview
The Investment & Portfolio Analysis Division in the Downstream Strategy and Capital Planning Department (DS&CP) is seeking a Downstream Strategy & Planning Specialist. DS&CP is responsible for the coordination of all of SAO s Downstream Investment Plan and Strategy. It also provides quantitative input to SAO s Downstream Strategy Council, working in close co-operation with its adjacent Divisions of Strategy & Capital Planning. The Specialist s primary role is to provide quantitative analysis and confirmation of the strategic fit of SAO s Investment Plan. The Investment & Portfolio Analysis Division in the Downstream Strategy and Capital Planning Department (DS&CP) is seeking a Downstream Strategy & Planning Specialist. DS&CP is responsible for the coordination of all of SAO s Downstream Investment Plan and Strategy. It also provides quantitative input to SAO s Downstream Strategy Council, working in close co-operation with its adjacent Divisions of Strategy & Capital Planning. The Specialist s primary role is to provide quantitative analysis and confirmation of the strategic fit of SAO s Investment Plan.
Key Responsibilities
• Provide techno-economic analysis on Downstream opportunities. Mainly focusing on Refining / Petrochemicals integrated assets and their interaction with further Downstream (Trading, Retail) hydrocarbon value chain segments.
• Collaborate with all of Downstream s Admin Areas and other corporate functions in establishing and updating appropriate investment analysis criteria.
• Provide commercial and technical expertise for downstream strategy, including appraisal of strategic options, identification of strategic tradeoffs and implementation plans.
• Develop quantitative analysis on sustainability / ESG implications on SAO s Downstream Investment Plan.
Minimum Requirements
• Bachelor s degree in Engineering related field, MBA or a relevant advanced degree is strongly preferred.
• Minimum of 15 years of professional experience in operations, technology & business development, with a strong track record of economic and commercial evaluations for downstream opportunities. Mainly refining and petrochemicals and also other segments (trading, retail, low carbon energies).
• Experience with asset techno-economic modelling and optimization tools (e.g. PIMS, Petroplan ) as well as data management and use from main downstream / industry consulting entities.
• Knowledge of Refining and Chemicals process technologies. Including recent developments in the sustainability space (decarbonization, circularity, non-fossil feedstocks and related).
• Knowledge and understanding of the global energy markets and trends.
• Ideally, international and multi-cultural working exposure.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

The role of a customer experience (CX) Manager is to ensure that the company follows a customer-centric approach and delivers a smooth, unfragmented and consistent customer experience across all touchpoints and at all stages of the buyer journey across all Direct Operations (Emirates/Qatar/KSA)
A customer experience manager is responsible for keeping track of customer journeys, interacting with customers across channels and platforms, and coordinating with all internal stakeholders such as sales, marketing, business operation, service and finance, in order to keep fine-tuning the customer s experience.
The customer experience Manager need to track a complex buyer journey across online and offline platforms and touchpoints. Each touchpoint where customers interact, transact or engage with the brand is an opportunity to build a positive predisposition towards the brand, or a minefield where the customer can be put off the brand for good.
What we give
With Canon, you'll get the support and encouragement you need to grow, from people who share your ambition. We'll invest in your professional development to help you learn and progress in your role with us. You'll find leaders who give you the freedom to explore new things and a team where knowledge is shared openly.
• Oversee the strategy, planning, and execution of the organization s overall customer experience goals.
• Understand customer base, then transform their needs into reality by managing multiple programs and projects to build the right experience for customers.
• Identifying ideal customer profiles and mapping customer journeys to identify the gaps in customer experience across all touchpoints, for all kinds of customer interactions, transactions and engagements from purchase to product return to customer support.
• Liaise with internal teams such as marketing, sales, product development, account management, billing, finance, etc. to ensure that gaps in the customer experience- irrespective of where they occur in the journey are plugged
• Regular communication with internal stakeholders such as customer service executives and other customer-facing teams to identify gaps and opportunities, if any in the brand experience
• Raising red flags wherever the business process billing, installation or anything pre or post sales needs correction to ensure the customer has a seamless experience with the company
• Ensuring the CX strategies are aligned to the larger marketing and business goals and outcomes
• Collect, track and analyze customer feedback and suggest improvements internally based on the insights gathered help measure metrics such as Net Promoter Score (NPS) to gauge how the brand is performing on CX performance parameters
• Work with the technology teams to ensure a seamless brand and buying experience with the technology- be it the brand website or a self-service portal
• Build solid initiatives to track Employee Satisfaction Rate in terms of department tools, processes, and management support. Then work towards defining gaps and improving employees experience
What we ask
•
Bachelor s Degree in any field

B2B Account Management background is preferred
• Working experience of minimum 8+ years in a customer facing role.

Proven account management or relationship management

Outstanding business development & negotiation skills

Excellent Interpersonal & Communication Skills (written & verbal)

Generally, technically savvy, and open to tech products

Technical expertise would be a plus, but not a deal-breaker; we will train!

Excellent Mathematical & analytical thinking

Experience using MS Office tools, Advanced Salesforce.com usage & Knowledge

Adaptable to unforeseen situations, keep focus on the customer & make empowered decisions with integrity, empathy, & compassion.

Consultative sales skills required to assist in explaining product benefits & features, overcoming objections, & closing sales

Excellent listener, assertive, persistent, persuasive & results oriented

Valid UAE driving license & car is a must
You will need
• Empathy and Listening skills
• Collaboration & project management
• Speed flexibility & agility
• Data management & analytics
Canon is enriching lives and businesses in incredible new ways. You can play a part in shaping the future of a company that s visionary, innovative and bold. As the world's best imaging company, we're living and working together for the common good.

Job Description
We re looking for talented Designer who is a confident, creative, and proven collaborator who believes flexibility, adaptability, agility are the keys to success. It s an amazing time to join the Creative Team at Informa Markets, as we continue to deliver game-changing creative experiences for some of the best brands in the events world. This is where you come in.
As a Graphic Designer, you will play a crucial role in conceptualizing, designing, and executing visually appealing and engaging graphic solutions for a variety of mediums. Leveraging your extensive experience and expertise in design principles, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to create innovative designs that effectively communicate messages, enhance brand identity, and drive business objectives. In addition, you will mentor and guide junior designers, ensuring high-quality design output and fostering a creative and collaborative work environment.
Reporting to the Creative Lead, you ll have experience in all things design and bring the flair, ideas, and skills to deliver innovative experiences...no Comic Sans around here. You should have the skills and attributes to be flexible, versatile and can articulate the value of a concept or visual design to key stakeholders and team members with equal effectiveness.
This role requires a deep understanding of all design and digital executions, from best practice to user behaviors, as well as knowing the latest trends and opportunities in the design industry.
• Respond to creative design briefs for ongoing projects and team pitches.
• Be proactive and continue to bring forward ideas, both big and small, to pitch to teams.
• Respond to in-house and team feedback in a professional and timely manner.
• Handle ad hoc projects with quick turnaround times when necessary.
• Keep up to date with media production for digital, online and print. Know the technical specifications and best practices for each of them.
• Participate in pitch processes and brainstorming sessions with the wider team.
• Maintain an organized file structure and data management system that allows all team members to easily access project files.
• Stay up to date with current design trends and always be on the lookout for new techniques, styles, and cool, shiny tricks.
• Oh, and you ll have fun of course. Desired Candidate Profile
Qualifications
• 5 years of experience as a designer in events industry or with an agency.
• You have strong visual and conceptual skills, with the technical ability behind the computer to back this up.
• You ve got a desire to grow and learn more about workflows, pushing design thinking and working with different visual styles.
• Strong organizations skills and the ability to work on multiple projects at the same time.
• Creative, resourceful, and dedicated to fully understanding the problem before reaching a solution.
• You love working as part of a creative team and bouncing ideas off each other to produce the best possible work.
• You have experience in Adobe Creative Suite, Animation skills are a HUGE plus but not a necessity (if you have references of this make sure you show us).
• You re an excellent communicator.
• A high attention to detail is a must.
• Having UX/UI skills is a big bonus point.

Roles & Responsibilities

For one or our Client we are looking for a passionate, forward-thinking Senior UX Research Consultant creates impactful conceptual ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design. As part of a transnational team, the sr researcher drive the research of the mobile and desktop applications with fellow researchers, designers, product managers, and software developers. A senior UX Researcher should have fully technical skills over tools and methodologies applied to UX Research projects. This role should co-work with the rest of the design teams for execution, and follow-up of the projects, including coaching, client facing and delivery.
What You'll Do:
• Develop a trusted reputation as a research expert and a product and design thought leader among designers, product managers, engineers, and data analysts who care deeply about creating top?notch user experiences.
• Create and own your research roadmap, prioritizing research that will have the most significant impact on your teams product strategy and roadmap.
• Execute best in class generative and evaluative research end to end, including project scoping and design, execution, analysis, socialization, and activation.
• Sustain an informed and empathetic organization by strengthening our understanding of our customers and evangelizing research insights throughout the company.
• Highlight usability issues and advise your team on how to improve them.
• Increase research efficiency by contributing to the optimization of tools, processes, and workflows with the research team.
• Share your passion, expertise, and knowledge to help elevate your fellow researchers and the research function.
Requirements:
• 5+ years of professional and 3+ years of practical UX research experience with experience testing consumer software across multiple surfaces (Desktop, Mobile Web, iOS and, Android).
• Track record of utilizing multiple qualitative and/or quantitative research methods to drive business and product decisions.
• End-to-end experience with all aspects of user research (study design, recruiting, moderation, analysis, reporting).
• A portfolio demonstrating your work as a UX researcher along with stories about how your research helped fuel product breakthroughs.
• Experience working with stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into study designs and research questions.
• Excellent communication, presentation and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively to different audiences.
• Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Design, Sociology, Psychology, Anthropology or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience:
• 5+ years of professional UX Research experience, having done multiple successful Projects.
• Passion for making high-quality experiences, and a demonstrable portfolio.
• Experience directing and mentoring designers.
Position Details:
• Job type: Full time, Contractual.
• Travel: Expected up to 70%.
• Location: Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

We are Data Solutions and Digital Services, leaders in tech-driven innovation. Our goal is to equip businesses with advanced digital solutions for growth and success. Our strength lies in fostering a collaborative environment that nurtures creativity and talent.
The web team works in a multi-disciplinary environment UI/UX designers and other developers to bring exciting new web and mobile projects to life. We help and learn from each other and constantly strive to improve both our work and our processes.
Required Skills And Experience:
Demonstrable experience of work on modern web and mobile applications
A strong understanding of HTML, CSS with SCSS, Typescript, React and React Native
Experience with React libraries (TanStack, Redux, Saga, ...)
Experience with TypeScript
Experience with Ant Design
Experience with responsive user interfaces for a wide range of devices and browsers
Experience with Git
Awareness of SEO best practices
A strong understanding of web performance in complex user interfaces
Ability to interact with UX, designers and server-side developers
Curiosity about technology and a thirst to learn
University degree or equivalent education
Who you are:
We want a Web Developer who loves what he/she do. You are passionate about web standards and keep abreast of new developments in our industry. You have strong attention to detail and value the design of a product as much as you value the code. You'll create high fidelity web and mobile applications using modern technologies

Work closely with UX designers and visual designers to implement exemplary user experiences

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

JOB PURPOSE :
To review credit data management processes, recommending improvements, overseeing credit risk platforms and manage systems development, enhancements or changes, implementing and supporting the implementation of new systems from credit risk perspective in order to optimise resource utilisation, minimise associated costs and improve workflow/productivity
ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Lead projects from risk perspective liaising with stakeholders for completion in order to keep them updated on progress and to identify areas of concern that need to be addressed
Support automation efforts of other credit risk teams and share expertise in data architecture and extraction in order to promote best practices in risk data management
2. Management of Credit Systems
Manage credit risk systems databases and collaborate with the relevant stakeholders in order to maintain and improve the systems
In conjunction with IT, conduct regular reviews of database design, system mapping, logic, data extraction and report generation in order to provide fit for purpose solutions within budget
Support implementation of new systems by other units in the bank to ensure the credit risk perspective is adequately incorporated in the same
Design, run and maintain the Risk Adjusted Return on Capital (RAROC) and other dashboards for ensuring maintenance and use of best practices, industry benchmarks, credit policy compliance and portfolio quality standards in order to identify and recommend improvement areas
3.Data Management Framework
Act as back-up for data management function maintaining the required data, reviewing the data extracted and stored to ensure compliance with the Data Management Functions requirements
Design, build and maintain master risk database in order to serve as credit risk s single source of information
Integrate where required data from ADCB s subsidiaries into HO DataMart s to ensure accuracy of database
4.External stakeholders like CBRB, AECB, Auditors etc.
Ensure data submission with predefined frequency in a timely manner to all regulatory / external bodies.
5.People Management
Manage self and team in line with ADCB s people management policies, procedures, processes and practices to ensure adherence and to maximise own and employee contribution to business performance
Manage the effective achievement of the team s objectives through setting individual objectives, managing performance, developing the team and providing formal and informal feedback to maximise overall performance, engagement and motivation
6.Budget Management
Contribute to the preparation of the business area s budget and manage and monitor the financial performance against the budget so that areas of unsatisfactory performance are identified, rectified promptly and potential performance improvement opportunities are capitalised upon
7.Policies, Processes, Systems and Procedures
Recommend and implement improvements to departmental policies, procedures and processes covering all areas of activity so that all relevant procedural requirements are fulfilled while ensuring that ADCB delivers best-in-class services, products and innovation
8.Continuous Improvement
Identify opportunities to contribute to organisational and departmental change initiatives, programmes and projects taking into account best practice and standards in the business environment
9.Customer Service
Demonstrate Our Promise and apply the ADCB Service Standards to deliver the bank s required levels of service in all internal and external customer interactions

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking an experienced ARC GIS developer with expertise in Dojo and Oracle to join our team. As an ARC GIS Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining GIS applications and solutions, leveraging the ARC GIS platform along with the Dojo toolkit and Oracle database. Your primary focus will be on creating dynamic and interactive user interfaces using Dojo, integrating it with ARC GIS functionalities, and ensuring seamless integration with Oracle for geospatial data management.

Responsibilities:
• Develop GIS applications: design, code, test, debug, and deploy GIS applications using the ARC GIS platform, with a strong emphasis on utilising the Dojo toolkit for creating user interfaces and Oracle for data management.
• Dojo integration: Integrate the Dojo toolkit with ARC GIS functionalities to develop interactive and visually appealing user interfaces for GIS applications.
• Custom application development: Create custom tools, scripts, and workflows using Dojo to enhance GIS functionality and automate processes.
• Geospatial analysis: Perform complex spatial analysis, geoprocessing tasks, and data modelling using ARC GIS tools and libraries while leveraging Dojo for visualisations and user interactions.
• Data management with Oracle: Manage geospatial data in Oracle, including data acquisition, integration, transformation, and quality assurance, ensuring effective integration with ARC GIS.
• Collaborate with stakeholders: work closely with clients, GIS analysts, and other team members to gather requirements, understand project objectives, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
• Documentation: Prepare technical documentation, including system specifications, user manuals, and test plans, specifically highlighting the Oracle integration aspects.
• Troubleshooting and support: Investigate and resolve issues related to GIS applications, provide technical support, and perform system maintenance tasks with expertise in both ARC GIS, Dojo, and Oracle.
• Stay updated with industry trends: Keep abreast of the latest GIS technologies, Dojo toolkit advancements, Oracle database capabilities, tools, and best practises, and evaluate their potential for implementation. Desired Candidate Profile
• Bachelor's degree in computer science, Geographic Information Systems, or a related field
• Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in developing GIS applications using the ARC GIS platform, with a strong focus on the Dojo toolkit and Oracle database.
• Proficiency in the ARC GIS software suite, including ARCMap, ARC Catalogue, and ARCGIS Server
• Extensive experience and expertise in the Dojo toolkit for web application development, including creating dynamic user interfaces, widgets, and data visualisations.
• Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, JavaScript, or C#
• Experience with ARC GIS APIs and SDKs, such as ARCObjects, the ARC REST API, or the ARC GIS Runtime, and their integration with Dojo
• Solid understanding of geospatial concepts, data formats (shapefile, GeoJSON, etc.), and coordinate systems.
• Expertise in Oracle databases for geospatial data management, including data modelling, SQL queries, and spatial indexing.
• Familiarity with web-based GIS technologies like Web Mapping APIs (Leaflet, Open Layers) and web services (WMS, WFS).
• Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
• Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and clients.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description: Summary:
The Computer Engineer position in Abu Dhabi, UAE, within the Engineering & Manufacturing industry, involves utilizing computer engineering principles and technical expertise to develop and maintain computer systems, networks, and software applications. The role primarily focuses on designing and implementing efficient computing solutions to support the organization's engineering and manufacturing processes.
Key Responsibilities:
Systems design and development: Design, develop, and maintain computer systems, including hardware and software components, to support engineering and manufacturing processes. This involves selecting appropriate technologies, ensuring compatibility, and optimizing system performance.
Software development: Develop and maintain software applications tailored to the specific needs of engineering and manufacturing operations. This includes programming, debugging, and testing software solutions to improve efficiency, automate processes, and enhance productivity.
Network infrastructure management: Design, implement, and maintain computer networks and infrastructure to support data communication, collaboration, and information sharing across various departments. Ensure network security and performance optimization.
Troubleshooting and technical support: Diagnose and resolve hardware and software issues, providing technical support to end-users and addressing any system-related problems to minimize downtime and disruptions in operations.
Data management and analysis: Develop and implement data management systems to organize and store engineering and manufacturing data securely. Use data analysis tools to extract insights, identify patterns, and support decision-making processes.
System integration and automation: Integrate different engineering and manufacturing systems, such as CAD/CAM software, PLCs, and SCADA systems, to streamline processes and improve overall system performance. Develop automation solutions to optimize efficiency and reduce manual intervention.
Collaboration and project management: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineers, technicians, and IT professionals, to coordinate projects, manage resources, and ensure the successful implementation of computer engineering solutions. Desired Candidate Profile
Job Requirement: Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. Strong knowledge of computer hardware, software development, and network infrastructure. Proficiency in programming languages, such as C++, Python, or Java. Familiarity with engineering software and tools, such as CAD/CAM, PLC, and SCADA systems. Understanding of network protocols, security, and data management principles. Analytical and problem-solving skills to diagnose and resolve technical issues. Excellent communication and teamwork skills to collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders. Project management experience is a plus.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Job Summary: The Lab Supervisor is responsible for the efficient and safe operation of the laboratory. This includes supervising laboratory staff, ensuring compliance with safety protocols and regulatory standards, managing equipment and resources, and supporting research or testing activities. The Lab Supervisor plays a key role in maintaining a productive and organized laboratory environment.
Key Responsibilities:
• Laboratory Management:
• Oversee day-to-day laboratory operations, including scheduling, resource allocation, and workflow coordination.
• Ensure the availability of necessary supplies, reagents, and equipment for experiments or tests.
• Maintain cleanliness, orderliness, and safety within the laboratory.
• Staff Supervision:
• Recruit, train, and supervise laboratory personnel, including technicians, assistants, and interns.
• Provide guidance, mentoring, and performance feedback to team members.
• Ensure compliance with laboratory policies and safety procedures.
• Quality Assurance and Compliance:
• Ensure that all laboratory activities adhere to regulatory standards, such as ISO, CLIA, or other relevant guidelines.
• Develop and enforce quality control protocols to maintain accurate and reliable results.
• Keep abreast of industry best practices and regulatory changes.
• Equipment and Maintenance:
• Oversee the maintenance and calibration of laboratory equipment and instruments.
• Troubleshoot equipment issues and coordinate repairs or replacements as needed.
• Ensure the proper disposal of hazardous materials and waste.
• Data Management:
• Maintain accurate records of experiments, tests, and research findings.
• Ensure data integrity, confidentiality, and compliance with data management protocols.
• Assist in data analysis and report generation.
• Research Support:
• Collaborate with researchers, scientists, or project leads to support ongoing experiments and projects.
• Assist in the design and execution of experiments when necessary.
• Contribute to research proposals and grant applications.
Qualifications:
• Bachelor s or Master s degree in a relevant scientific field (e.g., Biology, Chemistry, Biochemistry, etc.).
• Several years of laboratory experience, with progressively increasing responsibilities.
• Strong leadership and supervisory skills.
• Knowledge of laboratory safety protocols and regulatory compliance.
• Proficiency in using laboratory equipment and software.
• Excellent communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
• Ability to work effectively in a team and multitask in a fast-paced environment.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
A leading reputable Jewelry brand in Zouk Mikael, Lebanon is seeking an experienced and driven E-commerce Manager to oversee the seamless functioning of our online store. As an E-commerce Manager, you will play a vital role in enhancing our customers' online shopping experience and ensuring the efficient integration of data and product management. Your responsibilities will encompass various aspects of website management, from data integration to website auditing, and product addition.
Key Responsibilities:
-Data Integration: Collaborate with the IT team to ensure smooth data integration across different systems, including inventory management, customer databases, and payment gateways. Monitor data accuracy and troubleshoot any integration issues that may arise.
-Website Auditing: Conduct regular website audits to evaluate its performance, user-friendliness, and overall functionality. Identify areas for improvement and implement necessary updates to enhance the website's efficiency and user experience.
-Product Management: Oversee the addition and removal of products on the website. Ensure product information, images, and descriptions are accurate and up-to-date. Monitor product availability and update stock levels accordingly.
-Customer Support: Provide support to customers with inquiries related to the website, products, and orders. Address customer concerns promptly and professionally to ensure a positive shopping experience.
- Conversion Optimization: Collaborate with the marketing team to optimize the website's conversion rate. Analyze user behavior and implement strategies to increase sales and improve overall website performance.
- SEO and Content Management: Work closely with the marketing team to optimize product pages for search engines and ensure SEO best practices are followed. Manage website content and ensure it aligns with the brand's voice and values.
- Analytics and Reporting: Utilize analytics tools to monitor website traffic, user engagement, and sales performance. Generate reports to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.
- Stay Updated with E-commerce Trends: Keep abreast of industry trends and best practices in e-commerce. Implement innovative strategies to stay competitive and enhance the overall online shopping experience.
Qualifications and Requirements:
- Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, E-commerce, or a related field.
- Proven experience in e-commerce management, data integration, and website auditing.
- Strong knowledge of website platforms, CMS, and data management systems.
Familiarity with SEO best practices and conversion optimization techniques.
- Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
- Effective communication and teamwork abilities.
- Detail-oriented with a focus on delivering high-quality results.
As an E-commerce Manager, you will be an integral part of our team, driving the growth and success of our online store. If you are passionate about e-commerce, data management, and website optimization, we welcome you to join our dynamic team and make a significant impact on our digital presence.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description: The BIM (Building Information Modeling) Coordinator is a key role in the construction and building industry, responsible for coordinating and implementing BIM processes throughout the project lifecycle. The BIM Coordinator plays a crucial role in facilitating collaboration and communication among various stakeholders to ensure efficient and effective project delivery.
Key Responsibilities:
BIM Implementation: Lead the implementation of BIM processes and technologies on construction projects. Ensure that BIM standards, protocols, and best practices are followed by all project team members. Develop and maintain project-specific BIM execution plans.
Model Coordination: Coordinate and manage the creation, integration, and maintenance of 3D models, including architectural, structural, and MEP (Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing) disciplines. Resolve clashes or conflicts in the models through clash detection and coordination meetings.
Collaboration and Communication: Facilitate effective communication and collaboration among project stakeholders, including architects, engineers, contractors, and subcontractors. Promote information exchange and coordination through regular meetings and workshops.
Model Quality Control: Conduct regular quality control checks to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and integrity of BIM models. Review and validate model information, including geometry, attributes, and data consistency.
BIM Standards and Guidelines: Stay updated with industry BIM standards, guidelines, and emerging technologies. Ensure compliance with local regulations, project requirements, and BIM protocols.
Training and Support: Provide training and support to project team members on BIM tools, software, and workflows. Assist in resolving technical issues related to BIM implementation.
Data Management: Manage BIM data and project documentation, including model files, drawings, and specifications. Establish and maintain a structured and organized BIM project database.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements, automation, and efficiency gains in BIM workflows. Propose and implement enhancements to optimize project outcomes. Desired Candidate Profile
Job Requirement: Qualifications and Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, or a related field. Proven experience as a BIM Coordinator or a similar role in the construction industry. Proficiency in BIM software platforms such as Autodesk Revit, Navisworks, and BIM 360. Familiarity with BIM standards and protocols, such as COBie, IFC, and LOD (Level of Development). Strong understanding of architectural, structural, and MEP systems. Excellent coordination and communication skills to facilitate collaboration among project stakeholders. Detail-oriented with a focus on quality control and data management. Problem-solving abilities and the capacity to work effectively under pressure. Familiarity with local building codes, regulations, and construction practices. Knowledge of emerging trends and technologies in BIM and digital construction.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Job Description
As a HSE Inspector who is responsible you will be inspecting, monitoring, and promoting compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations and standards in various settings. This role aims to create and maintain a safe and healthy working environment while minimizing the potential impact on the environment.
Responsibilities :
• Conduct regular inspections of workplaces, construction sites, facilities, and equipment to identify potential hazards and ensure compliance with safety standards.
• Perform thorough safety and environmental audits, assess risks, and recommend corrective actions.
• Stay updated on local, regional, and national health, safety, and environmental regulations.
• Ensure that the organization is in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
• Evaluate workplace processes, procedures, and equipment to identify potential risks and hazards.
• Develop risk assessment reports and recommend strategies to mitigate identified risks.
• Provide training sessions, workshops, and educational materials to employees and contractors to raise awareness about safety procedures and practices.
• Promote a culture of safety throughout the organization.
• Investigate accidents, incidents, and near misses to determine their causes and recommend preventive measures.
• Compile incident reports and maintain records of investigations.
• Develop and implement emergency response plans, evacuation procedures, and crisis management protocols.
• Conduct drills and simulations to ensure readiness in case of emergencies.
• Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of inspections, audits, incidents, and corrective actions taken.
• Generate detailed reports for management and regulatory authorities as required.
• Identify potential environmental hazards, such as pollution, waste management issues, and resource conservation.
• Recommend strategies for minimizing the organization's environmental footprint.
• Collaborate with management, supervisors, and employees to address safety concerns and implement best practices.
• Continuously monitor safety and environmental performance, and suggest improvements to existing processes and protocols.
Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in Occupational Health and Safety, Environmental Science, Engineering, or a related field.
• Relevant certifications such as NEBOSH (National Examination Board in Occupational Safety and Health) or UAE-specific HSE certifications.
• In-depth knowledge of UAE HSE regulations, standards, and best practices.
• Strong analytical skills to assess risks and develop effective mitigation strategies.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills in English; Arabic language proficiency is often preferred.
• Experience in conducting inspections, audits, incident investigations, and training.
• Proficiency in using HSE software tools for data management and reporting.
• Ability to work collaboratively and influence stakeholders at all levels.
• Attention to detail and a proactive approach to HSE challenges.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description: A Metering Technician in the Energy & Utilities industry is responsible for the installation, maintenance, calibration, and troubleshooting of energy meters and associated equipment. They ensure accurate and reliable meter readings, monitor energy consumption, and contribute to billing and revenue collection processes.
Key Responsibilities:
Meter Installation and Maintenance: Install and configure energy meters at residential, commercial, and industrial locations. Ensure proper wiring connections, functionality, and compliance with safety standards. Perform routine maintenance and inspections to ensure accurate meter readings.
Meter Calibration: Calibrate energy meters regularly to maintain accuracy and reliability. Use calibration equipment and techniques to adjust meters according to established standards and specifications.
Meter Reading and Data Collection: Collect meter readings manually or using automated systems. Record and document energy consumption data accurately and efficiently. Perform data validation and verification to ensure data integrity.
Troubleshooting and Repairs: Identify and resolve metering issues, such as meter malfunctions, communication errors, or power supply problems. Diagnose problems, replace faulty components if necessary, and ensure proper functioning of the metering system.
Quality Control and Assurance: Conduct quality checks on metering equipment, ensuring compliance with industry standards and specifications. Perform accuracy tests and inspections to validate meter readings and identify any discrepancies.
Data Analysis and Reporting: Analyze metering data to identify consumption patterns, anomalies, and potential issues. Generate reports on energy consumption, billing information, and metering system performance. Present findings and recommendations to management or relevant stakeholders.
Compliance and Regulatory Requirements: Stay updated with metering regulations, standards, and best practices. Ensure compliance with local regulations, industry guidelines, and legal metrology requirements.
Customer Support: Address customer inquiries and complaints related to metering issues, billing discrepancies, or energy consumption. Provide assistance and guidance to customers regarding energy conservation and metering processes.
Health and Safety: Adhere to health and safety guidelines and protocols when working with electrical systems and equipment. Ensure proper use of personal protective equipment and safe work practices.
Collaboration and Teamwork: Coordinate with cross-functional teams, such as meter data management, billing, and customer service, to ensure smooth metering operations and customer satisfaction. Desired Candidate Profile
Job Requirement: Requirements: Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Electrical or Electronics Engineering, or a related field. Previous experience in metering operations, installation, or maintenance is preferred. Familiarity with different types of energy meters, metering protocols, and communication systems. Knowledge of metering principles, accuracy standards, and metrology practices. Proficiency in metering software, data management systems, and related tools. Understanding of electrical systems, wiring, and safety precautions. Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. Attention to detail and accuracy in data recording and analysis. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Adaptability to changing job requirements and work schedules. Physical fitness and ability to work in outdoor environments. Knowledge of health, safety, and environmental regulations. Fluency in English (written and spoken). Knowledge of Arabic (beneficial but not mandatory).

• Manage Budgets & Costs: Sets, negotiates, agrees and manages all financial

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description: The IT Consultant job in Abu Dhabi, UAE, within the Transport & Logistic industry, involves providing expert advice and solutions to optimize IT systems and operations. Here is a summary of the job description:
IT Strategy Development: IT Consultants develop strategic IT plans aligned with the goals of transport and logistics companies. They assess current IT infrastructure, identify areas for improvement, and recommend solutions to enhance efficiency and digital transformation.
System Integration and Implementation: IT Consultants oversee the integration and implementation of IT systems and software. They collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements, select appropriate technologies, and manage the implementation process. They ensure smooth integration and provide training and support to end-users.
Infrastructure Management: IT Consultants design and manage IT infrastructure, including networks, servers, and storage systems. They ensure scalability, security, and reliability to support the growing demands of transport and logistics operations.
Data Management and Analytics: IT Consultants develop data management strategies and implement analytics solutions. They analyze data trends, extract insights, and provide recommendations to improve decision-making, optimize routes, enhance supply chain efficiency, and enhance customer experience.
Cybersecurity: IT Consultants establish cybersecurity measures to protect sensitive data, systems, and networks. They assess risks, define security protocols, and monitor potential threats. They ensure compliance with data protection regulations and industry best practices.
IT Project Management: IT Consultants lead IT projects, overseeing planning, resource allocation, and budget management. They work with cross-functional teams to achieve project milestones within defined timelines and deliver high-quality results.
Technology Trends and Innovation: IT Consultants stay updated on emerging technologies and industry trends relevant to transport and logistics. They identify opportunities for innovation and digital transformation, utilizing technologies like IoT and AI to streamline operations and improve efficiency.
Stakeholder Collaboration: IT Consultants collaborate with internal stakeholders, including management, operations teams, and IT departments, to understand business needs and align IT initiatives accordingly. They also engage with external vendors and service providers to ensure effective delivery of IT solutions and services. Desired Candidate Profile
Job Requirement: Qualifications: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field. Experience in IT consulting, preferably in the transport and logistics industry. Strong knowledge of IT infrastructure, systems integration, cybersecurity, and data analytics. Proficiency in project management methodologies and tools. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Statement Of Functions
To execute all activities related to the Software SCADA integration of new Substations to the Data Management System (DMS). To ensure the maintenance and optimum performance of the company, SCADA and Oracle Operating System and all interdepartmental Key Performance Indicators are achieved.
RESPONSIBILITIES

To ensure the operational performance of the encompassing DMS system inclusive of the SUN Solaris V5.8 and UNIX Operating System. To also consistently monitor and supervise SCADA functionality and applications.

To create a backup strategy and consistently update the contingency plans.

To generate various reports on a daily, weekly and monthly basis pertaining to the performance of the system, server and any inconsistencies in the Geographic Information System (GIS) database. To also generate the DMS Data Analyzer report and ensure all various DMS databases are backed-up systematically.

To assist the senior devising the necessary details required for the Factory Acceptance Test (FAT) and Site Acceptance Test (SAT) ensuring the correct specification for the departmental needs.

To problem shoot and resolve any faults or inconsistencies with the system or server, replacing, reconfiguring or maintaining relevant defective hardware.

To generate documentation for all new equipment of different specifications, due to procedures and rules, review and update, test and re-test.

To ensure the consistency and reliability of the Source Database (Oracle RDBMS) and the Operational Database (SINAUT Spectrum).

To provide technical support as and when required to maintain the optimal performance of the DMS Systems.

To carry out the importing and exporting of data between the GIS and DMS database, GIS editing, and fix resolve and provide temporary solutions to maintain core programs that may have been affected by software bugs.

To generate the generation of the SQL statements, scripts and reports. To also design, implement and troubleshoot DMS data modeling, and a template for DMS data pertaining to transformers and cables.

To administrate the TIBCO system (OMS) to ensure the synchronization of NOP s from DMS to GIS.

To perform data input via the SDM, data import/export and error message tracing.

To assist the software team members effectively.

To manage the Local Area Network (LAN) fast Ethernet switches and routers. To troubleshoot any connection issues and resolve problems ensuring the network is consistently running.

To manage the consistent operation of the of the DMS systems 24 hours 7 days a week, ensuring that it is fully operational and supported.

To ensure the administration of the Oracle Server RDMS System.

To ensure all systems are supported and the regular backup of all databases and archives. To ensure the restoration of data by alternating between Hard Drives.

To check the Inter-nation Control Center Protocol (ICCP) and Tele-Control Interface (TCI) on a daily basis to ensure optimal working performance.

To backup the External Data Exchange (EDE) and troubleshoot the EDE reports ensuring accuracy and optimal working performance.

To troubleshoot the DMS software, system or server as and when needed.

To maintain all databases and alter parameters of both the DMS and Oracle, system and database to ensure functionality.

To check the system servers daily and revise all technical contracts and specifications as and when needed. To also generate and develop various SQL statements, scripts and reports.

To provide 27/7 technical support for all problem, faults and inconsistencies of the SCADA System. To also provide technical support to all control engineers and cooperate with team members.

To provide a technical opinion of the necessary parts needed for the section and review the performance and approve the specifications.

Ensure that all work procedures are carried out in accordance with the System Safety Rules and HSE Roles and Responsibilities Procedure, in addition to the general safety rules and regulations enforced by local authorities.


Minimum Job Requirements
B.Sc. in Computer Science.
6 years direct experience in a SCADA environment.
Good technical expertise in SCADA, TCI, ICCP with the ability to read SQL and understand Linux. Knowledge of UNIX is preferable.
A thorough knowledge of the HSE regulations, procedures, standards.
The ability to read schematic displays.
Good knowledge of electrical power utility systems and substations.
Good knowledge interpersonal, communication, coordination, and problem solve abilities.
PC literate especially MS Access, with knowledge of GIS & DMS is an added advantage.
Excellent Arabic and English both written and spoken. Desired Candidate Profile

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

A Business Analyst is a professional who works closely with stakeholders to identify goals, develop best practices for data collection, and analyze current processes to determine what can be improved to achieve their desired outcome.
As a Business Analyst, you'll collect and analyze data and information to look for ways the customer business can run more efficiently. You may be tasked with projects designed to improve quality, reduce errors, or design new business processes. In this role, you'll research and collect data from reports and through talking with teams and managers. You'll analyze the data and information and come up with possible solutions. Business Analysts document findings and communicate recommendations. It's important to have strong data analysis and communication skills. You'll also want to be comfortable working with analytics software (Microsoft Excel is a must) as you'll be producing documents and reports.
Duties & Responsibilities
• Understand and articulate business stakeholders requirements in terms of the scope of work.
• Understanding the as-is process, analyzing users' requirements, and documenting requirements.
• Document client requirements in terms of functional specification documents or product/feature backlogs, that cover features, functionalities, use cases, user stories, etc.
• Visualize and document customer journeys for the client with an emphasis on the To Be state.
• Define detailed functional requirements, process flow diagrams, and business cases; including gap and impact analysis.
• Manage business and IT stakeholder communications, functional and technical requirements.
• Assist technical teams in translating functional requirements into technical requirements.
• Perform/coordinate user acceptance testing to ensure functionality meets business needs before each product release.
• Provide functional training to business users prior to testing by business stakeholders.
• Identify potential change (s) to the scope of work.
• Analyze and document the potential impact of change and communicate with stakeholders. Desired Candidate Profile

Job Requirements
• 2 to 5 years of experience as a business analyst in consultancy firms or IT firms.
• At least 1 year experience in the banking industry.
• Proven ability to understand business ideas/problems and develop technology solutions to enable/solve business ideas/problems.
• Ability to understand customer needs and perform sound business analysis work.
• Ability to comprehend and translate business requirements into technical specifications.
• Professional technical writing skills.
• Understanding of Databases and Data Management Lifecycle.
• Data collection and analysis.
• Interpersonal and communication skills.
• Analytical skills.
• Requirements Engineering
• Process Modeling

Education
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, Management Information Systems, Information Technology, or a related field.

Aramco energizes the world economy.
Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer.
With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco's value to society.
Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations' spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom's vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.
We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.
Overview
We are seeking a Financial Analyst to work with Finance & Performance Management (F&PM) in Petroleum Engineering & Development (PE&D).
This financial analyst is a chief position holder of the newly established Compliance unit with three direct reports within F&PM, Responsible to build and maintain the compliance unit, with the aim to ensure that PE&D meets company and industry standards.
We are seeking a Financial Analyst to work with Finance & Performance Management (F&PM) in Petroleum Engineering & Development (PE&D).
This financial analyst is a chief position holder of the newly established Compliance unit with three direct reports within F&PM, Responsible to build and maintain the compliance unit, with the aim to ensure that PE&D meets company and industry standards.
Key Responsibilities
As a business matter expert (BME), demonstrate a thorough understanding of IFRS applicable to oil & gas business and relate this to Saudi Aramco (SA). D eliver insightful data and analysis in an Accurate, Complete and Timely manner to support PE&D Senior Management's business decisions. Identify areas for continuous improvement, discuss and communicate recommendations with key stakeholders. Point of contact in PE&D for finance and reporting compliance related requests and tasks. Have a solid understanding of the link between the business and the accounting rules to assess the impacts on Income Statement, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow. Network with key stakeholders, especially within PE&D, other Upstream Admin Areas, Upstream and Finance Business Line. Lead, mentor and develop a group of 2-3 junior and senior professionals.
You will be required to perform the following:
• Conduct and supervise day to day operations within Compliance Unit, including follow-up and reporting on delegated areas and tasks
• Identify areas of importance from a compliance perspective, and inform stakeholders
• Develop sustainable follow-up and reporting procedures and systems
• Responsible to follow-up and report on areas such as, but not limited to: periodic impairment assessments, ARO, enterprise risk management, IKTVA and contact for external and internal audit related queries.
• As a BME, involve in discussions and tasks as agreed with Finance Lead
• Independently prepare information memorandums and proposals
Minimum Requirements
As a successful candidate, you will:
• Have a BS Degree in business, finance or a related discipline
• Have a Minimum of 10 years relevant experience is required
• Strong IFRS knowledge
• Have Good knowledge with MS Office products such as excel, ppt and word as a minimum, and familiar with ERP systems such as SAP.
• Have Further knowledge within areas of database applications, data management applications and data communication and presentation tools is a benefit.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description: A Geoscientist in the Energy & Utilities industry is responsible for studying the Earth's structure, composition, and processes to support energy exploration and production activities. They combine knowledge from various scientific disciplines, such as geology, geophysics, and geochemistry, to analyze data and provide insights into the location, quality, and sustainability of energy resources. Geoscientists work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams to assess the geological and environmental factors influencing energy projects.
Key Responsibilities:
Geological Analysis: Conduct detailed geological studies and investigations, including field mapping, stratigraphic analysis, and structural interpretation, to understand the subsurface geology and identify potential energy reservoirs.
Geophysical Data Integration: Integrate and interpret geophysical data, such as seismic, gravity, and magnetic data, to delineate subsurface structures, faults, and potential hydrocarbon reservoirs.
Petrophysical Analysis: Evaluate the physical and chemical properties of rocks and minerals to assess reservoir characteristics, including porosity, permeability, and fluid saturation.
Reservoir Modeling: Build geological and reservoir models using software tools to simulate and visualize subsurface structures, aiding in the identification of drilling targets and reservoir management.
Geochemical Analysis: Analyze rock and fluid samples to understand the composition, quality, and potential of energy resources. Assess geochemical data to determine reservoir quality and the presence of hydrocarbons.
Risk Assessment: Evaluate geological and environmental risks associated with energy projects, including geological hazards, reservoir integrity, and potential environmental impacts.
Data Management: Collect, organize, and manage geological and geophysical data sets. Ensure the accuracy, reliability, and integrity of data for analysis and reporting purposes.
Collaborative Work: Work closely with multidisciplinary teams, including geophysicists, engineers, and environmental specialists, to integrate geological and geophysical data into project planning and decision-making processes.
Technical Reporting: Prepare technical reports, presentations, and documentation to communicate findings, recommendations, and uncertainties to stakeholders, project teams, and regulatory bodies.
Research and Development: Stay updated with the latest advancements in geoscience technologies, methodologies, and software tools. Contribute to research projects aimed at improving exploration and production techniques. Desired Candidate Profile
Job Requirement: Requirements: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Geology, Geophysics, Geochemistry, or a related field. Strong knowledge of geological and geophysical principles, methods, and data interpretation. Proficiency in geoscience software tools and modeling techniques. Familiarity with energy exploration and production processes. Experience in geological mapping, structural interpretation, and reservoir characterization. Understanding of petrophysical analysis techniques and reservoir modeling. Knowledge of geochemical analysis methods for assessing reservoir quality. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and presentation abilities. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment. Fieldwork experience and proficiency in using geological and geophysical instruments. Familiarity with industry-standard software for geoscience analysis. Knowledge of health, safety, and environmental regulations in the energy sector. Adaptability to changing project requirements and deadlines. Attention to detail and accuracy in data interpretation. Strong computer skills for data manipulation and modeling.

Job Description
NEW UAE NATIONAL JOB - REGIONAL JUNIOR ANALYST (UAE NATIONAL ROLE) , Dubai:- Our client, who is an international player in sea, land, air and logistics solutions, serving more than 420 ports around the world across 5 continents, with a fleet of around 600 vessels are looking to hire a conscientious Emirati Junior Analyst.
REPORTING TO: Business Development Manager
MISSION AND RESPONSABILITIES
The Regional Analyst will act as analytical backbone of the department, who will have to optimise the performance of Intermodal and Business Development, through the collection of vital business intelligence data (analytical studies, reports, building KPIs, dashboards, graphs, Market studies & etc.).
The Main objective of the mission will be to leverage the available data to:
1. Inform the Intermodal and Business Development department about the current state of the business
via crips reports and follow ups
2. Provide quick, easy-to-digest access to insights about the regional Intermodal & Business Development
performances and generate valuable recommendations and corrective measures

strategic business decisions
4. Closely collaborate with Cost Control, Commercial, Procurement, Logistics and Operations teams to
develop effective initiatives and strategies that will optimise costs and commercial development
5. Building holistic Market study reports based on independent research on regional markets
6. Capturing Market intelligence & Competition info to assist the management on Investment decisions for
crucial business development projects
7. Construct and deliver, detailed studies via reports on specific business cases with regards to
Management s situational requirements
Main Functions
1. Intermodal Performance follow-ups
2. Prime task to build and monitor important KPIs of Intermodal Weekly / Monthly basis
3. Monthly Intermodal KPIs follow ups such as Negative Margin, Transport Order creation delays & etc.
4. Periodic update of Block Train Performance, Agent haulage & Inland Market share info to the Regional
and Head office management teams
5. Monitoring Carrier Haulage ratio & Carrier Haulage conversions
6. In coordination with DRO Procurement & Regional Intermodal Officer, attribute allocation percentage
to vendors within the several corridors and boosting CEVA integration on TBL movements
Intermodal Benchmarking
1. Build a benchmarking system aiming at tracking competition rates collected by the network
2. Segregate buying and selling rates
3. Further analysis to be done on transit clearance fees
Regional Intermodal Data management
1. Regional in-charge of Intermodal systems- making sure all Local teams have access to precise Intermodal
statistics (to act as a bridge between Local teams and HO teams)
2. Verifying the accuracy of the corporate data, via systematic investigation with Local teams
Intermodal Financial KPIs & Agility Monitoring
1. Be in close contact with DRO Cost Control team
2. Monitoring of Intermodal Revenue, Margins and Costs
Proposition and Monitoring of Agility initiatives (Cost Savings and/or Cost Optimization)
1. Research & Studies on Business development topics
2. Prepare timely Market study on the DRO Scope countries and Intra Regional Markets with regards to
Market share, competition, commodities, and trading partners should be updated
3. Perform Research studies on specific Markets and projects, in accordance with the business
requirements and Management s interests
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
- Must have a Higher Education/Postgraduate degree
- Strong knowledge in data analytics, business intelligence, finance
- Strong analytical skills and must be numeric
- Expert level of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
- Proven experience with data visualisation tools & other business intelligence software (Qliksense)

entire Microsoft Office suite
- Strong ability to distil complex data into easy-to-understand analysis with actionable recommendations
- Extremely detail oriented and organized, highly quantitative and creative, passionate about using data to
guide strategy
- Dedicated, self-starter, fast learner, ambitious and strong collaborator

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Excellent opportunity to work with a diversified investment company
Progress your career as a Hospitality Analyst
About Our Client
Our client is a dynamic and diversified investment company with a robust portfolio encompassing key growth sectors, including real estate, hospitality, education, and capital investments. Headquartered in Abu Dhabi, they maintain a diverse local and international investment portfolio.
Job Description

Control Procedures: Establish, maintain, and coordinate the implementation of departmental control procedures in alignment with corporate requirements.

Financial Data Management: Assume responsibility for all financial data within the division, ensuring timely receipt of data and reports from all stakeholders.

Financial Modeling: Develop and maintain reports, financial models, and forecasts for hotels.

Comprehensive Reporting: Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations, including analysis of operational performance for assigned entities.

Reconciliation: Perform various reconciliations to confirm the accuracy of financial reports, comparing data from the accounting system and other sources.

Accounts Receivables: Review and track hotels' accounts receivables, doubtful accounts, legal cases, and collections, providing monthly analysis and highlighting concerns.

Budget Support: Support the annual budgeting exercise and financial projections by providing data-driven insights and recommendations to the Senior Asset Manager - Hotels.

Financial Analysis: Analyze monthly financial reports, comparing them to the approved yearly budget and previous years, and highlighting concerns for further investigation.

Performance Benchmarking: Conduct performance benchmarking analysis using industry tools such as Hotstat and others to assess hotels' performance against industry standards and competitors.

KPI Analysis: Collect, compile, and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) related to occupancy rates, average daily rates (ADRs), revenue per available room (RevPAR), and market share.

Financial Records: Maintain financial records and support document management, including reconciling pre-opening, operating, and FF&E budgets.

Capital Expenditures: Maintain financial records and reconciliation for Capital Expenditures and special projects directly paid by the Owning Company.

Best Practices: Explore the latest benchmarks and best practice initiatives in the industry.

Internal Audit Support: Support the annual internal audit process, liaise with auditors as required, meet deadlines, and follow up on outstanding issues.

Financial Tracking: Report FF&E spending versus budgets and prepare summaries of quotations for significant items.

Retail Leasing: Maintain retail leasing records and vacancies, benchmark financial performance, and report findings to the Senior Asset Manager - Hotels.

Standard Operating Procedures: Update and create Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and templates for functions under this role and ensure compliance.

Task Tracking: Create tracking sheets for pending matters, regularly follow up, and provide progress updates or highlight concerns.

Problem Solving: Demonstrate creative problem-solving skills and provide recommendations to address concerns.

Effective Communication: Keep the Senior Asset Manager - Hotels promptly informed of any issues directly affecting operations and other relevant topics.

Ad Hoc Duties: Perform related duties and special projects assigned by the Senior Asset Manager - Hotels or COO when applicable.
The Successful Applicant
Experience:

A minimum of 5 years in Hospitality Management Finance or general accounting experience is essential.

Knowledge of the region's business environment is essential.

Familiarity with hotel operations is essential.
Qualifications:

Education: Graduation/Diploma in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, Finance, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.

Experience: Proven experience in hotel performance analysis, benchmarking, or related roles.

Industry Tools: Proficiency in performance benchmarking tools and platforms such as Hotstats, STR Global, or similar industry tools.

Software Skills: Strong PC skills in MS Word are essential. Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to create insightful reports and presentations.

Accounting Knowledge: Good knowledge of accounting principles and procedures sufficient to compile financial reports.

Hospitality Management: Good knowledge of hospitality management, including a comprehensive understanding of hotels, operations, revenue management principles, industry trends, and systems. Financial and commercial understanding and reporting.

USALI Knowledge: Understanding of financial practices as per USALI is an advantage.

Analytical Skills: Ability to select information from various sources, interpret statistical tables and formulas, and perform mathematical calculations.

Feasibility Studies: Experience in creating feasibility studies and calculating ROI & IRR is an advantage.
