Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Role Purpose:
A software tester, also known as a quality assurance (QA) tester or software QA analyst, plays a crucial role in the software development process. They are responsible for ensuring that software applications meet the required standards of quality, functionality, and performance.
Role Details:
• Test Planning: Collaborate with project managers, developers, and business analysts to understand project requirements and define test objectives and strategies.create test plans and test cases based on functional and technical specifications.
• Test Execution: Execute test cases to validate software applications and identify defects or bugs. Conduct various types of testing, including functional testing, regression testing, integration testing, performance testing, and usability testing.
• Defect Management: Report and track software defects using bug tracking tools. Clearly document steps to reproduce the defects and provide additional information to assist developers in resolving them. Verify and validate bug fixes.
• Test Automation: Develop and maintain automated test scripts using testing frameworks and tools. Identify repetitive test cases that can be automated to increase efficiency and coverage. Execute automated tests and analyze test results.
• Test Environment Setup: Set up and configure test environments, including hardware, software, and network configurations, to simulate real-world usage scenarios. Ensure that the test environment is stable and closely resembles the production environment.
• Test Data Management: Create and manage test data required for testing activities. Generate and maintain realistic and representative test data sets to ensure comprehensive test coverage.
• Test Documentation: Create and maintain test documentation, including test plans, test cases, test scripts, and test reports. Provide clear and concise test summaries and reports to stakeholders, highlighting the status of testing activities and any identified issues.
• Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, business analysts, project managers, and stakeholders, to understand the software requirements and communicate test findings and recommendations effectively.
• Continuous Improvement: Continuously enhance testing processes and methodologies to improve efficiency and effectiveness. Stay updated with the latest industry trends, tools, and techniques related to software testing.
• Quality Assurance: Contribute to the overall quality assurance process by identifying areas for improvement in software development practices. Provide feedback and suggestions to enhance the software development life cycle.
• Adherence to Standards: Follow established testing standards, methodologies, and best practices. Ensure compliance with quality assurance processes and guidelines. Desired Candidate Profile

• Bachelor s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
3+ years of proven experience in software testing, with a focus on mobile applications and web services.
• Solid understanding of software testing methodologies, including manual and automated testing processes.
• Proficiency in testing tools and frameworks for both React Native and NestJS applications.
• Experience with test automation tools such as Jest, Detox, Cypress, or similar.
• Strong ability to create detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and a keen eye for detail.
• Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.
• Strong communication skills to collaborate with development effectively, product, and QA teams.
• Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
• Knowledge of Agile/Scrum development methodologies is a plus.
• ISTQB or other relevant certifications are a bonus.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
The Company
Robert Half are working with a well-established and rapidly growing investment firm based in Downtown, Dubai. They are seeking a dedicated and analytical FP&A Manager to join their finance team. The successful candidate will play a key role in supporting our financial planning and analysis efforts, ensuring the firm's financial health and optimizing decision-making processes.
The Role
• Financial Modelling: Create and maintain complex financial models to analyse historical data, forecast future financial performance, and identify key financial trends.
• Budgeting and Forecasting: Collaborate with various departments to develop annual budgets and quarterly forecasts, ensuring alignment with the firm's strategic goals.
• Performance Analysis: Monitor and assess investment performance, providing insights into portfolio performance drivers and recommending adjustments when necessary.
• Variance Analysis: Conduct in-depth variance analysis to track and explain differences between actual financial results and budgeted/forecasted figures.
• Reporting: Prepare and distribute regular financial reports to senior management, highlighting key performance indicators and trends.
• Scenario Analysis: Assist in scenario planning and stress testing to evaluate the impact of various economic and market conditions on the firm's financial position.
• Strategic Support: Provide financial insights and data-driven recommendations to support strategic decision-making processes.
• Ad-Hoc Analysis: Undertake ad-hoc financial analysis projects as needed, providing timely and accurate information to aid in decision-making.
• Data Management: Ensure data integrity and accuracy within the financial systems, making necessary adjustments and improvements as required.
The Candidate
Charted Accountant Qualification is a must
• 4+ years of experience in financial planning and analysis, preferably within the investment management industry.
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Advanced knowledge of Excel and financial software tools.
• Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
• Health and wellness programs.
Salary and Benefits
37,000 - 42,000 AED a month, plus company benefits
Robert Half is committed to equal opportunity and diversity. Suitable candidates with equivalent qualifications and more or less experience can apply. Pay and salary ranges are dependent upon experience, qualifications and training. If you wish to apply, please read our Privacy Notice describing how we may process, disclose and store your personal data.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
The job incumbent will assume full responsibility for overseeing all financial transactions, including both manual entries in the books and data management in software systems. They will also be responsible for managing tax-related transactions, conducting in-depth analyses, and preparing detailed reports when needed. Their main objective will be to ensure strict adherence to accounting standards and company policies during all stages of these processes.

What will you be doing?
• Managing all accounting transactions: Overseeing and managing all financial transactions within the organization, ensuring accuracy and adherence to accounting principles.
• Assisting in preparing budget forecasts: Contributing to the process of creating budget forecasts by providing financial insights and data to support informed decision-making.
• Reporting accounting statements on time: Preparing and presenting timely and accurate accounting statements, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.
• Handling monthly, quarterly, and annual closings: Overseeing the closing procedures for each accounting period, ensuring proper reconciliation and timely reporting of financial records.
• Reconciling accounts payable and receivable: Verifying that accounts payable and accounts receivable are accurately recorded and reconciled, ensuring proper management of payments and collections.
• Ensuring timely bank payments: Managing and processing bank payments to vendors, suppliers, and stakeholders, ensuring they are made on time and in accordance with financial obligations.
• Computing taxes and preparing tax returns: Calculating taxes owed and preparing accurate tax returns, ensuring compliance with tax regulations and meeting filing deadlines.
• Auditing financial transactions and documents: Conducting regular audits of financial transactions and documents to ensure accuracy, identify discrepancies, and mitigate financial risks.
• Reinforcing financial data confidentiality and conducting database backups: Prioritizing the confidentiality and security of financial data by implementing measures to protect sensitive information and conducting regular backups of financial databases.
• Complying with financial policies and regulations: Ensuring strict adherence to financial policies, accounting standards, and regulatory requirements, maintaining compliance throughout all financial processes and procedures. Desired Candidate Profile
• 1 to 3 years of Work experience as an Accountant
• Excellent knowledge of accounting regulations and procedures, including the Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).
• Hands-on experience with accounting software.
• High proficiency using MS Excel skills including VLOOKUPs and pivot tables.
• Experience with general ledger functions
• Strong attention to detail and good analytical skills
• BSc in Accounting, Finance or relevant degree
• Additional certification (CPA or IFRS) is a plus.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Description
Job Purpose
• Provide broad technical expertise in subsea Pipelines Integrity Management engineering, to timely and quality develop, implement, improve, and enhance Pipelines Integrity Management (PIMS) processes and procedures specifically aimed at ensuring that the company operated subsea pipelines are efficiently monitored and controlled to meet the Company s production objectives in a cost-effective manner while maintaining the highest level of integrity, environmental and personnel and process safety compliance.
Job Context & Major Challenges
• Work within established Safety umbrella, structures, procedures, engineering standards and methodologies in place by the company
• Provide direct and indirect advice in the field of pipelines integrity engineering
• Some degree of freedom in the execution of function, with events and activities driving performance. Works independently within agreed work practices and contributes to improvement and streamline business processes.
• Work requires analytical, interpretative, and constructive thinking, with a significant degree of evaluative judgement to address complex discipline and multi-discipline related problems and issues particularly in relation to subsea pipelines.
• Development of work methods from several alternative options in accordance with established pipelines integrity management programs, procedures and professional standards including planning, execution and results assessment concluding pipelines risk assessment and recommendations to extend the remaining life of pipelines.
• Work is subject to review and direction by direct supervisor, Head of Subsea Pipelines Integrity, and SPI Division Manager.
• Interface with or act as a technical representative for the company Opco with and outside organizations (i.e., shareholders, vendors, consultants), and supervisor contractors as needed.
Key Job Accountabilities - I
• Support in assessing PIMS programs, to ensure companywide compliance and consistency with policies, practices, and procedures. Support in implementing and stewarding PIMS Programs and ensure that company utilizes cost effective PIMS tools and equipment.
• Develop and maintain the PIMS documentation, including procedures, equipment strategies, SOW for annual and long-term inspection and integrity management plans, anomaly database, PIMS status reports, KPI reports, and annual integrity reports etc.
• Ensure all stakeholders are kept informed and all requirements have been captured and obtain necessary approvals for implementation. Participate in cross assets reviews to ensure consistency of PIMS document for the entire the company facility.
• Conduct subsea Pipelines Integrity Management (PIMS) monitoring, investigations, and prevention activities, including monitoring Integrity Operating Windows affecting subsea pipelines conditions and life. Extend the necessary support to offshore operation in executing planned PIMS inspection campaigns (UWI & ILI) and maintain inspection data updated.
• Review and analyse pipelines inspections and integrity reports and the outcomes of planned and unplanned Under water Inspection, Topside Inspections, Onshore Inspections and Smart Pigging inspection findings, and failure investigations etc., to evaluate and provide recommendations to restore pipelines functionality, improve performance, and extend its operating life. Prioritize response to findings and communicate findings and recommendation to relevant stakeholders. Obtain necessary approvals for implementation of recommendations and follow-up to ensure recommendations are implemented.
Key Job Accountabilities - II
• Develop asset related PIMS risk assessment results and prepares data for management review. Perform the Risk analysis for pipelines related assessments. Initiate and lead changes to the PIMS risk assessment process and participate in cross assets reviews for common alignment and lessons learned sharing.
• Ensure that all PIMS Engineering contracts are up to date and necessary administrative activates are timely managed per company governors and procedures.
• Ensure compliance with Company approved policy and procedures and support all activities related to audit of the pipeline system.
• Develop and timely review the asset related annual budgets and keep track of budgets to ensure any potential deviations are highlighted as early as possible during the year. Participate in SPI Overall Budget reviews for common alignment.
• Identify, evaluate, and implement appropriate new technologies. Support driving strategic technical innovation and provide expertise in area of subsea pipelines PIMS. Review design requirements of new projects and modifications and submits recommendations.
Qualifications
• Bachelor s degree in Engineering, or Engineering Science in Mechanical, Chemical, or Material.
Knowledge and/or Experience
• 6 years experience in subsea gas pipelines integrity activities.
• Experience in subsea pipelines integrity management activities including underwater inspections and smart pigging.
• Competent level in PIMS, risk-based inspection, corrosion management and control, damage mechanisms, NDT techniques, and RCFA for upstream pipelines in sour service.
• Experience in using the international standards (ASME, API, NACE and DNV) in pipeline integrity management tasks.
• Knowledge in use of subsea pipelines integrity management tools, and inspection data management software (e.g., GIS, Pvi).

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

SUMMARY
OBJECTIVE
- Responsible for provision of overall cost & planning services for the Contracts, ensuring overall planning integration and quality project control.
- Responsible and accountable for managing the project control & planning processes, ensuring consistency, quality across engineering, procurement, construction and commissioning, considering HSE requirements.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
- Responsible for the provision of overall Planning, Scheduling, Monitoring and reporting of the Project progress, Managing the planning process,
- Accountable for managing the development and delivery of integrated plans in accordance with the project activities and mile stones, setting out planning standards and guidelines, ensuring that site planners are meeting schedule and compiling the Monthly Progress Reports.
- Shall work closely with Contract Manager and Project Engineer on the overall project plan build and execute progress reporting on costs and schedule.
- Responsible for the preparation and maintenance of the overall project schedule to ensure optimization of resources and control of all associated project work.
- Ensure effective co-ordination within the planning team and to its external interfaces.
- Monitors engineering schedules to ensure that the engineering deliverables are scheduled to meet construction requirements.
- Provides weekly reports of engineering and procurement progress, and informs to management on areas of concern and advice remedial actions and alternatives to maintain the schedule.
- Monitors contractor, vendors' and sub-contractors schedules to ensure that the project has a realistic and achievable construction schedule.
- Leads and directs other Planning / Schedule Engineer.
- Provide expert support ensuring consistency with standard durations.
- Prepare planning network for the project including scheduling and cost control.
- Operate planning tools such as SAP PS and primavera. First line System Administration of Primavera
- Analyse the project schedule in relation with other projects and highlight his comments to the project engineers.
- Ensure links between different projects are in place and understood.
- Carry out integrated project portfolio analysis.
- Responsible for overall central administration of the Primavera System comprising the following:
i. User access management including security profiles and privileges.
ii. Maintenance of standard Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), Resource Breakdown Structure (RBS), for project and activity codes.
iii. Maintenance of overall integrity of the portfolio of projects in Primavera.
iv. Carry out regular analysis of project portfolio in Primavera.
v. Share best practices and lesson learned to the engineering community.
vi. Disseminate standard methodologies or practices using the Primavera Methodology management module.
vii. Provide support on all planning and scheduling issues.
viii. Generate corporate Key Performance Indicators and reports from the Primavera database.
- To develop cost and schedule control estimates and project key control documentation.
- To ensure that HSE matters are given due consideration in execution.
- To execute project planning as per contract.
- To plan to have a control over manpower and material resources in order to execute the project within budget, schedule, quality and HSE requirements.
- Shall actively participate in encouraging developing younger Omani personnel to take up Planning Engineer roles.
QUALIFICATION & EXPERIENCE
- Degree in discipline specific engineering (B.Sc./B.Eng/ M.Sc) and membership of internationally accepted applicable professional Institute (preferred not mandatory).
- 10 years of experience in the design, specification, construction, commissioning and general project engineering faculties within oil & gas facilities development projects with experience project cost and planning systems.
- Minimum 5 year experience in Primavera p3e and SAP.
COMPETENCIES/SKILLS
- Sound commercial appreciation and judgement.
- Knowledge of project control tools.
- Analytical, interpersonal, negotiation & communication skills
- Ability to cope with stress, independent thinking, decisiveness and a strong focus on results.
- Documentation Skills.
- High level proficiency in the use of data management and Primavera planning software programmes.
- Able to design and test logic precedence networks and systems for the project activities planning, monitoring and coordination.
- Able to develop expertise in the Clients SAP, Primavera P6 planning software.
JOB CONTEXT & CHALLENGE
- Project outcome completely depends on the efficient & effective planning & control methods.
- Process owner for the Project Controls & Planning Management System.
- Exposed to working under pressure to meet the targets & deadlines, with coordination among multi-discipline teams.
KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS
- Completing the Project within the agreed cost/ schedule.
- Setting realistic, profitable and achievable target plans, phase by phase.
- Ensuring planning for uninterrupted operations.
- Effective Interdisciplinary Coordination.
- Ensuring the availability of resources (men & material) throughout the project, with proper planning.
- Establishing cordial and healthy business relationship with all the inter-discipline members of the project.
- Training & mentoring young professionals.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Position Overview:
The Retail Coordinator will be responsible for implementing the clienteling strategies and the CRM programs within Tiffany & Co. KSA.
The Retail Coordinator will be based in Riyadh and will collaborate with the market s Country Manager and Store Managers, to create a high-performance clienteling culture and capabilities. The Retail Coordinator is responsible for building programs to inspire our retail teams to proactively build strong relationships with their customers, aimed at increasing customer loyalty and lifetime value.
As the custodian of the local customer data base, the individual will partner with retail teams on data capture and subsequent data management.
They will also support the Country Manager and the Store Managers by providing weekly & monthly retail-oriented dashboards to help them monitor their teams and targets.
Key Accountabilities:
• Be the Salesforce key-user for the market and train the retail teams on a monthly basis on Salesforce new features and improvements, to make the most of the tool.
• Sales performance analysis on weekly and monthly basis.
• Partner with each store to increase business opportunities, drive customer loyalty and increase purchase frequency. Communicate KPIs and align market activities to meet and exceed established goals.
• Supply ordering and management: create suppliers, coordinate invoicing and place orders.
• Coordinate approval flow within retail department.
• Support the Retail Learning Manager to identify learning action plan to maximise clienteling skills, selling skills and elevate the Client Experience.
• Organize meetings preparation, presentations, booking and follow ups.
• Apply all international retail guidelines and actively ensure the implementations in the Stores.
• Leading retail weekly and monthly meetings.
• Collaborate with the Communications Teams on segmentation of customer data and deploy customer contact strategy aligned with cluster (emailing, ecards, postal mailings, catalogues, gifting)
• Provide weekly and monthly reporting to Country Manager, MD and Store Managers to monitor sales target, clienteling targets.
Required Qualifications:
• 3-5 years within a retail environment, hospitality or CRM.
• Previous experience with client data base.
• Comfortable with customer data analysis and interpretation, previous usage of Salesforce.
• Experience in sales and service delivery and building performance against targets.
• Good understanding of retail stores processes and procedures
• Proficiency with MS Office software including Word, Excel, Outlook.
• The ability to inspire trust, integrity, fairness, and professionalism both with sales professionals and clients.
• Strong verbal and written communication skills.
• Proven ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, changing environment.
• Strong networking skills with an ability to build rapport quickly.
• Flexibility to travel within KSA.
• Fluent in Arabic and English.
Preferred Qualifications:
• Luxury retail experience.
• Experience using Salesforce.
• Experience in the KSA market.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented HR Administrator to join our company. The HR Administrator will provide crucial support in various HR functions, including recruitment, onboarding, employee records management, benefits administration, and general HR administrative tasks. The ideal candidate should possess excellent communication skills, a strong attention to detail, and a solid understanding of HR processes and regulations.
Responsibilities:
Assist in job postings, candidate screening, and scheduling interviews.
Coordinate pre-employment background checks and reference checks.
Prepare offer letters, employment contracts, and new hire documentation.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records and HR databases.
Process employee status changes, such as transfers, promotions, and terminations.
Ensure compliance with data protection and confidentiality regulations.
Support employees with benefits inquiries and issue resolution.
Assist in developing and updating HR policies and procedures.
Ensure compliance with labor laws and regulations.
Maintain HR files, including personnel documents, contracts, and policies.
Manage employee leave requests and timekeeping records.
Assist in organizing employee events, training sessions, and HR meetings.
Handle general HR inquiries and provide timely responses.
Excellent organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data management.
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.
Qualifications and Skills:
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Solid understanding of HR principles, practices, and employment laws.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Strong problem-solving and conflict resolution abilities.
High level of discretion and ability to handle sensitive information.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills.
Proficient in HRIS software, MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), and familiarity with HR-related tools and systems.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose:

To ensure a world class level of marketing that adopts a mix of traditional and innovative tactics and strategies that reflects the position of the events. This role will be expected to engage with key stakeholders across the events within the portfolio.

Key Accountabilities:

Create, develop, and implement the overarching marketing strategy for the event deliverables across exhibitor, visitor, delegate and speaker acquisition process.
Work closely with the ED on stakeholder management across the event, including the preparation and sharing of campaign verticals in monthly meetings with key government entities.
Create and manage the marketing P&L for the event campaign cycle with direct reporting to the ED.
Identify, cultivate, and manage 3rd party relationships across barters and industry associations.
Work closely with the conference production team on the creation of all conference related collateral, paying close attention the timeline management and deliverables plus website updating.
Work closely with the Commercial Directors & Event Director on strategy implementation, lead generation, agent management, sponsorship creation and delivery of all exhibition and sponsorship related collateral and ensuring regular updating of website content.
Create and implement robust visitor campaigns with a focus on unique attendance growth and retention strategies.
Identify the competitor landscape of events by industry and geo-spread and create/implement campaigns to counter and disrupt the identified events.
Devise and implement comprehensive social media campaigns including but not limited to programmatic, geo-fencing, retargeting, social amplification, influencer marketing, SEO, display ad campaigns and paid banner campaigns that are content rich spanning the entire cycle of the event.
Work with the head of digital for hybrid solutions to ensure seamless integration of pre-identified solutions across the conference and exhibition elements of the event.
Work with external PR agencies on domestic and global strategies to ensure MENA wide and international coverage of all related PR content from direct releases to op-ed driven content.
Develop relationships with trade associations, media, regulators, and industry organizations to foster support for events
Work closely with the in-house database team on data management including but not limited to data cleansing, data acquisition, data building, gap analysis and segmentation management.
Work and collaborate with overseas offices in the development, sharing and implementation of best practice ideas and concepts.
Lead, manage and motivate a team of marketing managers and executives, including the setting of annual KPI s and bonus structures.

Qualifications and Experience:

At least 5 years year's demonstrable experience at management level in events and / or B2B media
Degree educated.
Detailed knowledge of marketing best practice with strong knowledge and understanding of social media marketing.
Experience of dealing with and managing key stakeholder relations.
Knowledge of mid to large scale B2B exhibitions and conferences
Understanding of GDPR & data protection
Experience in Policing and or law enforcement
Experience of developing an online and digital strategy.
Experience of auditing existing procedures and introducing new procedures.
Appreciation of international cultures/foreign language
Ability to network and liaise with senior people/trade bodies and associations
Anticipation of market trends and proactive market involvement

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Department: Commercial Procurement
Job Status: Full Timer
Working Hours: Monday till Friday from 9:00 am till 6:00 pm
Location: Head Office Zalka
SCOPE OF THE JOB
The Junior Back Office Unit Agent is responsible for maintaining accurate database records and tracking of all products at Mike Sport.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
• Coordinate closely with buying team in order to set the Price Structure of all received collection.
• Ensure accurate update of Price Structure excel sheet, by adding full description about every single item (Barcode, Gender, Color, Size, Cost etc )
• Perform the item creation process on system (Navision) in order to be shared with concerned parties.
• Execute price changes & discounts of items on system, upon the request of the Manager.
• Liaise with logistics team in order to set the Purchase Order before receiving any shipment.
• Liaise with E-Commerce team and provide them administrative support to maintain an updated platform, by sharing the price structure of the selected items.
• Conduct Transfer Orders in coordination with buying team, so the warehouse department can proceed with the distribution process of goods to our branches.
• Prepare Sales Orders in coordination with buying team in case of international shipments.
• Receive defected items list from the warehouse department and report it to the buying team in order to take corrective actions.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
• Education: Bachelor Degree in Business Administration, or documentation.
• Experience: 0 to 1 year experience in data management.
• Linguistic Skills: Advanced in written & spoken English & Arabic, French is a plus.
• Computer Skills: Extensive knowledge in Ms. Office.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
The job incumbent will provide general administrative support to the HR department, including scheduling meetings, coordinating interviews, maintaining HR files, and assisting with other HR-related tasks as required.
What will you do?
• Recruitment and Selection: Collaborates with hiring managers to create job descriptions and advertisements, Screens resumes and applications, shortlisting candidates based on qualifications, Coordinates interviews and manages logistics for candidates and interviewers, assists in the interview process, takes notes, and provides feedback.
• Employee Onboarding: Assisting with the onboarding process for new hires, including conducting orientation sessions, collecting required documentation, and ensuring a smooth transition into the organization.
• HRIS Management: Managing the Human Resources Information System (HRIS), which includes updating employee records, generating reports, and maintaining data accuracy.
• Employee Data Management: Handling employee data, such as personal information, employment history, benefits enrollment, and other relevant records, while ensuring confidentiality and data security.
• Benefits Administration: Assisting with the administration of employee benefits programs, including enrollment, changes, and answering employee inquiries related to benefits.
• Payroll Support: Collaborating with the payroll department to ensure accurate and timely processing of employee payroll, including verifying timesheets, deductions, and assisting with payroll-related inquiries.
• Leave and Attendance Management: Managing employee leave requests, including tracking accrued leave, processing time-off requests, and maintaining accurate attendance records.
• HR Policies and Procedures: Assisting in the development, implementation, and communication of HR policies and procedures, ensuring compliance with labor laws and regulations.
• Employee Relations Support: Assisting with employee relations matters, such as addressing employee inquiries, resolving conflicts, and providing general support and guidance to employees.
• Compliance and Reporting: Assisting with HR compliance activities, such as preparing reports, supporting audits, and ensuring adherence to applicable laws, regulations, and company policies.
• HR Projects and Initiatives: Supporting HR projects and initiatives, such as performance management, employee engagement programs, training and development initiatives, and other HR-related projects as assigned. Desired Candidate Profile
• Proven experience with HR Operations ( Fresh grads are welcomed to apply)
• Excellent communication and listening skills.
• Excellent Emotional Intelligence (EQ) skills
• The individual should have a high attention to detail and the ability to prioritize tasks, especially when working under pressure. They should also demonstrate sensitivity to handling confidential information.
• Experience with recruitment procedures.
• Demonstrated expertise in using Microsoft and Google workplace tools is necessary.
• Relevant training and/or certifications in an HR is a plus .

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Description
As a Remote Operations Executive, you will play a crucial role in managing and optimising our operations to ensure efficiency, quality, and growth. You will be supporting our on-the-ground operations team with managing projects, software, and monitoring KPIs and progress reports and liaising with the appropriate key team members. You will act as an owner of specific projects where your role will involve monitoring progress, chasing for updates and pushing for results. You will also support and lead many ad-hoc projects.
• Operations Strategy: Develop and execute strategies to streamline and improve our operations, driving efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
• Teamwork: Remotley work with a team of professionals, ensuring their productivity and project execution
• Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for process optimisation, automation, and standardisation to enhance overall operational performance.
• Data Analysis: Analyse vital operational metrics and provide actionable insights to support data-driven decision-making.
• Project Management: Oversee various operations-related projects, from planning to execution, ensuring timely delivery and successful outcomes.
• Vendor and Partner Relationships: Manage relationships with external partners and vendors to ensure a seamless supply chain and operational support.
• Compliance: Ensure compliance with industry regulations, standards, and company policies.
• Remote Team Collaboration: Foster a collaborative and positive remote work environment, encouraging effective communication and teamwork among team members.
• Data Management: Ensure documents and reports are categorised and stored accurately for compliance and access. Desired Candidate Profile

Requirements
• Bachelor's degree, MBA or related advanced degree preferred. You must have achieved a very good or Excellent degree classification
• Experience in operations management with a proven track record of success
• Strong leadership and team management skills, even in a remote work setting
• Native-level written English skills
• Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities
• Proficiency in project management tools and data analysis software
• Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
• Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and meet deadlines in a remote work environment
• Proactivity in research and effective self-education
You must submit a cover letter for your application to be considered.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

JOB DESCRIPTION
DESIGNATION: Sustainability Manager / (ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance Manager)
REPORTING AUTHORITY: Deputy CEO
LOCATION: Dubai
DEPARTMENT: Management
Scope:
Reporting to the Deputy CEO, the Sustainability manager is responsible for developing and implementing sustainable practices within an organization. This includes analyzing the environmental impact of business operations and creating strategies to reduce the organization s carbon footprint, waste, and resource use. The sustainability manager also works to ensure compliance with environmental regulations and standards and engages with stakeholders to promote sustainable practices.
Dimensions of the job:
Duties are carried out for the organization and all its subsidiaries, associated and connected entities. Direct reports:
ESG Officer
Principle accountabilities, role, and responsibilities:
Develop and implementation of sustainability framework for the entire group.
Environmental Monitoring, Waste management, Environmental Impact Assessment, Environmental training and awareness, Environment risk assessment and mitigation, regulatory compliance.
Internal and External audits, review meetings and Training and Awareness Programs related to Total Quality Management (TQM).
Developing and implementing strategies and policies to reduce the organization s environmental impact.
Tracking and reporting on the organization s environmental performance
Collaborating with internal stakeholders, including executives, operations managers, and employees, to promote sustainable practices and encourage behavior change.
Engaging with external stakeholders, such as suppliers, customers, and community members, to promote sustainable practices and build partnerships.
Ensuring compliance with relevant environmental regulations and standards
Managing sustainability projects and initiatives, including setting goals, allocating resources, and monitoring progress
Communicating the organization s sustainability performance and goals to stakeholders, both internally and externally
Keeping up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in sustainability, and recommending new approaches and technologies to improve the organization s sustainability performance.
Engagement with regulatory bodies to expedite required legal permits and timely renewal of the legal documents.
GHG (Greenhouse gases) emissions accounting, Net Zero Strategy and road map, CDP reporting (Carbon Disclosure Project), Sustainability Linked Bond (SLB) and SPO (Sustainability Principles and Objectives) and GHG data management.
Establishing and implementing IMS (Integrated Management System) in accordance to ISO
9001-2015, ISO14001-2015 and OHSAS 18001-2018.
Management of environmental data, data verification & assurance, performance reporting to internal and external stakeholders e.g.CDP, OGP, annual reports and accounts.
ESG Development of ESG indicators, policies and reporting, Zero Waste to Landfill, Net Water Positive, Net Zero Emission, GRI (Global Reporting Initiative) reporting.
Documentation and implementation of requirement of various product conformity certificates.
Set environmental requirements in scope of work during tendering, evaluation of bids and managing contractors for implementation of environmental requirements.
Climate Change Report, Sustainability Report, HSE Reports, Environ-mental performance report and other reports related to HSE, ESG and Sustainability.
Developing corporate standards, guidelines, and tools to achieve organization vision and policy commitments.
Lead a diverse workforce.
Comply with the Health, Safety and Environmental Policies
All ad hoc tasks and projects designated by the Deputy CEO
Work under the direction of the Deputy CEO.
SKILLS
Strong leadership experience and skills with the ability to provide direction to others
Exceptional analytical skills for problem solving as well as excellent communication skills
Organizing and planning.
Attention to detail.
Results oriented with a can do attitude
Willingness and ability to work rotating shifts, weekends, and holidays.
Reliability.
Stress tolerance.
KNOWLEDGE & EXPERTISE
Knowledge of MS Office
07-10 years of work experience in Similar Profile with pleasant personality.
High Level of Integrity.
02-04 years of experience in Heavy Manufacturing Industry Experience
QUALIFICATION
Master/ Graduation Environmental Science and Sustainability or Environment and Sustainability Management

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Job Description
we are looking for a HSE Inspector who is responsible for conducting inspections, audits, and assessments to ensure that workplaces and project sites comply with health, safety, and environmental regulations and standards. This role involves identifying hazards, recommending corrective actions, and promoting a culture of safety to prevent accidents and injuries.
Responsibilities :
• Conduct regular inspections of workplaces, construction sites, facilities, and equipment to identify potential hazards and ensure compliance with safety standards.
• Perform thorough safety and environmental audits, assess risks, and recommend corrective actions.
• Stay updated on local, regional, and national health, safety, and environmental regulations.
• Ensure that the organization is in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
• Evaluate workplace processes, procedures, and equipment to identify potential risks and hazards.
• Develop risk assessment reports and recommend strategies to mitigate identified risks.
• Provide training sessions, workshops, and educational materials to employees and contractors to raise awareness about safety procedures and practices.
• Promote a culture of safety throughout the organization.
• Investigate accidents, incidents, and near misses to determine their causes and recommend preventive measures.
• Compile incident reports and maintain records of investigations.
• Develop and implement emergency response plans, evacuation procedures, and crisis management protocols.
• Conduct drills and simulations to ensure readiness in case of emergencies.
• Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of inspections, audits, incidents, and corrective actions taken.
• Generate detailed reports for management and regulatory authorities as required.
• Identify potential environmental hazards, such as pollution, waste management issues, and resource conservation.
• Recommend strategies for minimizing the organization's environmental footprint.
• Collaborate with management, supervisors, and employees to address safety concerns and implement best practices.
• Continuously monitor safety and environmental performance, and suggest improvements to existing processes and protocols.
Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in Occupational Health and Safety, Environmental Science, Engineering, or a related field.
• Relevant certifications such as NEBOSH (National Examination Board in Occupational Safety and Health) or UAE-specific HSE certifications.
• In-depth knowledge of UAE HSE regulations, standards, and best practices.
• Strong analytical skills to assess risks and develop effective mitigation strategies.

In our continuous efforts to maintain financial records and reports, perform account reconciliations, assist with budget and close processes, conduct internal audits, and maintain accounts payable documentation, we are on the lookout for a dynamic, experienced professional with proficiency in Microsoft Dynamics ERP, particularly Dynamics 365 for Finance. Prepare comprehensive monthly financial reports, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.

Substantiates financial transactions by auditing documents.

Keep abreast of new tax laws and regulations, advising the management team on any changes that could impact the organization s financial landscape.
Prepares special financial reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing account information and trends.
Maintains customer confidence and protects operations by keeping financial information confidential.
Improving the current process of the organization by providing suggestions to the management and implementation of improved processes.
Manage the payroll in the system and process salaries and leave salaries on time.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
As a Microbiologist you will play a crucial role in diagnosing and monitoring infectious diseases and conditions by studying microorganisms. Your expertise in microbiological techniques, specimen analysis, and interpretation of results will contribute to accurate patient diagnoses and effective treatment plans.
Responsibilities :
• Receive and process patient samples, such as blood, urine, sputum, and tissue, for microbiological analysis.
• Follow strict protocols to prevent contamination and ensure accurate results.
• Cultivate and identify microorganisms present in patient samples, such as bacteria, viruses, and fungi.
• Use staining, biochemical tests, and molecular techniques for accurate identification.
• Conduct antibiotic susceptibility tests to determine the most effective treatment options for bacterial infections.
• Diagnose infectious diseases by identifying the causative microorganisms and their characteristics.
• Prepare detailed and accurate reports of laboratory findings, including interpretation of results.
• Share results with healthcare professionals to aid in patient care decisions.
• Maintain quality control measures to ensure accurate and reliable laboratory results.
• Participate in proficiency testing and quality assurance programs.
• Adhere to strict safety protocols and guidelines to prevent laboratory-acquired infections and ensure the safety of personnel.
• Operate and maintain laboratory equipment, ensuring accurate and reliable performance.
• Stay updated on advances in microbiology, diagnostic methods, and technology through ongoing professional development.
• Collaborate with healthcare professionals, clinicians, and other laboratory staff to interpret results and contribute to patient care.
Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in Microbiology, Medical Laboratory Sciences, or a related field. Master's or Ph.D. is advantageous.
• Relevant experience as a Microbiologist in a medical laboratory setting, preferably in the UAE.
• Strong knowledge of microbiological techniques, clinical specimen analysis, and identification methods.
• Understanding of medical microbiology, infectious diseases, and pathogenic microorganisms.
• Proficiency in using laboratory equipment and diagnostic tools.
• Attention to detail and accuracy in handling patient samples and laboratory procedures.
• Effective communication skills for reporting findings and collaborating with healthcare professionals.
• Knowledge of quality control and quality assurance practices in medical microbiology.
• Adherence to laboratory safety protocols and procedures.
• Problem-solving skills for interpreting complex laboratory results.
• Familiarity with laboratory information systems (LIS) and data management.
• Fluency in English; knowledge of additional languages such as Arabic is beneficial.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

-Fantastic work culture
-Opportunity to make a positive impact
-A role that offers a breadth of learning opportunities
Our client is a technology-enabled bus aggregator that empowers fleet owners to make more money by increasing the utilization of their vehicles. They are tackling the 250B$ MENA market for moving people and things. They are growing rapidly working with the largest fleet operators in the region with thousands of vehicles in their supply pool.
The Job
Our client is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Accountant to join their team. As an Accountant, you will play a crucial role in managing their financial operations and reporting processes. Your expertise will be instrumental in converting cash-based accounting to accrual-based, ensuring accurate recording of day-to-day financial transactions, and maintaining compliance with accounting standards and local regulations.
Your responsibilities will include:
Convert cash-based accounting to accrual-based, ensuring accurate and comprehensive financial reporting.
Create invoices and receipts for suppliers and clients, authorized by management, in a timely manner.
Monitor, record, and categorize day-to-day financial transactions, subsequently posting them to appropriate accounts.
Conduct reconciliations of entries, sales, payroll taxes, reports, and general ledger within the accounting system.
Process checks, manage accounts receivable and payable, and execute payroll activities promptly.
Generate monthly, quarterly, and annual profit and loss statements, presenting accurate financial insights to support decision-making.
Record cash receipts, debit and credit entries, and produce financial statements for analysis.
Prepare and maintain all necessary information for the annual audit process.
Develop comprehensive company financial statements and perform thorough financial analyses.
Organize and manage the trial balance and chart of accounts systematically within the accounting filing system.
Offer administrative and clerical support to management, promptly reporting significant financial issues.
Adhere to established accounting policies and procedures to ensure compliance with local regulations and reporting requirements.
Handle VAT returns, including filing, exemptions, calculations, and related activities.
Generate purchase orders for suppliers and clients, ensuring streamlined procurement processes.
Oversee end-to-end management of all accounting functions necessary for operations and comprehensive reporting.
Onboard and proficiently utilize online tools such as Xero or QuickBooks to manage all accounting operations.
Ideal Candidate
We d Love To Meet If You Have
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field. CPA certification is a plus.
Proven experience in financial accounting, with a strong understanding of accrual-based principles and financial reporting.
Proficiency in using accounting software such as Xero, QuickBooks, or similar tools.
Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in financial data management.
Solid understanding of local tax regulations, reporting standards, and compliance requirements.
Effective communication skills to liaise with cross-functional teams and report financial information accurately.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to identify and address financial discrepancies.
Organizational skills to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.
High level of integrity and confidentiality when dealing with sensitive financial information.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, adapting to changing priorities.
Work Here If You re
Driven, accountable, humble and honest to the point.
A collaborative team player and can mediate differences in opinion.
Communicate ideas in an articulate manner with your team, technical and non-technical audiences through written, oral and presentation mediums.
Open to trying different approaches to arrive at the best possible solution.
Able to accept and adapt quickly and constructively to change.
Keen to learn and self-improve.
Inclined towards making work simple and organized.
Able to easily switch between thinking creatively and analytically.
It Is natural to understand and share our users emotions.
A big dreamer with guts to get into the unknown.
Ref: YMFUZLCJIG

IM & CMMS Scope Of Work:
• Ensure contractor has submitted IM delivery plan for all projects.
• Develop all document and data management procedure.
• Develop and agree all standards, systems, handover requirements and close out activities of Information Management with engineering and Operations.

Experiences:-

• MS Excel advanced
• Good at perpetration of reporting
• Skilled in CMMS activities
• Good communication
• Training the resources
• Ability to write and update IM related procedures.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

• Requirements & Summary
Company : Weatherford
Skills : Operations Management
Experience : 6 + Years
Education : Bachelors/3-5 yr Degree
Location : Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
Overview
Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.
We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.
Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.
When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger - a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each other's successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.
Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provides you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.
Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
Responsibilities
• Lead & work closely with GEO Zone Business Manager, Key Customer Accounts & Sales Managers to conduct RTDS business strategy across MENA GEO Zone. Delivering on revenue, margin & growth initiative for the RTDS sub product line.
• Develop deep understanding of RTDS / CENTRO / Well Construction Optimization Software solutions including competitive landscape, business development opportunities and contribute to CENTRO product roadmap including knowledge of engineering and KPIs requirements.
• Lead & accountability for BSA (Project Financial / Tendering approval process) and drive Target Pricing & Cost Optimization for respectively for all opportunities.
• of and offerings to scenario of other Line in the BSA Approval and establishing minimum acceptable GM to capture market share. (Case specific, but the lowest we can go, before reaching out to you and global)
• Lead the teams of all projects managers delivering RTDS projects with key GEOZONE Customers and responsible for sharing best practices, execution issues, raising technical & product performance issues with global stake holders. Represent Weatherford Digital lead in front of Customer stakeholders.
• GEOZONE lead for business case development for solving Customer current drilling & downhole issues by using ML/ AI techniques.
• Responsible for proactive hiring of RTDC (Real Time Data Centre Operators), SME and RTDS Technical Consultant to drive project delivery & Centro deployment execution and closely work with RTDS Centre of Excellence in Mumbai & Huston. Working closely with Country HR leads to retaining key talent & proactive engagement.
• Responsible for driving customer & internal team & sales training, enhanced user experience and respective career path & progressions roadmap for the MENA RTDS team.
• Lead and closely work with marketing, country accounts & digital solutions peers for trade conferences, customer roadshows & customer product demo & trials.
CENTRO key features: CENTRO is Weatherford's new state-of-the-art digital well delivery solution . This innovative solution goes beyond transferring information between the rig and the office. It embodies the evolution of digital data services, integrating cutting-edge data management, visualization, and real time engineering technologies. Bring an integrated, real-time environment with enhanced user experience to your asset team. The Centro well construction optimization platform eliminates the struggle of gathering, consolidating, and processing data from multiple sources, to deliver immediate value to your organization.
Featuring advanced visualization capabilities, Centro facilitates collaboration within asset teams, boosts productivity, and results in more informed decisions. This end-to-end solution helps customers to leverage software intelligence and digital process-automation to better achieve cost savings.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
Essentials:
• Bachelor/master's degree in petroleum engineering/ relevant engineering from a recognized university
• Minimum 6-10 years functional experience in similar roles and multination set-up.
Preferred:
• Consultative selling and or Consulting experience related to design, implementation or monitoring of a digital oil field solution.
• Experience in working for Real Time Data Services and Drilling Optimization Software Solutions
• Post Graduate Degree in Engineering/ Computer Sciences/ Petroleum Engineering and Management.
Knowledge & Skills Sets:
Essentials

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Job Description: Frontend Engineer (Nuxt.js/Vue.js - PWA Development)
We are looking for a talented Frontend Engineer to join our team and contribute to the development of our cutting-edge Progressive Web App (PWA). As a Frontend Engineer, you will play a key role in designing and implementing the user interface of our PWA using Nuxt.js and Vue.js. You will collaborate closely with the backend team and UX/UI designers to create a seamless, responsive, and engaging user experience.
Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
- Design and implement the frontend architecture, user interface, and interactivity of our PWA using Nuxt.js and Vue.js.
- Develop responsive and scalable web applications that adhere to PWA principles, ensuring an optimal user experience across different devices and platforms.
- Implement efficient state management using Vuex, providing a robust foundation for data management and application logic.
- Optimize the performance of the PWA, focusing on fast load times, smooth animations, and seamless navigation.
- Collaborate with UX/UI designers to ensure a visually appealing and intuitive user interface, following best practices for usability and accessibility.
- Write clean, modular, and maintainable code, following industry best practices and coding standards.
- Conduct thorough testing and debugging of the frontend code to ensure high-quality and bug-free deliverables.
- Stay up-to-date with the latest frontend development trends, techniques, and best practices, and apply them to improve our PWA.
- Collaborate with the backend team to integrate frontend components with the API endpoints and ensure smooth data flow.
- Participate in code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and continuously improve the code quality and development processes.
Requirements:
- Proven experience as a Frontend Engineer, with expertise in Nuxt.js and Vue.js.
- Strong understanding of web technologies, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
- Experience in developing Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) and knowledge of PWA principles and best practices.
- Proficiency in frontend frameworks like Nuxt.js and Vue.js, including components, routing, state management (Vuex), and server-side rendering (SSR).
- Familiarity with RESTful APIs and asynchronous data handling.
- Strong knowledge of responsive design principles and mobile-first development.
- Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development workflows.
- Solid understanding of software development principles, including testing, debugging, and code optimization.
- Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality, user-centric frontend solutions.
- Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to translate complex requirements into elegant solutions.
- Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Preferred Skills:
- Experience in working with UX/UI designers to create visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces.
- Knowledge of frontend build tools like Webpack and module bundlers.
- Familiarity with frontend testing frameworks such as Jest or Cypress.
- Understanding of backend technologies and API integrations.
- Familiarity with CSS preprocessors like Sass or Less.
- Experience with performance optimization techniques for web applications.
If you are passionate about frontend development, have a strong understanding of Nuxt.js, Vue.js, and Progressive Web App development, and enjoy working in a collaborative environment, we would love to hear from you. Join us in building innovative PWAs that deliver exceptional user experiences!
Please include your portfolio or links to relevant projects showcasing your frontend development expertise along with your application

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Asset Management Engineering Expert
Location: Qatar
Salary: 35000 QR - 45000 QR/M
Experience: Minimum Bachelors degree in civil engineering
1.Up to 19 years of cumulative experience in a relevant field (Master s degree)2
2,Up to 20 years of cumulative experience in a relevant field (Bachelor s degree)
Language: Arabic / English
Overview of the Job
The Senior Asset Management Engineering Expert is responsible for the management of activities related to the delivery of long-term Asset Management (AM) strategy, standardized Asset Management Plans for Catchment Zones, investments, policies and procedures across a diverse range of asset portfolios and Framework Contracts to align with the overall strategic objective of Assets Affairs
Key Responsibilities
Operational Responsibilities
1.Assist in the development of the Department s Annual Business Plan, as well as the Section s Performance Objectives and ensure the alignment of activities.
2.Embed asset management related change due to Catchment Zone Framework, driving standardisation and process compliance.
3.Develop Assets Affairs asset management policy, strategy and standards to support Framework Contractors to develop AM Plans accordingly.
4.Provide and utilise appropriate financial and risk-based frameworks to drive asset management decision making and ensure delivery of the required service performance.
5.Oversee the development of policy and strategy for asset information and core asset systems such as SCADA, Work Management, EAMS, investment prioritization and deterioration tools.
6.Manage multiple stakeholder relationships to ensure asset strategy is appropriate, understood, upheld and maintained (i.e. Infrastructure Affairs, Procurement and Contract Management and Heads of Section).
7.Develop, implement and monitor a plan that ensures Assets Affairs is aligned with ISO55000 requirements.
8.Manage AM capability, develop, recommend and implement agreed areas of continuous improvement.
9.Keep up to date with current and future asset management strategy and provide recommendations for improvements, share knowledge with colleagues and train team members.
10.Undertake site visit for resolution of issues, data verification and checks.
11.Support the Section and Department in Emergency management such as rainy season activities including attendance at Emergency Control Centre (ECC) and/or site.
12.Assist Asset Management Advisor/ Expert in the implementation of applicable policies, procedures, and processes.
13.Keep current with latest market trends and developments, and stay abreast with current trends and leading practices in Asset Management
14.Keep the Head of Engineering Services Section informed of significant issues that may jeopardize the achievement of Ashghal goals.
Perform other duties / tasks as required

Not Applicable

Project Affairs, PQD, PTO

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities

Missions
The corporate security expert plays an essential role in defining and evaluating the company's strategy, but also in reviewing IT security models and security practices. Group IT.
• He has an understanding of all security requirements for the company.
• The corporate security expert provides his expertise to define security requirements, select, implement and test security systems, and prepare security policies and procedures.
• Finally, he/she shares his/her expertise during internal and external events.
• She/He supports the professions as they mature so that they comply with the bank's IT security requirements.
MAIN ACTIVITIES:
• The corporate security expert can work on all or part of the following activities.
• Analyzes the security risks of technologies (data security, identity and access security, cloud), security tools and services, evaluates their impacts and makes recommendations.
• Monitors and validates IT infrastructure and other reference architectures in accordance with Group IT security standards, recommends changes to improve IT security and reduce IT risks, where appropriate.
• Collaborates with the Group's technical architects and security team to share best practices in terms of IT security Collaborates with the business continuity management (BCM) team to validate IT security practices for BCM tests and operations in the event of a switchover.
• Facilitates threat modeling of services and applications with regard to identified IT risks and associated data management.
• Oversees testing and validation of internal security controls as directed by the CISO or internal audit team.
• Contributes to the writing and updating of IT security procedures and standards at the request of the CISO (Group or entity) Participates in the writing or validation of IT risk analysis for the entity Participates in the production of technical POC on emerging and innovative IT security solutions.
• Contributes to the development of the Group's Cyber Security community by communicating and sharing the technology monitoring studies carried out.
Profile

Business skills: IT security and Cyber security - Anticipation of risk - Ability to decide/give a risk opinion - Safety and security.
Tools - Methodologies - Technologies: As an indication, adapt to the context/specialty - Good knowledge of the main IT risk & security frameworks NIST, CIS, ISO27001, EBIOS.

Job Description
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Job Profile: Migration Specialist
Position Overview:
We are seeking a highly experienced and knowledgeable Migration Specialist to join our team. You will provide expert advice and assistance to clients seeking to relocate or migrate to a new country or region. You will navigate the complexities of immigration and ensure a smooth transition for our clients and will be responsible for managing complex migration cases, staying up-to-date with immigration laws and regulations, and ensuring compliance with all relevant procedures. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in the industry, excellent communication skills, and a strong understanding of global immigration policies.

Responsibilities:
Consultation: Provide initial consultations to clients to understand their specific migration needs and goals. Assess their eligibility for different immigration programs, visas, or permits.
Documentation: Assist clients in gathering and preparing all necessary documents and paperwork required for the migration process. This may involve legal documents, identification papers, financial records, and other relevant paperwork.
Application Processing: Prepare and submit migration applications on behalf of clients to the relevant immigration authorities or agencies. Ensure that all required information is accurate, complete, and submitted within specified deadlines.
Compliance and Regulations: Stay up-to-date with immigration laws, policies, and regulations of different countries. Ensure that clients are aware of the latest requirements and comply with the rules throughout the migration process.

Communication: Act as a liaison between clients and immigration authorities, keeping clients informed about the progress of their applications, any changes in regulations, and any additional information required.
Problem-Solving: Handle any issues or complications that may arise during the migration process. Find solutions to overcome obstacles and provide guidance to clients on the best course of action.
Client Support: Offer ongoing support and assistance to clients during the migration process and upon arrival in the new country. This may include providing information about housing, education, healthcare, and other essential services.
Collaboration: Collaborate with other immigration professionals, such as lawyers, to ensure that clients receive comprehensive and accurate advice.
Data Management: Maintain detailed records of clients' applications, documents, and communications to ensure efficient case management.
Ethical Standards: Uphold ethical and professional standards while handling sensitive client information and adhering to confidentiality protocols.

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Law, International Relations, or a related field (preferred).
More than 4 yrs experience working as a Migration consultant preferably in a leadership role.
In-depth knowledge of immigration laws, regulations, and procedures, both domestic and international.
Strong understanding of various immigration programs, including temporary visas, permanent residence, and citizenship.
Ability to work independently, manage multiple cases simultaneously, and meet deadlines.
Professional certifications or memberships related to immigration consulting.
